1044639493847.summary: #career direction #career switch #career transition #youth #talking #therapy #fellow seekers The case for the client: The Job Search journey for someone who is retrenched or seeking new path can be a tough one. As people explained online, it's like falling into an abyss or a void. People head in multiple directions, trying to find one that work. But the haphazard search depletes one of his vital energies. The focus becomes very scattered, and growth is impeded. Talking Therapy: 1) Topic include: (a) Health & Wellness, (b) Career Direction. Personality profiling tools. Career direction modalities/ tools. Personal experience/ insights. Stories and advice, heard. 3) Sharing about "modalities" - models etc that help with finding career direction, such as new age Feng Shui (mindset toolkit + meditation ), Ikigai concepts (adapted ), Questions to ask ourselves, True Colors profiling (motivation based ). An alternative date, maybe suggested. ############ We will be meeting at a cafe in 111 Somerset. (Eg. Han's etc.)
1044639493847.description: Our main mission is to provide a non- judging audience. We help assist you to uncover your unique talent (and mission). 1st trial
1044639493847.title: Career Consultation/ Networking. Lending a listening ear. (Group Session)

1022309845267.summary: Welcome to BASH Bi-Monthly Breakfast Meet! Join Us for Another Inspiring Breakfast Networking Event! Are you a solopreneur or small business owner looking to connect, collaborate, and elevate your business strategies? Dont miss our exclusive breakfast networking event designed just for you! Event: Breakfast Networking for Solopreneurs and Small Business Owners Date: 18th October Time: 8:30 a.m. Venue: 47 Kallang Pudding Road (unit number will be sent to you upon registration) Fee: SGD 35 (Includes a delicious breakfast; all proceeds go to charity after covering food and beverage costs) Focus: Dynamic Brainstorming and Masterminding Sessions Hot Seat Speaker: Collin Chee Founder of Spikes of Love & Professional Emcee Title: Feeling Alive on Stage! Discovering Passion at any Age Collin Chee, now in midlife, will share his personal journey of rediscovering passion and purpose. He will talk about how he feels alive on stage, embracing new energy and meaning in his career as a professional emcee. This inspiring session will give you fresh insights into reigniting your own sense of purpose, no matter where you are in life or business. Join us for a morning of inspiration, innovation, and impactful networking. Dont miss this opportunity to gain fresh insights, build valuable connections, and unlock new growth potential for your business. Who can you expect to connect with at this network: HR Specialists, Accounting Specialist, Interior Designer, Life Coach, Maid Agency Owner, Durian Event Specialist, Eco-living Specialist, Corporate Gift Specialist and more.

1022309845267.title: BASH Bi-Monthly Breakfast Meet

1036669324857.summary: Join us for an empowering and reflective community Thrive: Women Empowerment Circle. Our very first meetup is called Reconnection & Reflection. This intimate gathering will foster connection, self-reflection, and forward planning in a supportive and nurturing environment. We are all living in a busy era, and day in and day out, we are focusing on doing rather than being. Because of that, at times, we lose sight of great things & connections that we have achieved or failed to give enough time to acknowledge setbacks or even give ourselves enough rest that we deserve. With our very first meeting - Reconnection & Reflection , we will hold a space for one another, allowing us to jot down and reflect on how life has been for us in 2024 and what energy and experiences we want to have in 2025. Reflection & Reconnection Meetup Date & Time : 26 Oct 2024, 11AM - 12.30 PM Location: @strangerconvos -195 Pearl's Hill Terrace. Nearest MRT: Chinatown Fee: $18/ pax What to expect in the session - Expand your social network & get to know other like minded women Establish healthy habits through meditation which help you to stay centered & grounded for the days ahead Gain understanding & appreciations on your wins & setbacks and understand what it takes to embrace your life with gratitude Discover methods & techniques in Visualisation Learn ways to prioritise your life and give space for what truly matters We look forward to seeing you there and creating a space of connection, reflection, and growth together! About Thrive - Women Empowerment Circle Thrive - Women Empowerment Circle is created as a social space for women to meet and connect regularly (both offline and online), with themes focusing on Self-Love, Self-Development, Wellness, Connection, and much more. If youre interested in being part of Thrive, join our Facebook group to stay updated on upcoming events - https://www.facebook.com/share/g/P58WUxFNZhAkM749/ Thrive is created by Tiffany Nguyen, an Image Consultant & Holistic Personal Coach. She is a founder of Living Well With Tiffany, a personal development platform helping women to thrive and grow into the best version of themselves, with the focus on Appearance, Behaviour, Communication & Emotional Balance.
1036669324857.description: This intimate gathering will foster connection, self-reflection, and forward planning in a supportive and nurturing environment.
1036669324857.title: Women Empowerment Group - Reconnection & Reflection Meetup

890799383937.summary: What our Pawdiatric Partners programme is about The journey of a caregiver can be challenging and isolating. Through this programme, we strive to improve the mental and emotional well-being of both patients and caregivers by involving our special Caring Canines. Who is this programme for? This programme is designed for patients and caregivers of KKH. Individuals with the following are not allowed to participate in this programme for health and safety reasons: those with non-intact skin on their hands patients on the bone marrow transplant service patients under isolation precautions those lacking parental or guardian consent patients with allergies or severe fear of dogs INPATIENTS - You are required to obtain consent from your doctor before attending this event. The consent forms can be obtained from the nurses station. How can I join the session? To ensure the welfare of our Caring Canines, they will be on duty at KKH for one hour per session. Each hour will be divided into three 20-minute slots, and participants can sign up for one slot. There are only 15 spaces available per slot. While walk-ins are permitted, space is limited, and priority will be given to ticket holders. Please be aware that a separate ticket is necessary for each child and caregiver, meaning two tickets are required for a caregiver-child pair. When and where can you find our dogtors at KKH? Venue : Womens Tower B1 podium (near the taxi stand) Time : 4pm - 5pm Session dates (Tickets will be made available 1 week before the session date) : 19 April 3 May 17 May 24 May 7 June 21 June 5 July 19 July 2 August 16 August 30 August 13 September
890799383937.description: Join us for an exclusive canine-assisted program tailored for patients and caregivers at KK Women's and Children Hospital!
890799383937.title: Pawdiatric Partners

938496096087.summary: BNI Crescendo Singapore is a business networking group established in 2006. Made up of over 50 committed business owners and sales professionals from various trades and industries, members work together to pass referral business and explore new opportunities. Our Chapter members represent trades from sectors such as Finance, Legal, Business Solutions, Marketing & Events, IT & Technology, Health & Wellness, Building & Real Estate and more. STANDARD OF EXCELLENCE BNI Crescendo takes pride in being professional and upholding a standard of excellence. While we are serious about creating business through networking, we also take care to mentor and support new members through their BNI journey. AWARD WINNING CHAPTER Led by committed members, BNI Crescendo continues to be a leading high performance chapter in Singapore. We are a proud recipient of the following awards: 2015, 2016, 2017: BNI Singapore Chapter of the Year Award (3 consecutive years) 2018: Titanium Chapter Award 2020, 2021: BNI Singapore Chapter of the Year, Bronze Award 2022- Top 3 Chapter with the Highest Referrals 2023- Top 3 Chapter with the Highest % of Green Performing Members 2024- Top 3 Chapter with Highest Growth We track our performance in terms of referrals passed, done deal value, retention and attendance. WHY VISIT US? Visit us to give yourself the chance to: Experience the dynamism of our membership, Learn how referral marketing can be a sustainable business marketing strategy for your business; Network and develop long lasting business relationships with us; Create the opportunity for collaboration; and Witness real business growth via referrals. WHAT TO EXPECT To maximise your experience, please join us early at our weekly open networking sessions which begin promptly at 7.30am. Our official meeting ends by 10.30am. Visitors are invited to join us for lunch for further networking. PHOTOGRAPHY AND RECORDING NOTICE Photography and/or audio and video recording may occur when you attend or participate in the events and activities. By attending or participating in our events and activities, you consent to interview(s), photography, and/or audio and video recording, and its/their release, publication, exhibition and/or reproduction to be used for the purpose of marketing and promotions (audio and video production, publication and/or website). **Important: If you do not wish to be photographed or recorded, please contact and inform the Leadership Team or organiser of the event or activity to withdraw your consent.
938496096087.description: We are a business network with business owners focusing on relationship building and referrals passing.
938496096087.event_address: 45 Tg Rhu Road Level 2, Fort Room, Singapore, 436899
938496096087.title: Business Networking (BNI Crescendo)

1001676791247.summary: I am pleased to invite you and your team to the Spatial Biology Congress taking place on November 21-22, 2024 at NTU@One-North , Singapo re . This year's event is co-hosted by the Genome Institute of Singapore (GIS) and Global Engage. The congress will feature a diverse range of topics including spatial omics technologies, imaging technologies, AI and data science, disease mechanisms, diagnostics, drug discovery, and emerging trends. In addition to the scientific program, the event will offer numerous opportunities for collaboration and networking. For CONFERENCE BROCHURE click kere Key Highlights: 20+ speakers from academia and industry experts Case studies from across variety of contexts Interactive panel discussions session Early career researchers and poster exhibition to promote scientific development Networking opportunities Meet the Scientific Committee: Shyam Prabhakar , Associate Director and Senior Group Leader, Genome Institute of Singapore (GIS), A*STAR Grace Yeo Hui Ting , GIS and BII Fellow, Genome Institute of Singapore (GIS) and Bioinformatics Institute (BII), A*STAR Ashraful Haque , Laboratory Head and Team Leader, The Peter Doherty Institute for Infection & Immunity, University of Melbourne Jonathan Loh Yuin-Han , Deputy Executive Director, and Research Director, Institute of Molecular and Cell Biology (IMCB), A*STAR Kylie James , Laboratory Head, Garvan Institute of Medical Research, University of New South Wales Attending a Spatial Biology Scientific Conference provides numerous benefits: Cutting-Edge Research : Stay updated on advancements in spatial multi-omics and emerging technologies. Networking : Connect with experts, researchers, and industry professionals for collaborations and partnerships. Application Insights : Learn about spatial biology's role in clinical research and interdisciplinary fields. Hands-On Learning : Engage in workshops and case studies to boost your skills. Emerging Trends : Gain insights into future trends and discuss regulatory and ethical challenges. Collaboration and Funding : Explore cross-institutional collaborations and funding opportunities. Visibility and Recognition : Present your work, enhance your profile, and earn awards. Publication : Presentations at scientific conferences often lead to publications in conference proceedings or special issues of academic journals. The prices per delegate are as follows. Individual Bookings Academia/ NFP/ Industry - USD 350 Register by using the code ns5_sb24 for a 5% discount. For registration please sign up here I am eager to find out if this would be of interest to you and your company . I would very much appreciate hearing your thoughts and I look forward to receiving your response, for group registration please email me. With best wishes, ............................................................................................ Nidhi | BD- Director | Global Engage Ltd P: +60327790098 E: nidhi@global-engage.com
1001676791247.description: Use the code ns5_sb24 for a 5% discount on Global Engage website
1001676791247.venue_name: Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine (LKCMedicine)
1001676791247.title: Spatial Biology Congress Asia | Use the code ns5_sb24 for a 5% discount

1008156883377.summary: Join us at the 3rd Clinical Trials Festival Festival Asia on 12 - 13 March 2025 at Marina Bay Sands, Singapore, where industry leaders come together to address the evolving challenges of clinical trials. CTFA 2025 is proudly celebrating its successful third year as the region's leading event for clinical trials and research leaders. Building upon the resounding success of our inaugural conference, we are thrilled to bring together industry experts once again to explore cutting-edge insights and advancements in the field. Join us as we delve into crucial topics shaping clinical trials, from protocol design to decentralized trials and effective trial management. This event offers valuable insights, networking opportunities, and collaboration to improve drug discovery and translation, ultimately benefiting patient outcomes. Asia's potential in clinical research takes center stage, with countries like Singapore, South Korea, and Australia becoming attractive hubs for international drugmakers. The conference provides a pivotal platform for discussing partnerships, regulations, patient engagement, and digital strategies, while exploring advancements in medical imaging. Our goal is to foster collaborations, share best practices, and explore innovative solutions to enhance trial efficiency and impact in the region.
1008156883377.description: Asias Only Clinical Trials Conference for Biologics, Cell and Gene Therapy, and Vaccines, Uniting Clinical Trials Leaders
1008156883377.venue_name: Sands Expo & Convention Centre, Marina Bay Sands Singapore
1008156883377.title: 3rd Clinical Trials Festival Asia 2025 (NON-APAC Biopharma/Academic)

932385519187.summary: Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS) and Real Estate Developers Association (REDAS) are excited to partner again on the 2024 conference - Net Zero Carbon Cities: Dream or Reality. Running for its 7th year, the upgraded "Net Zero Carbon Cities: Dream or Reality" conference will address the challenges and demands of creating sustainable cities. As cities around Southeast Asia face the dual challenge of urbanization and climate change, Singapores commitment to the Green Plan 2030 serves as a beacon for innovation and strategic development in resilient infrastructure, green buildings, and sustainable transport systems. Joined by industry leaders, city planners, investors, practioners and policymakers, the conference will cover insights into sustainability strategies, regulatory requirements, and opportunities to drive organisations toward a net zero future. *6 CPD points applicable for all RICS member attendees. For more details, please visit our website here . Conference programme 08:15 Registration 08:50 Opening by Conference Chair Ren Hillig MRICS, Managing Director Head of Project & Programme Management Southeast Asia, Asia Infrastructure Solutions 09:00 Welcome Remarks by REDAS Tan Swee Yiow, President, REDAS 09:05 Welcome Remarks by RICS Tina Paillet FRICS, President, RICS 09:10 Guest of Honour Speech Dr Amy Khor, Senior Minister of State, Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment Ministry of Transport 09:20 MOU Signing Ceremony with The Architectural Society of Shanghai China (ASSC) 09:30 Session 1 Special Presentation - Planning for Liveable and Resilient City Hugh Lim, Executive Director, Centre for Liveable Cities, Ministry of National Development, Singapore 09:50 Session 2 Keynote Presentation Low Carbon and Sustainable Operations in Commercial Spaces & Launch of Joint White Paper with RICS & Tongji University Mo Fan, Chairman, Cushman & Wakefield Vanke Service 10:20 Session 3 Plenary Speaker Innovations in Net Zero Carbon Building Lifecycle Yoon Young Kim, Cluster President, Singapore & Brunei, Schneider Electric 10:50 Break 11:10 Session 4 Panel Discussion Electrifying Transportation: The Road Ahead for EVs and AVs Moderator: Tom Bennett, Principal Consultant, Paia from CBRE Panelists: Chee Kiong Goh, CEO, Charge+ Tony Chan, Planning Business Leader Southeast Asia, Arup Zarith Sofia Magad, Technical Director, Transport Planning, Mott MacDonald Hong Kian Lim, Executive Director Urban Development (Asia) Executive Director, Residential ( Asia), Surbana Jurong 11:55 Session 5 Panel Discussion AI and Digital Transformation for Net Zero Carbon Cities Moderator: Bennett Wong, Associate Director, RSM Singapore Panelists: Denis Branthonne, Co-Founder & CEO, Novade Dr Lee Nai Jia, Head of Real Estate Intelligence Unit, PropertyGuru Group Bill Lee, Founder, CEO, Azendian Solutions Private Limited Derek Del Novo, Head Digital & Software, Siemens Smart Infrastructure, Buildings 12:40 Luncheon 13:35 Session 6 Panel Discussion - Shaping the Future Workforce: Skills, Technology, and Upskilling Moderator: Istilah Abali MRICS, Director, Cost Management, Turner &Townsend Panelists: Esther An, Chief Sustainability Officer, City Developments Limited Joseph Ooi, Co-Director, Institute of Real Estate and Urban Studies, National University of Singapore Adeline Liew, Head of Employee Experience and Services, Group Corporate Real Estate, DBS Bank Alan Goh, Chief Executive Officer, CPG Facilities Management 14:20 Session 7 Panel Discussion Valuing Sustainability: ESG in Real Estate Valuations and Financing Moderator: Jovi Ho, Assistant Editor, The Edge Singapore Panelists: Lia Nicholson, Head of Sustainability, Terrascope Christine Li, Head of Research, Knight Frank Asia Pacific Jasper Wong, Managing Director, Head of Real Estate & Hospitality and Construction & Infrastructure, United Overseas Bank Ross McQuillan, Associate Director - Asset Management ,M&G Real Estate 15:05 Break 15:25 Session 8 Panel Discussion - Leasing Reimagined: Navigating New Frontiers in Real Estate Leasing Moderator: Samantha Tan, General Manager, South Beach Consortium Panelists: Sally Tan, Senior Managing Director, Head of Client Solutions, Savills Singapore Jerry Tan, Partner, WongPartnership Desmond Sim, CEO, Edmund Tie & Company (Southeast Asia) Pte Ltd Anshul Jain, Chief Executive, India & Southeast Asia Head of APAC Tenant Representation, Cushman & Wakefield 16:10 Session 9 Plenary Speaker Climate Resilience and Adaptation: Building Sustainable Cities Dr Deven Chhaya, Partner, Infrastructure Advisory, KPMG in Singapore 16:40 Closing Remarks Tony Osude, Chief Market Delivery Officer, RICS 16:45 Conference End

1023087892427.summary: The world produces enough food to feed 1.5 times the global population, so why are people still hungry? Learn how to start your own cause-driven projects, contribute to a food sustainable world,and embark on virtual visits to World Visions innovative development projects in Timor Leste and discover how we transform the lives of children and families in the most vulnerable of places. Let the stories shared by our guest speaker, humanitarian field staff, and youth changemakers inspire you to work towards a hunger-free world! Ticket sales end 29 Nov 2024. F or more information, visit www.worldvision.org.sg/youthforchangeconference

911082571497.summary: 2024 2nd Power Electronics and Power System Conference (PEPSC 2024) Nov. 6 to 9, 2024| Nanyang Technological University, Singapore https://www.pepsc.org/ 2024 2nd Power Electronics and Power System Conference (PEPSC 2024) is co-organized by University of Electronic Science and Technology of China and Hong Kong Society of Mechanical Engineers(HKSME), technical Sponsored by IEEE PES Singapore chapter, supported by Nanyang Technological University, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Hangzhou Dianzi University, media supported by Electric Machines and Control, Proceedings of the CSEE, CSEE Journal of Power and Energy Systems(CSEE JPES), Automation of Electric Power Systems, New Type Power Systems, Power System Protection and Control, Protection and Control of Modern Power Systems, Power system Technology, High Voltage Engineering, Power Generation Technology,High Voltage, Electric Power Information and Communication Technology, Electrical Power Engineering Technology, CPSS Transactions on Power Electronics and Applications(CPSS TPEA), Journal of Power Supply,Nanfang Nengyuan Jianshe and Neimenggu Dianli Jianshe, which will be held at Nanyang Technological University in Singapore from Nov. 6 to 9, 2024. The theme of PEPSC 2024 is "Digital, Intelligent Power Conversion and New Power System". This conference is aimed at providing a platform for all researchers and engineers to share ideas, highly developed skills and successful practices to others. The conference will last for 3 days with the reception to be held on the first day to meet and mingle with conference chairs, session chairs and other participants. We would like to invite you to join us in this important event and share your recent advance development and research finding in Power Electronics and Power System to all attendees. Besides, it is also a good opportunity for you and your family to enjoy the culture and view in Singapore. We are looking forward to seeing you in PEPSC 2024. Publication and Indexing (1)All the accepted and presented papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE XploreISBN: 979-8-3503-9019-3 subject to meeting IEEE Xplores scope and quality requirements. The publisher will submit articles to Engineering Village, Scopus, Web of Science and other databases for review and indexing after publication. (2)Selected papers(accepted and presented) with great extension will be recommended to publish in Special Issue of electronics (ISSN 2079-9292): "Advances in Power System Dynamics, Stability, Control and Dispatch with Large-Scale Renewable Energy Penetrated" after conference. Topics 1. Power Electronics Topology and Control 2. Wind and solar storage power electronics 3. Power electronics for power transmission and distribution 4. Transportation electrification power electronics 5. Data center power electronics 6. Power electronic devices 7. Control, modeling, simulation 8. System stability and reliability 9. Renewable energy conversion technology and new energy storage 10. New power system 11. Smart grid and energy Submission Electronic Submission System: https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/PEPSC2024 E-mail: info@pepsc.org Notice 1) Manuscripts must be written in English; 2) The manuscript should be written in accordance with the standard of template; 3) The topics of paper should be relevant to conference topics; 4) Plagiarism and Duplicate submission are prohibited; 5) Innovation and scientific value is a must. Call for participants 1,Presenter: If you are interested in giving presentation on conference, without publishing your paper in the proceeding, you need to submit the abstract and title of your presentation to us: info@pepsc.org 2,Listener: If you are interested in attending the conference to participant this gathering on the field above you are welcome to join us and share your ideas! 3,Reviewer: Experts in the area of power electronics and power systems are welcome to join the conference as reviewer. Contact Ms. Amber Cao Phone:s+852-30506862 Cell Phone: 18200296850 E-mail: info@pepsc.org / ambercao@smehk.org Website: https://www.pepsc.org/
911082571497.description: 2024 2nd Power Electronics and Power System Conference will be held at Nanyang Technological University in Singapore from Nov. 6 to 9, 2024.
911082571497.title: 2024 2nd Power Electronics and Power System Conference

957025929317.summary: TRANSFORMING POSSIBILITIES INTO REALITIES AI now stands as a pivotal game-changing technology that impacts us all. Recent breakthroughs in AI have sparked renewed interest in its potential, risks, and implications for humanity. While AI has primarily been about pattern recognition, future advancements will bring systems with human-level cognitive abilities, fundamentally reshaping our way of life with profound implications for societies everywhere PM Lawrence Wong Artificial intelligence (AI) is no longer a future concept, but rather a present-day reality that is transforming industries and society throughout the globe. Singapore, with its forward-thinking policies and strategic initiatives, is leading the way in this shift. AI is crucial for Singapores ambitions, enhancing efficiency, innovation and competitiveness. Singapore's push for innovation relies on its capacity to leverage data. AI's ability to analyse vast datasets yields valuable insights, driving the development of new products and services. This data-driven approach not only creates new business opportunities but also improves customer experiences. Agility and vision are essential for staying competitive in a globalised economy. AI gives Singaporean businesses the predictive power to improve supply chains, streamline decision-making procedures, and predict market trends with unique precision. By taking a proactive stance, organisations can stay ahead of the curve and quickly adjust to changing market conditions. AI's importance extends beyond economic gains to advancing sustainable development goals. It optimises energy utilisation and lowers waste by deploying resource-efficient apps, resulting in much lower environmental footprints. Smart grids and AI-driven logistics are great examples of how simplified processes may increase energy efficiency and reduce carbon emissions. This emphasises AI's critical role in creating a more sustainable future for the entire world. Singapore's commitment to AI is demonstrated by strong government support and forward-thinking policies. The new National AI Strategy and Model AI Governance Framework provide a comprehensive framework for ethical AI development. This enabling ecosystem promotes responsible innovation and ensures that AI deployment is consistent with ethical standards and societal well-being. As attendees gather at the AI Summit, Singapore's AI journey unfolds, demonstrating the country's steadfast commitment to leveraging technology for societal advancement. Singapore lays the groundwork for a future where AI acts as an accelerator for equitable growth and global leadership by enhancing efficiency, fostering innovation, boosting competitiveness, promoting sustainability, and empowering its workforce. The Singapore Gen AI Revolution Summit 2024 brings together industry leaders, innovators, and visionaries from the enterprise, finance, and public sectors to explore the newest AI developments and applications.
957025929317.description: 19 November 2024 8.00 am - 4.00 pm Singapore Standard Time
957025929317.title: Singapore Gen AI Revolution Summit 2024

883832114647.summary: Understanding Green Financing, Risk, Profit, and Purpose - TGS-2024043800 In today's rapidly evolving global landscape, the imperative for sustainable investments has never been more pronounced. As investors and financial institutions increasingly recognize the critical importance of integrating environmental considerations into their decision-making frameworks, this course emerges as a timely and indispensable resource. Designed to furnish participants with a comprehensive toolkit, it navigates the intricate terrain of green financing, empowering individuals to comprehend the associated risks and challenges while embracing the broader ethos of sustainable finance. Throughout the duration of this course, participants will embark on a journey towards a profound understanding of the concepts and principles underpinning green financing and its intricate relationship with sustainability. Delving into the multifaceted facets of green investment and the overarching objectives of sustainable finance, each module serves as a stepping stone towards enhanced comprehension and proficiency. By exploring foundational concepts in green financing and dissecting the four cardinal elements of sustainable finance - finance, governance, social, and environmental - participants will acquire invaluable insights and expertise. Guided by a meticulously curated curriculum, participants will traverse through modules delineating critical topics such as the Introduction to Green Financing, Relationships between Green Investment & Sustainability, Sustainable Finance Asset Class & Investment Strategy, and Sustainable Investment Trends & Challenges. With each module, individuals will hone the requisite knowledge and skills imperative for navigating the dynamic landscape of sustainable finance. Empowered with the ability to identify, assess, and capitalize on opportunities in green financing, participants will develop a nuanced understanding of associated risks and challenges, thereby emerging as discerning and adept practitioners in the realm of sustainable finance. By journey's end, participants will emerge equipped with the acumen to make well-informed investment decisions, catalyze positive environmental and social outcomes, and spearhead transformative change within the financial sector towards a more sustainable future. Moreover, participants will gain invaluable insights into the diverse array of stakeholders comprising the sustainable finance ecosystem, thereby fostering enhanced collaboration and synergy towards shared objectives. Yes, this course is IBF-funded! The IBF Standards Training Scheme (IBF-STS) provides funding for training and assessment programmes accredited under the Skills Framework for Financial Services. For our training programmes that are accredited under the IBF Standards, eligible Singaporeans & PRs can apply for funding support under the IBF Standards Training Scheme (IBF-STS), subject to all eligibility criteria being met. Note: All participants (Self-Sponsored and Company-Sponsored) must be physically based in Singapore For company-sponsored participants, the company must meet the following two requirements to qualify for funding support of up to 70% from IBF (excluding GST). 1. Company-Sponsored participants have to be Singaporeans or Singapore Permanent Residents (PRs) that are physically based in Singapore. 2. Eligible companies refer to Financial Institutions that are regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) (either licensed/exempted from licensing) and Fintech companies that are registered with the Singapore Fintech Association.
883832114647.description: Explore the evolving world of sustainable finance, learn to integrate environmental considerations into decision-making, and drive positive.

1040336503487.summary: What You'll Do Born and raised in Bangkok, Sirilaksana, or Siri, will be preparing a special meal in memory of her late mother, who served in the Royal Thai Air Force. Weekends were precious moments for them to spend together, and they were often filled with delicious food. This dinner, Siri will recreate a dish particularly dear to them a seafood stir-fried noodle dish called radna. The freshness of the seafood in Chon Buri, a destination for this dish, is a key part of the memory that she hopes to share with everyone. About Whats For My Dinner In moments of remembrance, food becomes a heartfelt tribute to our departed loved ones. This year, join us as we witness the preparation of these special meals and learn about the connection between food and the departed from communities from different cultures, nationalities and background. Multiculturalism is important in Singapore as it serves as the bedrock of the nation's societal fabric. It fosters mutual respect and harmony among diverse ethnic communities with different cultural practices, languages and religions. This shared understanding bridges social divides, cultivating an environment where every individual feels valued and included. It shapes Singapore's unique identity on the global stage, fortifying its reputation as a cosmopolitan hub. Food serves as a conduit for understanding and appreciating our neighbours culture and traditions. From Singaporean food to ASEAN cuisine to far beyond, there are dishes sure to suit everyones tastebuds. Through interacting with members from different communities, Whats For My Dinner aims to inculcate a greater awareness of the diverse communities residing in Singapore. It spotlights Singapore, through many of its culinary adaptions, as a melting pot of cultures and encourages deeper appreciation of our multicultural identity. Be inspired by the flavours and friendships and let us makan (dine)! About The Host Singapore became Sirilaksana, or Siris, new home in 2013. Drawn to the citys vibrant energy, she built a career in advertising and consumer research, and even met her husband here. Siri has been actively involved in the Thai Association for the past two years, organising their annual Songkran celebrations and community get-togethers. These experiences have led her to forge deep friendships and her desire to share the richness of Thai culture with Singapore. Who should come? Everyone is welcome to participate! Participants under 13 must be accompained and supervised by a parent/guardian at all times. Programme Details Approximate Duration: 2 hours (Please arrive 15 minutes before the tour for registration) Language: English Meeting Point: Please meet in front of Lilac Oak Cafe at 71 Oxley Rise, #01-01, Singapore 238698 Ending Point: The event will start and end at the same point. The events will proceed rain or shine. What to bring? Participants should be dressed respectfully in smart casual (i.e. collared shirt, long pants and covered shoes). Sleeveless attire, shorts/miniskirts or sandals are strictly not allowed. Participants will be denied entry if they dress inappropriately. Participants should bring along an umbrella and a bottle of water. Please ensure that you bring along any personal medication. Asthmatic individuals are reminded to bring their inhaler. Other important information Dishes may contain soy, dairy, peanuts, tree nuts, fish, crustaceans, gluten and eggs. The food is not halal-certified and non-vegetarian. Parking is not available. The venue is wheelchair accessible. Photography is allowed at event premises. Disclaimer All ticket sales are final. There will be no refund if you wish to cancel your tickets. Each ticket admits only one participant. By agreeing to participate in the tour, every participant will be responsible for any injury, loss of damage due to careIessness of other actions on his/her part or that of children under his/her charge. Videos and photographs may also be taken during the event. By registering for this event, you give My Community full rights to use the photos for marketing and publicity. For updates: Follow us at @mycommunitysg on Instagram and @myqueenstown on Facebook. Visit mycommunity.org.sg to learn about our initiatives. Visit mycommunityfestival.sg for all our latest updates.
1040336503487.description: Join Siri for a heartfelt dinner as she recreates special Thai dishes, sharing cherished memories and flavours from Bangkok!
1040336503487.venue_name: Please meet in front of Lilac Oak Cafe at 71 Oxley Rise, #01-01, Singapore 238698
1040336503487.title: My Bangkok Dinner with Sirilaksana Kantha

1042788647917.summary: Finding Community in Alserkal Avenue - A talk with Nala, Kokoro & Subco Join us for an engaging conversation with Jill Lee Okkers from Nala, Faisal Yabroudi from Kokoro, and Rahul Reddy Subko as they share their unique journeys of finding community in Alserkal Avenue. A talk moderated by Shannon Holden. About the speakers Nala | Jill Lee Okkers After Natasha, Jill is the face behind the flavours of our brands. She has worked tirelessly with her team to create dishes that are original, authentic and fresh and does so while minimising our environmental footprint in every way possible. Jills role extends into training, kitchen layout and staff structure as well as quality control on our concept brands. Shes an innovator, ensuring that were always one step ahead. Like Natasha, Jill grew up drawing inspiration in the kitchen from her grandfather and came to TG having worked in hospitality for over fifteen years, holding positions such as Head Chef, Private Chef and Development Chef with a Diploma in Culinary Arts. Jill travels extensively for research into global cuisine and is often found dipping into cookbooks and websites and keeping an eye on food trends to inform her dishes. Shes also a qualified journalist, penning her thoughts on all things culinary over on her blog Food By Jill. Shes an advocate for food sustainability, underscoring the need to reconsider how and where we source our ingredients from. Faisal Yabroudi I began my journey in the food and beverage industry in late 2015 by co-founding PINZA. Initially focusing on the food delivery segment and later on launched the PINZA B2B model to supply other F&B operators in the market. My venture expanded to launch several successful virtual delivery concepts along the way. Driven by a passion for creating & developing unique dining experiences in Dubai, I eventually transitioned into the premium casual dining sector a few years ago by co-founding an outdoor live fire cuisine concept called Fiya and eventually launching Kokoro earlier this year. We provide a simple and casual dining experience, prioritising exceptional food quality, customer service, and customer retention." Rahul Reddy Rahul Reddy is the founder of Subko Specialty Coffee Roasters. With Subko, Rahul intends to help reimagine the Indian Subcontinent as a legitimate contributor to the global specialty coffee movements. The conception of Subko began in December 2018, and cemented itself in February, 2019, when Rahul decided to leave behind careers in the technology, social enterprise, and risk analyst worlds to train as an apprentice at a specialty coffee company called City of Saints in Brooklyn, New York. There, he learned the art of profile roasting coffee as a roasting apprentice, learned specialty brewing, packaging, producing cold brew, and farm level green bean buying. He also completed what is considered the coffee worlds most rigorous sommelier certification, requiring him to pass 21 sensory analysis exams around coffee, called the Specialty Arabica Q Grader. Talk m oderated by Shannon Holden Shannon is the Community Relations Manager at Alserkal Avenue, with professional experience at arts and cultural institutions and corporate business environments. She holds a BA degree from Smith College in Northampton, Massachusetts. In 2011, she managed the region's first and most extensive exhibition on contemporary African art titled As It Is! Contemporary Art from Africa and the Diaspora, a four-part exhibition at Mojo Gallery, Dubai, featuring the works of 24 African artists. An alumna of Campus Art Dubai's inaugural cohort, her CAD exhibition on the aesthetic of funk titled Chaos into Clarity: Re-possessing a Funktioning Utopia was selected and presented at Sharjah Art Foundation. By way of Arizona and New York City, she and her family have lived in Dubai for many years. Most recently she was a participant in Rewilding the Kitchen , an experimental culinary project curated by Nahla Tabba.
1042788647917.description: A talk with Jill Lee Okkers from Nala, Faisal Yabroudi from Kokoro and Rahul Reddy from Subko about finding community in Alserkal Avenue.
1042788647917.title: Finding Community in Alserkal Avenue | Nala, Kokoro & Subko

1044793063177.summary: Clean and reboot your entire system with this master alchemist. Kambo is a medicine that has a divine intelligence all of its own.... Possessing the miraculous ability to cleanse and purify so thoroughly as it works on the physical body, emotional body, the mind and the spirit. With over 15 years of experience walking the spiritual warriors path, and over 10 years of experience working with kambo, rappe and Sananga, Iwan Bran is a medicine carrier and shaman of the land. Initiatied into many traditions, including the 1500 year old Mexican Tol lineage of the Toltec tradition of the nagual; the Peruvian Mestizo tradition; and the Bwiti tradition of Gabon. He is also a sacred fire keeper and Eagle sun dancer, and Canuppa (sacred pipe) carrier within the Lakota tradition, and walks the arduous path of the Heyoka medicine man within that tradition. He has practiced on 4 continents, and is based in his homeland of Wales, where his knowledge is rooted through his alliances with the native trees such as the Yew, Oak, Birch. His speciality is in treating trauma and addiction as well as in facilitating extractions. And he has a very soft, but direct approach, preferring mostly to work in silence. Highly recommended. Kambo is a medicine traditionally used by many Amazonian tribes to cleanse the mind, body and spirit! It systematically cleanses the liver and lymphatic system; boosts the immune system; removes any blockages; helps to put us in touch with our authentic selves; brings unresolved traumas to the surface to be released; helps us to let go of unhealthy patterns and addictions; heightens our intuition and vision; restores vitality; boosts our energy levels and helps increase motivation; makes way for the blossoming of our full potential. Kambo is a secretion that is collected from the back of the Monkey Tree Frog. After drinking 2 litres of water, a thin piece of vine is heated with a flame, then small openings are burned into the skin - usually on the arms or legs... then the kambo is applied to those tiny openings. The sensation itself is like a fiery heat.... with an increase in heart-rate and slight swelling around the lips and cheeks. All impurities and 'old' energies are usually purged by vomiting into a bucket, but sweating, crying and also needing to go to the toilet are very common ways of releasing these negative influences and heavy energies. The experience itself lasts for around 20 to 30 minutes, and is followed by a resting and rehydrating period of up to 2 hours, depending on each individual's needs. 120. Max 10 places. RSVP To reserve your place book viawww.aho.communitywebsite. If you require a concession please contact darenellis@aho.community To contact Iwan or if it's your first time. 999324314927.summary: Air quality isn't just a global issueit's a local one that directly affects our health, wellbeing, and environment here in Charlton Kings. Building on the insights shared in our April event, Clean Air Cheltenham is launching a new initiative, "Charlton Kings Clean Air Action Group," with our full supportand we need your involvement to make a real difference! Why It Matters: Poor air quality can have serious impacts on our communitys health, from respiratory conditions to cardiovascular issues. During our last event, we explored Cheltenhams air quality standards, the latest research, and local monitoring data, including insights from the air quality monitor on London Road. Now, it's time to turn that knowledge into action. What You Can Expect: To kick things off, we are running a free community event on 30th October in the Stanton Hall, led by Hannah Leatherland from Cheltenham Borough Council, Trish and Mark Barber from Clean Air Cheltenham, and Peter Frings, which will revisit key data on air quality in Charlton Kings and outline actionable steps we can take together to improve it. Get Involved: This is more than just a discussionit's a call to action. With the launch of the "Charlton Kings Clean Air Action Group," with the support of our community we want to make tangible improvements in air quality. Whether its through individual lifestyle changes or collective community efforts, there are many ways you can help. We're also excited to announce that local schools are already discussing how they can contribute, making this a true community effort.
999324314927.description: Dont miss this opportunity to be part of a community-led effort for cleaner air and a healthier future for Charlton Kings!
999324314927.title: Launch Event: The Charlton Kings Clean Air Action Group

1034902971647.summary: Sudbury Community Energy Meeting Date: 30.10.24 Time: 18:00-20:00 Location: Sudbury Arts Centre Come and join us to find out about the exciting initiative to help communities take action on the climate crisis. As part of Babergh and Mid Suffolk District Councils Carbon Reduction Management Plan, we have teamed up with Community Energy South to provide support for the development of community led renewable energy projects to communities along the Stour River Valley. To make this happen, we need to speak to the groups and individuals in the River Stour area that are interested or involved in renewable energy and energy advice in their local area. This will help us make sure we can provide effective support for community led renewable energy and energy advice projects to get started and to reduce the areas carbon emissions. This evening will provide insight into: An introduction into Community Energy and Community Energy South How Community Energy fits within the Babergh & Mid Suffolk Carbon Reduction Management Plan Some successful case studies AND some talks from the recently established Community Energy Groups in Babergh & Mid Suffolk How you, your group or business can get involved and how well support you Ask questions, meet the teams and groups already established in the community energy sector. Tea and coffee will be provided, we look forward to seeing you there!
1034902971647.description: Let's come together at the Sudbury Community Energy Meeting to discuss how we can make our district more sustainable and energy-efficient!
1034902971647.title: Sudbury Community Energy Meeting

1011059003697.summary: Set sail for treasure hunt. The bounty: genes that confer "Super Powers" (like surviving in boiling temperature). The idea* was to read all the genetic codes, DNA in mixed population of microbes collected from different seas, without distinguishing the constituent species amongst. Then, store the findings in public domains, where others could learn and perhaps might help to mitigate effects of climate change. The master mind was none other than Craig Venter, a finisher of Human Genome Project. Only this time, the object gets smaller (marine microbe), the scope to go larger (seas of the world). We will be reading non-fiction "Microlands. We hope to learn about basics of DNA sequencing and discuss topics like: to whom the collected DNA belongs: the discoverer or the country where the life form lives at.Coincidentally, the United Nation Convention on Biological Diversity is going to be held around the same date. Book title: Microlands - The Future of Life on Earth Authors: C. Venter and D.E. Duncan Published by: Robinson (2024) Whether you are a casual book lover or clean tech expert, please join us. *This launched a new field, called metagenomics. By the same principle, Leaf-branch Compost Cutinase (LCC) was to be found degrading PET plastics in 2012.
1011059003697.description: A tale of how a maverick scientist collects DNAs from Seas of the world. Learn what is DNA sequencing in layman's terms, microbe sovereignty
1011059003697.title: DNA pirate or modern day Noah, saving us from extinction

1014370378107.summary: What is Female Founders Business Brunchin? On the morning of Friday, 18 October , Thrive and Barclays Eagle Labs (Brighton) will host a stimulating morning of talks, networking opportunities and a healthy brunch. Whats the theme of the brunch? Every brunch has a dedicated theme, and the theme for our upcoming brunch is Women on a Mission . In between the two talks, you will have the chance to network with other female founders, creatives and changemakers over a healthy brunch! Who is speaking at the brunch? Our first speaker is Antoinette Daniel. Antoinette is a former PE teacher, now entrepreneur who is passionate about seeing justice done in all areas of her life. She is the founder of multi award-winning London cleaning agency called Just Helpers and they are aiming to make the world a better place, one clean at a time. Strong justice Ethics are at the heart of all they do Currently she is in the process of radically transforming the cleaning industry to enable cleaning colleagues to be paid equitably, working rights and conditions to be more rigorously monitored, laws changed to enable ethical agencies to operate more ably, and clients' homes and offices cleaned to a consistently high standard. In her spare time she loves walking by the sea or sitting in her favourite chair watching the world go by. Our second speaker is Jess Rad . Jess Rad , is the Founder of The WomenHood addressing the unspoken challenges of womanhood today to create gender equity in our workplaces and home lives. Inspired by her own journey through premature menopause, late discovered neurodivergence, divorce, and as a parent carer, Jess is a dedicated social entrepreneur and speaker, offering powerful workshops, programmes and consultancy to organisations and communities. With a background as an award-winning marketer for the BBC, 20th Century Fox, and Disney, Jess founded The WomenHood in 2019 to challenge the loneliness epidemic and destigmatise taboo challenges. Jess is an ambassador for the SEND charity Amaze , a UN Women delegate, and has been shortlisted at The National Diversity Awards 2024 as a Positive Role Model for Gender. How much are tickets? Everyone is welcome to attend - however you identify. Tickets for this event are 20. 10% of our total ticket sales income will be donated to Network of International Women for Brighton & Hove (NIWBH) - an independent charity which provides a safe space for women of diverse cultures and backgrounds to meet, share experience and knowledge, and support each other. To learn more about the valuable work of the NIWBH, go to: https://niwbh.org/ Thank you to our event partner! This event has been made possible, thanks to the generous support of Barclays Eagle Labs . Barclays Eagle Labs is on a mission to support entrepreneurial growth, through its national network of incubators, industry specialism, growth programmes and events.
1014370378107.description: Be inspired and network with other women in business over a tasty brunch!
1014370378107.event_address: 139-142 North Street, Brighton and Hove, BN1 1RU
1014370378107.title: Female Founders Business Brunchin'

791445714437.summary: Wholeheartedly You Full Moon Womens Circles are an opportunity to pause and reconnect - a safe and sacred space to gather with other women, find grounding, comfort, inspiration and acceptance, and remember and celebrate our unity with nature and the universe. If you are feeling called to explore this interconnectivity to support your growth, healing and wellbeing, these circles are for you. The full moon is a magical moment in the already magical lunar cycle. Representing the cycles completion, the sun and moon become aligned on opposite sides of the earth and 100% of the moons face is illuminated by the sun, from our perspective at least. When you consider the magic and mystery of the universe, this is just one of many awe-inspiring wonders which can easily pass by unnoticed unless we tune in. The beauty is that as we explore our interconnectivity with nature and the moon, we can get to know ourselves more deeply. The full moon can light the way back to our truest, most wholehearted self. The significance of the full moon The energy of the full moon is that of celebration and gratitude. Sometimes in life, it can be as if we are always trying to get somewhere, so much so that we forget to pause and celebrate exactly where we are and who we are in this very moment. The full moon reminds us of our perfect wholeness. No matter what we go through, how broken we feel, or how we see ourselves, we are always whole, worthy, and complete. We are always enough. Just like the moon is always whole, it's simply that we only see it to be so at a certain point in the lunar cycle. But just because you dont see its wholeness, doesnt mean it isnt so. The full moon is an invitation to gaze up into the sky and see our perfect wholeness mirrored back to us. Energetically, the full moon can be a time when emotions and feelings are heightened. Full moon circles are also therefore an opportunity for self-reflection, to explore whatever is coming up for us at the time, with a gentle and compassionate heart. What is the full moon asking us to see? The full moon can shine the light on our lives and all parts of ourselves we keep in the shadows including our patterns and beliefs - an opportunity to turn our attention inwards and bring these parts of ourselves into the light, to embrace them wholeheartedly. What you can expect A guided meditation to relax, release tension, and connect with your heart and the energy of the full moon Gentle somatic practices to connect body and mind to support healing Reflection time and journalling with soothing natural tea The opportunity to share whatever is arising for you in our sharing circle (sharing optional) Calling on the oracle cards to connect with the moon's energy (also a beautiful way to nurture and tune into your intuition) Candlelight intention setting ritual - once the full moon reaches its peak, it begins to wane back to the new moon. What are you ready to release or let go of that no longer serves you? Please bring a crystal or piece of jewellery to place in the circle altar, to charge it with the full moons energy and the energy from the evening. Secure your place Full Moon Women's Circles are on a donation basis. I have included a suggested amount of 25 per place at the link below however please do not be put off if you cannot make a donation at this level. Please get in touch: katie@wholeheartedlyyou.co.uk. Inclusivity Wholeheartedly You Womens Circles embody inclusivity, non-judgment, and non-discrimination. Circles are therefore open to all who identify as a woman, and women from all walks of life, race, religion and background are welcome.
791445714437.description: A safe, sacred space to rest, reconnect, and tune into your heart and the magical energy of the full moon
791445714437.title: Full Moon Women's Circle

1006703305687.summary: Full Moon Women's Sacred Circle ~ Intention Setting Join us for this transformational New Year Intention setting supported by the wisdom from Mother Cacao and our ancestors through Shamanic Drumming . Event Details: Date: January 11, 2025 Time: 15:00 - 17:00 hours Location: Thames Barn Centre , Church Rd, Thame OX9 3AJ ( Room : Small Barn) Dear Soul Family, As the New Year dawns, we are presented with a powerful opportunity to set intentions that will guide us through the year ahead. Join us for a sacred afternoon of intention setting, cacao ceremony, and shamanic drumminga transformative experience designed to help you align with your highest self and manifest your deepest desires for 2025. Why Conscious Intentions? Setting conscious intentions is more than just making resolutions; it's about connecting deeply with your inner truth and aligning your goals with the highest vision for your life. Conscious intentions are the seeds we plant in the fertile soil of our awareness, allowing us to live with purpose, clarity, and mindfulness. By setting these intentions in a sacred space, we amplify their power, inviting the universe to support our journey throughout the year. The Power of Cacao Cacao, often referred to as the "Food of the Gods," has been used in ceremonial practices for centuries. This sacred plant medicine is known for its heart-opening properties, helping us to connect with our emotions, deepen our meditation, and access a higher state of consciousness. The gentle yet powerful energy of cacao allows us to clear blockages, release what no longer serves us, and invite love and compassion into our lives. It is the perfect ally in setting intentions that are rooted in love, harmony, and spiritual alignment. Shamanic Drumming: Journey into the Heart Shamanic drumming is an ancient practice that connects us with the rhythm of the earth and the heartbeat of all creation. The deep, resonant beat of the drum guides us into a meditative state, where we can journey inward to access wisdom, healing, and insight. This practice helps us to release stagnant energy, align with our inner rhythm, and step into the flow of life with confidence and grace. What to Expect Cacao Ceremony: We will begin with a sacred cacao ceremony, where you will be guided to connect with the spirit of cacao, open your heart, and set your intentions for the New Year. Shamanic Journeying Guided Meditation : A guided meditation will help you to envision your intentions clearly, aligning your mind, body, and spirit with your desired outcomes, anchoring your intentions into the earth and amplifying your connection with the collective energy of the group. Sharing Circle: There will be an opportunity to share your intentions with the group, if you feel called, creating a supportive community energy that will carry your intentions forward. This event is a sacred space for you to connect deeply with yourself, the earth, and the energies of the New Year. Whether you are new to these practices or have been journeying with them for years, you are welcome here. Please bring a crystal or a symbolic item to charge it with the New Year Intention and place it in the centre of the circle altar. Secure your place by booking via eventbrite or Paypal.Me/sensanchali Love & Light Aadi JotPrem Kaur About the Facilitator : About the Teacher : Aadi Jot Prem ( aka Sanchali ) is certified Kundalini Yoga Level 1 Yoga Teacher & a Transformational Coach. Her spiritual journey lead her to the purpose of supporting beautiful souls empowering them to identify & release their low vibrational beliefs that blocks them from manifesting a life they truly deserve. Her ongoing Transformational coaching practice of over 7 years , alongside the teachings of Kundalini Yoga that came into her life when she was experiencing yet another important personal transformation have become an integral part of her life . A devotee of Goddess Maha Kali , her Dharma is to awaken women to their true divine essence . Her classes cultivate a deep connection between the individual finite self to the Infinite Higher self. Hosting monthly Cacao ceremonies , Shamanic Drumming circles she creates containers for women to come together as sacred sisters to heal not just indvidually but also heal the collective consciousness.
1006703305687.title: New year Intention Setting ~ Cacao Ceremony with Shamanic Drumming

781657979057.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Sam Zindel is Managing Director of Brighton-based digital marketing agency Propellernet. He led the companys B Corp certification and is committed to doing everything possible to help restore our climate using business as a force for positive change. A graduate of the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership, Sam runs Low Carbon Leaders , co-founded The Million Tree Pledge and works closely with Clean Growth UK and our local authorities on business transition to net zero. Connect with him on LinkedIn. Ed Chinn I'm focused on creating a positive impact through my work, for the wider community and (as much as possible) the planet. Essentially, leaving the world in a better place than I found it. I look to do this connecting people, ideas and insights via groups like People, Planet, Pint! as well as LinkedIn and Twitter. Im a keen advocate of positive action through innovation, conscious capitalism and building a more circular economy. Via a range of sources, including fellowship of the RSA and podcasts (I highly recommend John Richardson and the Futurenauts!) to name a couple, I am passionate about educating myself about how I can be a better citizen and ancestor. Grace Prior With a career spanning hospitality, marketing and recruitment across global organisations before joining Silicon Brighton, Grace is passionate about making Brighton the destination for people in technology. If you're a technologist looking to become a community advocate, or a business looking to get behind our mission through event or wider strategic partnership opportunities, then get in touch. Silicon Brighton Silicon Brighton is a community-led initiative supporting digital growth in the South East. We really believe in Brighton, its people, and its potential. Working hand-in-hand with the local tech community, we support a number of Meetups across the city, providing individuals with free opportunities for networking, training, up-skilling and development, helping them to take their careers and businesses forward.
781657979057.description: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
781657979057.event_address: 10 Ship Street, Brighton and Hove, BN1 1AD
781657979057.title: Brighton and Hove - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

984018735527.summary: Join Together Culture member Sue for a monthly circle based on accessing our unconscious and developing intuition to help unleash creativity and hone a creative mindset. The circle will be open to evolution and a collaborative direction but to get us started the first 3 months will also act as standalone workshops: Thu 19 Sep: Using dreams to unleash our unconscious mind We will explore the Jungian concept of dreams, and how they can help access our unconscious. We will look at common dream themes, and look at ways to help dream recall and interpret symbols and the meaning of dreams. Feel free to bring any dreams with you and we can explore their messages to you. Thu 31 Oct: Using Tarot to access our shadow and intuition We will look at the Heros Journey, as told in Tarot through the major arcana cards, and examine how we can use the cards to access our unconscious, and work out what might be blocking our energy. We will look at ways that you can read Tarot for yourself and harness the power of your intuition. Feel free to bring a deck if you have one. Thu 28 Nov: Introduction to shadow work and uncovering triggers An introduction to Jungs concept of the shadow, what it is and how accessing our shadow can help us to get in touch with our true self, enabling us to make choices in our life from a calmer place, and direct our energy more effectively to what we really want from life. We will have some shadow coaching and post the session I will be offering a free 1:1 session to all comers. About Sue After 30+ years in a career in hospitality marketing, I was lucky enough to be able to retire from that world in 2021. I have spent most of the last 3 years on a journey inwards, training as a Jungian Life Coach, Yoga Teacher and Laugher Yoga Leader. All these modalities can help us to access our true selves, becoming calmer, more resilient and able to take control of our lives. I love helping people to step into truer versions of themselves, and am excited to be bringing this together at Together Culture so we can start a circle of intuition, learning and growth! I am a Certified Master Jungian Life Coach, 500RYT (Yin and Hatha Yoga), Certified Laugher Leader and Certified Tarot Reader. About Together Culture Together Culture is a community led, Community Interest Company. We are gathering a membership community united in their desire to help create a more equitable and ecological creative economy. We provide facilities, creative leadership and entrepreneurial skills development, momentum, structure, and resources for people to come together and make change happen. You can become a member of Together Culture here.
984018735527.description: A monthly circle based on accessing our unconscious and developing intuition to help unleash creativity and hone a creative mindset.
984018735527.title: Intuitive Insights Circle

1027994688787.summary: Canary Wharf Female Entrepreneurs: 1-Year Anniversary Event Hello lovely ladies! Were absolutely thrilled to invite you to our 1-year anniversary event ! This is set to be our biggest gathering yet, with exciting announcements about whats coming in November and beyond. You wont want to miss it! Agenda: 17:30 - Check-in, Drinks & Networking : Join us from 17:30 to enjoy a free drink and buffet options provided by local businesses. This is a great opportunity to start networking and connect with fellow female entrepreneurs. 19:00 - Welcome from the Founders : At 19:00, our founders, Ilona Drob and Thaisa Uchoas , will officially welcome everyone and share an update on community news and exciting new opportunities. 19:30 - Guest Speaker Panel : Were delighted to feature two incredible guest speakers : Dr Veena , GP, Media Doctor, and Mindset Curator Joan Medland , Co-founder and Co-CEO of Shoal Sustainable Savings App After the talks, there will be an open Q&A session , giving everyone the chance to engage with our speakers. 20:30 - Raffle & Prize Draw : Look forward to our fabulous raffle , with prizes donated by some of our amazing local female business owners! 21:00 - More Drinks, Food, and Networking : Stick around for more drinks, delicious nibbles , and the chance to meet and connect further with other attendees. Special Treat : Weve partnered with Cascavel Tequila to craft entrepreneur-themed cocktails and mocktails just for you! Event Details: Date : Friday, 25th October Time : 17:30 - 22:00 Location : The Republic, 2 Clove Crescent, E14 2BE This extended event promises a wonderful evening of celebration, networking, and fun! To support our community, please grab your ticket via Eventbrite . We cant wait to see you there! Speaker bios: Dr. Veena Babu is a London-based GP, broadcaster, and health expert who frequently shares her insights on prominent platforms, including Channel 5 News, BBC Radio, and ITV, among others. A leading Bollywood dance choreographer, Dr. Babu combines her passion for lifestyle medicine with her expertise in clinical leadership. She has leveraged her medical background and creative talents to spearhead initiatives addressing health inequities globally, beginning with the launch of SADAH, the UKs first charity dedicated to improving the lives of South Asian diabetic patients. Her innovative dance projects have garnered over 50 million views on YouTube, enabling her to raise thousands of pounds for various causes, including Great Ormond Street Children's Hospital, the Royal Society for Blind Children, and Kerala Flood Relief. Dr. Babu's recent collaboration with WaterAid brought her to 10 Downing Street and the Houses of Parliament, where she worked closely with MPs on health think tanks. In 2023, she had the privilege of interviewing global health ministers at the Africa Health Agenda International Conference in Rwanda. As her body of work continues to evolve, Dr. Babu remains committed to making a meaningful impact in health and wellness Joan Medland Co-founder and Co-CEO of Shoal Sustainable Savings App Joan is the Co-founder of Shoal, a sustainable savings app launching with a leading interest rate and FSCS protection, as well as the ability to support green and social projects globally. Before making the switch to intrapreneur in Standard Chartered Ventures incubation programme and completing multi-million dollar fundraises, Joan had a 15 year career in law, consulting and financial services. The idea for Shoal was born from an experience Joan had while looking for a savings product that did some good, and made a good financial return. After failing to find the right financial product with my high street bank, she took her research to the web at which point, feeling overwhelmed, she gave up. Claims were misleading or lacked transparency, financial performance was either uncompetitive or difficult to benchmark, or difficult to access the product without being high net worth. In bringing Shoal to market, it was important for the team to break down each of these barriers and have created innovative tools like your impact calculator which allows you to see how much CO2 youre avoiding or clean water youre creating, just by saving. Many people are thinking about sustainability in their lives, but don't realise how powerful their money is as a tool to influence positive outcomes especially when we join together with others. It's a common misconception that your money is just sat in your account, or locked up in a vault. But it's actually out there, doing things. Your bank uses it to provide loans to businesses and projects. And wouldn't it be great if you had a say over what your bank supports with your money? Over time, we aim to create a marketplace for sustainable finance to make it easier for you to save, spend and invest more sustainably. We'll do the homework for you, and bring the best, financially competitive products together in one place from a range of partners. Our mission is to break down barriers to empower people to achieve their financial goals in a way that promotes environmental and social responsibility.
1027994688787.description: Let's celebrate one year of female entrepreneurship in Canary Wharf!
1027994688787.title: Canary Wharf Female Entrepreneurs: 1-Year Anniversary Event

1011354266837.summary: Dear Woodsisters, The time has come. We began to circle after a Beltane Woodsisters gathering where we stepped into maiden/ young woman energy- which brought up some really difficult stuff about how we felt, what we went through and what we needed. We have all heard the call of the younger women " Where are our elders- how can we find you" Its time for us to call " WE ARE HERE". This is not our usual Woodsisters gathering- its a focused Grandmother Woodsisters circle open to women over 50ish who wish to come together and find ways that we can become- together- loving, wise Elders. A time to concentrate on what we can do together. We are asking for a very small donation a small amount toward the cost of tea and coffee and the woodland space ( which Rachel uses to maintain Kali woods). The booking also lets us know who to expect. Please bring snacks to share so that we can make toasties/sandwiches/ wraps etc as needed. Feel free to bring your craft to sit and do around the fire. I know for me it helps me focus. Lets put our minds together and see what life we can make for our children
1011354266837.description: A calling to Gather the Grandmothers and Wild Women in circle - We are needed. You are needed.
1011354266837.title: Gathering of the Grandmothers and the Wild Women - November 1st

1035056330347.summary: We invite you to gather with us, in the energy of Samhain, to honour your ancestors Whether or not you knew them or know anything about them whether you love them or hate them Whatever your relationship to your ancestry, this is a time to simply h onour the paths that they walked, give blessings to who they were, offer gratitude and prayers for the path you get to walk now, and create space for deep healing and release for anything that you are still carrying, that is now ready to release. In this sacred act of honouring and clearing, we can then make space to receive any gifts, any powers, any talents and skills that our ancestors had, and that we are ready to embrace. This also makes space to offer prayers for our future generations, just like our ancestors did for us. Samhain is the Celtic honouring of the season between Autumn Equinox and Winter Solstice, journeying from the light and in to the depths of darkness. A time where the veil between worlds are at its thinnest, and thus offering a potent time to honour those who have passed and create space within us to heal and make prayers for future generations to come. It is therefore the perfect time for us to do this beautiful work. The day is open to women and will be an embodied connection and journey through the heart and womb our power centres as women and where there is often so much generational conditioning and trauma passed down (as well as wisdom and gifts). Will you join us?
1035056330347.description: A day to honour, connect, release & receive from your ancestral lineage. Through ritual & ceremony we will journey through the heart & womb
1035056330347.title: Ancestral Remembrance

1015545853987.summary: This is a free meet-up for small business owners, entrepreneurs and people working from home who want to get out into the fresh air to discuss their challenges, discover new ideas and get support from their peers. This isn't a sales or network marketing group. Instead, we encourage people to delve into everything that goes into running a successful business. How It Works In small groups, we walk along the promenade, discussing our sticking points and offering ideas and advice from our own experience. Together, we aim to drive our businesses forward, enjoy the seafront and make new friends! When and Where We meet on the last Friday of every month outside Urban Reef at 9:30am. If the weathers bad well head inside Urban Reef and grab a table. Our walk takes us from Urban Reef to the Fishermans Walk zigzag and back, and usually takes about an hour. Afterwards, some of us grab a coffee. Children are welcome, as are dogs as long as you clean up after them! If you have any questions, email: info@beachwalkandtalk.co.uk

1044039870357.summary: Are you feeling isolated and lonely even if you live in London surrounded by loads of people? Are you stressed from work or anxious about your personal situation? Do you feel you never have time for yourself and so any self care? Are you craving more authentic and in person connection with other women? Look no further!!! Come and join me for a whole afternoon of women's drum circle! We will gather in a safe and secure space to take a welcome pause in our busy lives, tune into ourself, express how we feel, and drum to shake that energy and bring back movement into our lives! Drumming allow us to "switch off" the mind, and move from overthinking into feeling and letting the inner wisdom of our bodies to express itself. Expect some gentle guided meditation, plenty of drumming, in group or by pairs, times to share how we are feeling, and a nice drumming relaxation (aka shamanic journey) at the end. Drumming is done in an intuitive manner. This is not a workshop to teach any musical technique! But rather an opportunity to try and experience first-hand the healing that the vibration of the sound does to your body and mind! We will break for lunch in the middle of the session so please bring food to share . Healthy or home-cooked food preferred but please do what you can! Simple is best. There is no microwave onsite but pot to reheat food if needed. Cutlery and tableware is available. To be comfy please bring a yoga mat, a blanket, cushions, lots of warm layers and warm socks as the weather can be really cold at this time of the year! 7 frame drums are available to borrow during the circle. No experience necessary! Please let me know if you are bringing your own drum (of any kind!). Please note this is NOT therapy.
1044039870357.description: An afternoon of drumming with other women to release stress, connect and share. You will leave self-confident and energized,yet peaceful.
1044039870357.title: Women's drum circle: connection and well-being

978320682497.summary: Welcome to the feel-good season of fall! The final months of the year signal a busy period; with a new school term, event planning and work deadlines, it feels like the world is on fast-forward. But amidst this hustle and bustle, it's crucial to hit the pause button. Soon, you'll join us for events that showcase the best that rest can offer, especially with the right mindset and products. This autumn, make rest your solution. Together, we'll inspire each other to find new ways to unwind. After all, your body needs to recharge, so let's fuel it renewing relaxation! What to Expect Discovering our most dependable allies: the essentials we know, love, and rely on, including new wellness heroes to be revealed! Embracing nature's rest: authentic moments with essential oils bring us closer to our profound connection with the world. Meeting your needs in new and exciting ways: we'll focus on reminding your body that it's okay to chill and repair with the products needed to get you there. Look Forward To Events created for seasoned essential oil enthusiasts and newcomers alike. Expert-led workshops from doTERRA Corporate and key Leaders. New ways to support your body with the latest cutting-edge products! Sharing experiences, swapping stories, and building a network of support. In-Person Events We know that you love sharing experiences in person as much as we do, which is why we are thrilled to come together for some live events. The energy and passion of the doTERRA community is long-lasting! You will create precious memories, make new friends and take the experience of a live event with you. Bring your registration confirmation with you (this can be on your phone). Arrive 15-20 minutes before the event starts so you can check in. We advise those who are keen to attend live physical events to book as soon as possible to avoid disappointment!
978320682497.description: The restful rhythm of autumn awaits.
