863272650737.summary: Dear Folk Sister, Do you feel the call to explore your spiritual expression in a safe, fun and welcoming space but don't know where to begin? Perhaps you are already on this journey and would like to meet with kindred folk on their own paths. We work with spiritual cosmology to evoke and cultivate the perfect atmosphere where magic and relaxation merge. Folk Sisters wisdom circles open a divine portal into the sacred where your highest and most aligned self is free to take form. Carve out time to honour yourself as the living Goddess that you are and rest down in guided Sound and Nidra practices, take tea in ceremony, go on an embodied journey with your breath and embrace the joy and essence of this time of the year. Take time to consult the Wisdom Oracle cards, receive energy healing and talk with others about all things esoteric. In November Our Altar will be honouring the ones who came before us and the loved ones passed. Please bring anything you would like to add to it. Last year guests brought photos of loved ones they wished to honour and remember. We will be embracing the thinning of the veil between this realm and the next on this super fun evening. We will regale you with folklore, myth and ghost stories as we celebrate this time of mischief and magic. Let us dive into all that this time has to offer. This will be a beautiful time to explore our inner child through fun and creativity. We are Cate and Lisa, experienced holistic facilitators with a wealth of experience between us. We are delighted to welcome you to these unique, soul nourishing events. This circle is planned as an indoor/outdoor event. We will be utilising a private and secluded meadow as well as our Folk Sisters home, the Garden Hub, a private studio space in Ickford. Plant based snack to enjoy & gift bag to take away for all attendees ! Please contact us with any dietary or accesibilty needs Plenty of free parking available. Please bring a yoga mat We provide the rest and the magic

1005058064727.summary: About the event Join us for a delicious breakfast + coffee and spend a morning making new friends. We're not here for the BS networking. We're here for real connections. Our success has been because of the amazing women that are part of this community that make our networking groups relaxed, welcoming and warm. If you're just starting out in your business, or you've previously found networking not your cup of tea, then we're the group for you We won't ask you to do a 60 seconds pitch, we won't leave you hanging in the corner on your own; we're all about building real relationships with people. Breakfast includes 1 x hot drink and a pastry. What people say about networking with us "Women Who Do is honestly my favourite networking group, in person and virtual. They are very informal and Emma is an an amazing host, who makes you feel very welcome. She also provides really good questions to talk about during the virtual session so there is no chance for awkwardness." - Nadja "The Women Who Do community and events are so welcoming and empowering. You can turn up on your own and always come away knowing server always new lovely people. Its a great place to connect with other business owners and a place to collaborate!" - Meg "Lovely informal networking group. Supportive and friendly!" - Becky About your host: You will be welcomed by our wonderful Romsey Hub Leader, Kate Browning. Kate is a Boundaries & Creative Unicorn. She works with women who want to create a business and life that brings you joy, that is aligned with your values and one that you shape, by creating strong, healthy boundaries. Kate is also the Founder of a Creative Agency where they help impact led entrepreneurs who want to leave the world a little better off through their work, and to stand out and shine bright, by creating captivating marketing material with Canva and social media content that feels so beautifully, brilliantly and effortlessly them. Freeing up their time and energy, to focus on simply showing up and serving without worrying about their marketing.

1039392148897.summary: Welcome to Sussex Sister Circles - Hove (for the Worthing Circle, please click here ) Led by qualified life coach and circle facilitator Erin Lewis, Sussex Sister Circles are spaces for women to be together, decompress and take off the many hats we wear each day. Our Circles are safe, welcoming environments for women to support each other, share their stories and uplift one another. Women have been gathering in circle in communities across the world for generations. Whether the purpose be to honour the time of a womans bleed, to discuss issues of importance to the community or to mark the changing seasons, circles have been spaces for women to be held, seen and simply be, for many thousands of years. Womens circles are still a significant part of life in many First Nations communities around the world, but in the West we seem to have forgotten them. Or have we? Do we not all know the joy of gathering with the closest women in our lives, sharing stories, seeking support and discussing the things that matter? For me, and I know for others too, there has always been a subtle but ever-present difference in how a space feels when only women are present. There is something about the way women sink into each other and connect more deeply when there are no men present. That is what we create at Sussex Sister Circles - a space for women to rest in feminine energy and connect with other women. Its as simple as that and we would love you to join us. What to bring Please bring a yoga mat (or similar) and a cushion to sit on. Chairs will be provided for those who need them. Please also bring something that holds meaning for you (a photo, piece of jewelry, keepsake). Please arrive at 6:15pm for a 6:30pm start. We will close by 7:45pm. We will be in the Dune room, upstairs at The Wilbury Clinic, 109 Church Road, Hove. About the facilitator Erin Lewis holds a Professional Coach Diploma from Optimus Coach Academy and is a trained womens circle facilitator. She works with clients who are ready to identify and break out of the patterns and stories that are keeping them stuck in life. She is passionate about empowering women and creating spaces where they can connect, share and support each other. Already established in Worthing and now coming to Hove, Sussex Sister Circles aims to do just that.
1039392148897.description: A space for women from all walks of life to come together and connect, share and enjoy the luxury of being, rather than doing
1039392148897.event_address: 109 Church Road #Upper Floors, Brighton and Hove, BN3 2AF
1039392148897.title: Sussex Sister Circles - Hove

989076262727.summary: Hello, We are Mia, Katy, Sarah and Jake, and we are Shamanic Collective. We have experienced first-hand the deep healing and powerful transformation that shamanic work can facilitate when we are open to receiving guidance and knowledge from the liminal, otherworldly realms and the depths of our own being. Having studied with various teachers and shamans from around the world, we are passionate about sharing these modalities with those who seek holistic and alternative ways of healing. If youre interested in exploring shamanic healing, please join us for an afternoon of nourishing and joyful healing in community at the Bonnington Community Centre in Southwest London. Our community healings offer an opportunity to receive healing on emotional, physical and spiritual levels, re-establishing harmony, sovereignty and power. If you wish, you may join the 'healing chorus' to support the process with instruments and intention. Each participant receives a one-to-one shamanic healing. No previous experience required, just an open mind and heart. We are part of a larger network of shamanic practitioners and we occasionally invite other practitioners to help us faciliate our community events. Please note, the room is on the third floor of the building and unfortunately there is no wheelchair access. If you have any questions or need futher information, please email collectiveshamanic@gmail.com. We look forward to meeting you. Shamanic Collective What our clients say: "Thank you all for an amazing afternoon! I attended not fully knowing what to expect as I have not been to many events like this before. The environment was very calm and welcoming, with a beautiful altar set up for us to place offerings on. The healing session was a calming yet empowering experience for me. I felt like I went into a deep state and could have quite happily stayed for hours! It was so lovely to sit afterwards and talk through the experience with Sarah one-to-one, and to gain some insights into myself. After the healing I felt very serene and uplifted, and at the same time had a feeling of childlike excitement that I haven't felt for some time. I would love to attend more events in the future and highly recommend to anyone who is seeking healing and guidance in a safe, comfortable space with experienced practitioners! Thank you all so much." - Martha
989076262727.description: Join a small group of shamanic practitioners for an afternoon of nourishing and joyful healing in community.
989076262727.title: Shamanic Community Healing

993518579817.summary: Join Us for the Third Suffolk Tourism, Hospitality & The Arts Network Meet-up This is an event you wont want to miss! Were thrilled to offer an exclusive opportunity to explore John Ferguson's exhibition at Christchurch Mansion, ' An Eye For Life ,' with a private guided tour by the acclaimed photographer himself. John Ferguson is a renowned documentary, lifestyle, and portrait photographer based in Ipswich. His work spans over 60 countries, covering everything from conflict zones and natural disasters to intimate promotional campaigns highlighting poverty, refugees, and rural loneliness. He has photographed a diverse array of subjects, from global celebrities like Dolly Parton and Beyonc to unsung heroes of the Black Britannia project, which is now housed in the National Portrait Gallery. This exhibition is the first to delve into Johns remarkable career and his photography projects in Suffolk, capturing the essence of portraiture, identity, and homefrom iconic figures like Bowie to the raw energy of banger racing. Where: Christchurch Mansion (the jewel in the crown of Ipswich's historic past boasting over 500 years of history). When: Friday, 6th December | 10 am - 12 pm How much: 12.50pp Why Join Us? Have you noticed that traditional networking events often miss out on the dynamic minds from theatres, festival organisers, music venues, art studios, culinary hotspots, and tourist attractions etc.? Our events are different. We bring together professionals from across the tourism, hospitality, and arts sectors, creating a vibrant space where you can connect, collaborate, and growminus the formal pitches and stuffy suits. Relaxed Atmosphere: Network organically in a welcoming environment. Exclusive Experiences: Each event is hosted at a unique Suffolk tourist attraction. Inspiring Speakers: Hear from industry leaders while enjoying a Danish pastry and a hot drink. Lets come together to celebrate and strengthen Suffolks incredible creative and tourism community. Who Are We? Were Clare and Lucette, two passionate Suffolk-based business owners with over 25 years of combined experience in the travel industry. We created this network because we saw a gapa need for a space where professionals in tourism, hospitality, and the arts could connect, support one another, and collaborate on new ideas. Join us on this journey to showcase the best of Suffolks creative and tourism sectors, one unique venue at a time.
993518579817.description: Join us at The Suffolk Tourism, Hospitality & The Arts Network event for networking, inspiring talks and collaboration.
993518579817.title: The Suffolk Tourism, Hospitality & The Arts Network

1011092343417.summary: Join Connected You Community's monthly Walk & Talk Club where every month we meet at one of London's Royal Parks for a walk or nearby forest for a walk to connect and meet with other women. Invite a girlfriend to join! Be ready to connect - let's walk and talk together! WHO IS THIS FOR? If you are a woman or womxn who seeks meaningful connection in your life. You wish to make new friends, have heart-to-heart real convos and be seen and heard. You want to find a tribe of women where we support and uplift each other. We see you. We hear you. We've got you. We are Connected Yo Community of sisters waiting to welcome you to the tribe. T ICKETS Every attendee must have their own ticket! Freebie First Time: We offer free tickets for anyone who joins our community events for the first time. General Admission: 5.55 + fee WOMEN WHO ATTENDED SAID: "I absolutely loved the walk and talk experience because Essi created a beautiful space for everyone can be authentic and connect. I left energised, inspired and full of positive energy!" -- "The group were very open and honest, and the walk was lovely. There was no pressure to talk if we didnt feel like it during our circle which was great for new or shy members. " -- "Honestly no words, from start to finish my experience was amazing. Essi has an incredible energy, which is very open and welcoming and i could feel this from her initial message(s). The walking session was incredible, it was lovely to meet so many women and have a safe space to talk, listen and connect with each other. Thank you Essi for hosting and having me!" -- "It was a last minute booking for me the night before, I just thought, hey, why not? Go for it! It exceeded my expectations. I arrived a bit late, in a bit of a fluster, and feeling a bit drained and emotional. I left feeling completely different - my heart was full! Spent hours chatting with the lovely ladies I met, and even ended up going to the cinema with a couple of them after the walk!" -- "Lovely group with a wonderful purpose, to form connections in whatever way you are needing that particular day or time in your life. I appreciated how it felt very inclusive and personal. I will definitely be returning " -- "It was genial, I loved talking to all the women whom I found very inspiring and amazing for various reasons. I was apprehensive as don't always find it easy to access my feminine softer side so often nothing labeled women only I sometimes approach with wary, but I'm happy I've done this, it was incredible being in this amazing space with amazing women. I was surprised I've opened up much more than I expected. I loved the meditative experience and oracle card sharing stories. Also the location was gorgeous. Had an absolutely beautiful time." ABOUT CONNECTED YOU COMMUNITY Guided by Heart, United by Connection: This is Connected You. What began as a women-only community has blossomed into an inclusive space welcoming everyone, from all walks of life. We are a tribe where every person, regardless of background or identity, finds belonging. We see you. We hear you. We've got you. At Connected You, we foster connections that go beyond the surface. Our workshops, circles, and events encourage heartfelt conversations that enhance well-being and build meaningful friendships. Our community is guided by compassion, acceptance, and the belief that we are stronger together by supporting one another. Founded by Essi Virtanen, who draws on her background in journalism and coaching, Connected You was created as a sanctuary for those seeking to be seen and heard. Essis understanding of the power of shared stories in healing and uniting us has shaped our philosophy: we are all connected, and through these connections, we can grow and thrive. Our Mission We strive to make community and support accessible to all, ensuring our events are affordable. No one should be denied connection due to financial constraints. In a world that is filled with separation and juxtaposition, people feel more disconnected than ever. We believe in creating confidential, safe, inclusive spaces to connect both virtually and in person to battle against this disconnection we see through high statistics of depression and loneliness in this world. We believe together is better. To be part of the tribe, join our mailing list to hear first what happens next at: https://connectedyou.co/#mailing-list ABOUT THE FOUNDER Essi Auguste Virtanen Essi believes connection is the foundation for our wellbeing. She is an Intuitive Coach & Mentor, Inspirational Speaker and Author who holds a BA in Journalism and MSc in Applied Positive Psychology and Coaching Psychology. By combining her communications expertise, positive psychology knowledge and her gift of connecting with people, Essi founded Connected You Community which is all about bringing people together to have real heart-to-heart conversations and make meaningful connections in a community setting, which is according research the leading factor for long-term happiness. Everything Essi does is to help you to create a Connected YOU: who feels connected within Y ou, with O thers and the wider world and the U niverse to create a heart-led, fulfilling life. Essi also does 1:1 coaching on her HEARTFUL method which is about supporting people to reconnect with themselves after heartbreaking life events or life transitions, and find their direction for a fulfilling life. https://www.essiaugustevirtanen.co/
1011092343417.description: Connected You Community gathers a group of ladies every month to go on a walk to connect heart-to-heart and make new connections
1011092343417.title: Women's Walk & Talk Club - Victoria Park

1036838440687.summary: We are delighted to extend an invitation for your participation in the third global RECLAIM Network Plus Conference at the University of Surrey on Thursday, January 30, 2025, from 10:00 am to 4:00 pm (GMT). This event offers a unique opportunity to share best practices around blue, green and grey infrastructures with city officials, business and industry professionals, NGOs, and academics who share a passion for fostering greener, more resilient, and prosperous communities. Funded by a 1.45m EPSRC/NERC/AHRC grant, RECLAIM (Reclaiming Forgotten Cities Turning cities from vulnerable spaces to healthy spaces for people) is led by the University of Surrey's Global Centre for Clean Air Research (GCARE), in collaboration with the UK Centre for Ecology & Hydrology, Universities of Bath, Bangor and Warwick. The RECLAIM Network Plus serves as a comprehensive resource for towns and cities seeking information and support to implement green and blue infrastructure in their communities. It also facilitates connections with others sharing similar experiences. Complete instructions and additional information about the day will be provided to all registered participants before the event. If you encounter any registration issues or have enquiries about the conference, feel free to reach out to events@surrey.ac.uk. Please also note, photography and videography will be taking place during the event. The images and videos captured may be used for promotional purposes, including social media, websites, and other marketing materials. If you do not wish to be photographed, please email events@surrey.ac.uk. For more info & for updates on our featured speakers for the Conference please visit our RECLAIM Linked In https://www.linkedin.com/company/92448049/admin/feed/posts/ & Twitter https://twitter.com/reclaim_network
1036838440687.description: Celebrating Success, Connecting for the Future
1036838440687.title: RECLAIM Network Conference 2025

965833803907.summary: Have you ever been introduced to someone who completely changed the trajectory of your business? Perhaps they were the key to securing a new contract or owned the ideal location for your business. This structured networking session is designed to make these transformative connections through ethical word-of-mouth referrals. Why Attend: The event is not just another network meeting, it's a facilitated experience aimed at maximising the potential for productive business introductions. Using a tried & tested method, we will help you connect with individuals who can propel your business forward. Event Highlights: The pitch: prepare for the session by thinking about the profile of a person who could give you the new business you need - next month, next year, or game-changing. Referrals round: think about everyone in your own network of suppliers, customers or friends who buys goods and services Communal Breakfast: Exchange contacts, discuss collaborations, change lives over a croissant & a coffee. Success Stories: Veggies found a coop willing to give them a 5,000 bridging loan. Caleb was introduced to Hi Hoe, a proto-cooperative looking for support in developing their business plan. Fairbnb found an accommodation host for their founder, when they were visiting London for a conference. Calverts received a 40,000 no-strings grant to buy new machinery. Centre Point got an introduction that led to them becoming the UKs leading provider of accounting software to the charity sector. Every Givers Gain conversation has the potential to change the course of your working life. Bring your goals, your requests, your business card and your openness to making introductions. We're grateful to be supported by workers.coop for this event series. Your Facilitators Caleb and Sin from Principle Six. Prinxiple Six provides specialist development support to cooperatives and democratic businesses. We support groups to navigate and develop legal structures and incorporation, governance, financial planning and understanding what it means to be a co-op, especially member engagement & participation.Principle Six is especially experienced in supporting worker coops, housing coops & community owned venues in and around London. SPACE4 SPACE4 is part of Outlandish , a tech worker-cooperative committed to creating social and economic change. Through SPACE4, we activate our local community, small business, and social movements through affordable space, training, and networking events. Dont hesitate to get in touch or visit us. The 5 charge on this event is a deposit that will be refunded if you attend. The reason behind this is to assure bums on the seats as we spend a lot of time prepping for these events and workshops. 940225609107.summary: Have you always wanted to join a book club but dont have time to read the books? Or do you need inspiration for your reading list? Or are you dying to talk about your latest read with fellow book folk? Come on down to the Anti-Book Club! At the Anti-Book Club, there is no designated book of the month. Instead, everyone is invited to bring a book they recently finished - regardless of whether they liked, loved, or loathed it - and tell the rest of us what this book does (or doesnt do) for you. We are open to all kinds of books - audio, electronic, old school. In fact, it doesnt even have to be a book, as long as it is book-adjacent. And you dont have to bring the physical thing, just be willing to share something about it. The event will be facilitated by John Evans, long-time friend of SPACE4 and the cooperative movement, and Nida Sajid, resident librarian at creative collective Studio61, who will guide us through an evening of fun discussions. We will kick-off with an introduction by John and Nida, delving into their motivations for setting up the Anti-Book Club and what they hope to realise through it. We will then split up into smaller groups to chat about the books people have brought with them. Following this, we will reconvene as a room to share our insights and identify common themes across our audience-chosen book nook. There will be a selection of drinks and snacks available on the night as well as the option to purchase a home-cooked dinner, served up by Studio61s culinary team. The organisers John Evans is a software developer and imagineer residing in cyberspace. He is the project lead of spacetu.be, a group communication tool. Nida Sajid is a bibliophile living in London. She teaches all things culture and design at the University of Arts London and has previously worked for Libreria, a curated bookstore in Spitalfields designed for maximising serendipity. Studio61 is a co-operative made of people who are friends, neighbours and colleagues into all sorts of things - art, music, design, climate action, community energy, urban greening, technology, community organisingand more. https://studio61.substack.com/ https://www.instagram.com/thebookno0k/ SPACE4 SPACE4 is part of Outlandish, a co-op that builds websites and digital tools for social good. We are interested in tech for good, progressive economics, and social change. We provide co-working, meeting, and events space, primarily to social enterprises and digital activists. We also organise and host a range of events, workshops, and meetups around these topics. Dont hesitate to get in touch or visit us. Venue access information: https://space4.tech/visit-us Sign up to our newsletter: http://eepurl.com/dKiIsU Visit our website: https://space4.tech
940225609107.description: An alternative book club in collaboration with Studio61
940225609107.title: The Anti-Book Club | Last Thursday Sep to Nov

929114665977.summary: We continue to make waves! rev is a place for Pre-seed to Series-B founders to explore their options to grow their businesses. Starting with warp , aiming to provide acceleration options to earlier -stage founders. Then followed by rev, to gain insights from leading and emerging investors. What is warp? Were hosting warp from 2:30 pm to 3:30 pm , where we invite accelerators/incubators to showcase their programmes to an audience of early-stage founders that are looking for different support and funding options. Each speaker has 10 minutes to showcase their proposition. Attendees from warp can also participate in the rev afterwards. NB. If you are an accelerator/incubator and would like to present, please register here , select a relevant category, and we'll co-ordinate with you. What is rev? rev is our reverse-pitching series where leading and emerging investors showcase their propositions to an audience of Seed to Series A founders, both in person and on live stream, nationally and internationally. Were hosting rev from 4:0 0 pm to 7:30 pm at Canary Wharfs Level 39, London's iconic melting pot of innovators, investors, industry experts and ambitious entrepreneurs driving change across the sectors that dictate our experiences in daily life and bring a major financial and social impact - FinTech, Cyber Security, Data & AI, GreenTech, Life Sciences and more. Arrive earlier at 2.00 pm if youd like to participate in warp too. Theres no extra charge. Why rev? Pitching to VCs takes a chunk of time and loads of energy, and every rejection takes a little chip out of the soul; as an entrepreneur, you better be pitching to the right investors! As a startup founder, you have hundreds of other things to do, so weve structured rev to deliver fast, efficient insights to make the best use of two hours of your time. What happens at rev? rev is more than finding alignment with a VC's investment thesis, it's about finding where chemistry and personality resonate. We're here to help you discover the right investors efficiently. Each VC has five minutes to pitch, followed by your questions. Afterwards, immerse yourself in networking and leave a lasting impression - better still, make yourself unforgettable for the investors! NB. If you are an investor and would like a speaking spot at rev, please register at this link and well coordinate with you. More about the Organizer: About Pitchflix Pitchflix is your investor network powered by pitch videos. Investors can discover investment opportunities across the startup ecosystem from the UK and internationally, and founders can look for their future investors on the platform. Video provides a much richer experience and more efficient review process for investors compared to a pitch deck alone. Make yourself discoverable for VCs by registering on www.pitchflix.tv and uploading your own pitch video. Let us know if you have any questions. We're more than happy to help! The Pitchflix team is looking forward to welcoming you soon!
929114665977.description: Reverse-pitching showcase: leading and emerging VCs and accelerators showcase their propositions to investment-ready founders
929114665977.title: rev November: Investors and Accelerators Pitch to YOU!

976238404347.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Georgia Strivens, Marketing Specialist Georgia is a global marketing expert with a specialism in sustainability, events and digital innovation. She has worked for start-ups all the way through to major blue-chip organisations, including Salesforce, Oracle, RELX, Vonage and Delinian. Georgia has an entrepreneurial mindset with a passion for crafting ideas and strategies to inspire individuals and businesses to embrace sustainability. She believes that these endeavours cannot be achieved alone and it is unrealistic to expect ourselves to possess all the answers or attain perfection. Instead, she advocates for transparency, openness, and the courage to have candid conversations in a supportive environment where ideas can be shared, whilst having fun at the same time. You can connect with Georgia on LinkedIn. Alex Greig, Founder, Fuggles Beer Caf Alex founded Fuggles Beer Caf in Tunbridge Wells in 2013, driven by a vision to create a venue showcasing the finest British and European beers, as well as exceptional wines and spirits, in an atmosphere blending elements of a pub, Belgian-style cafe, and bar. Since its inception, Alex has expanded with two additional establishments. His dedication to quality, community, and environmental responsibility has earned Fuggles Beer Cafe recognition in the Observer's 'Best Places to Drink' guide and won the CAMRA's Pub Of The Year competition. Alex has implemented a dedicated sustainability policy, driving various initiatives to minimise Fuggles' environmental footprint. From sourcing products from like-minded suppliers to implementing energy-efficient practices and waste reduction strategies, Alex is committed to creating eco-conscious hospitality and further integrating sustainability into every aspect of the business. Additionally, he leads a Sustainability Food and Beverage group in Tunbridge Wells as part of the local Amplifi programme, to help other businesses learn how to do the same.
976238404347.description: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
976238404347.event_address: 28 Grosvenor Road, Royal Tunbridge Wells, TN1 2AP
976238404347.title: Tunbridge Wells - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

820173229207.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Alexis Eyre is a sustainable marketing consultant with experience in both marketing and sustainability helping companies ensure that their marketing functions become a force for good both from a strategic but also operational perspective. The main aim is to help companies ultimately contribute towards their wider business sustainability objectives. -- Meredith is the founder of BambooWorx , a sustainable marketing and growth consultancy for fintech, crypto and digital-first businesses that want to build or scale on the principles of people, planet, and profit. Shes a marketing leader and 'doer' who draws on her vast experience to bridge the world of crypto and digital assets, traditional finance, fintech and ESG principles as new technologies transform economies, ecosystems, and societies. Her motto is live and lead with purpose. Meredith has held global marketing leadership positions across the globe in Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong, and the UK for category leader brands like Citibank, FTSE Rusell, Elliptic, Contis, and SS&C Technologies. She is a Fellow of the Chartered Institute of Marketing, a Cambridge Institute Sustainability Leadership (CISL) Business Sustainability Management (BSM) alumni, and holds a Bachelor of Commerce (Marketing and Hospitality Management) from UNSW, Australia. -- Elaine Roberts is the change maker behind Klara Futura , a consultancy helping leaders and organisations navigate change to create resilience. Over the last 20 years, Elaine has held senior leadership roles in global purpose-led companies. Her experience spans launching the first mobile data services to the decarbonisation of shipping and renewable energy. From FTSE to SME to Private Equity and NGOs, she has expertise in driving strategic business transformation in B2B sectors, leading on customer, commercial, innovation, brand and marketing change. Committed to responsible business (#leadgoodchange), her work in resilience and growth for long-term sustainability, focuses on self, strategy and systems. Elaine is a Trustee of Stop the Traffik, a charity working to eliminate human trafficking and has previous Board experience in youth and disability charities. She is a mentor for Be the Business, an assessor for the Cambridge Institute of Sustainable Leadership and a Fellow of the Institution of Engineering and Technology.

1008164115007.summary: Capturing images around the historic naval city of Portsmouth during a small group social event offers a rich blend of history and vibrant urban life. Portsmouths maritime heritage is evident in landmarks like the HMS Victory, the Spinnaker Tower, and the Historic Dockyard, where old and new coexist in harmony. As you explore, the group setting allows for diverse perspectiveswhether focusing on the grandeur of naval ships, the charm of Old Portsmouths cobbled streets, or the bustling energy of retail parks. The collaborative environment of a small group fosters creativity, with participants sharing techniques for capturing the citys unique character. From wide-angle shots of the waterfront to intimate details of historic architecture, the range of photographic opportunities is vast. Additionally, the group dynamic encourages experimenting with different styles, be it long-exposure shots of the harbour or candid street photography. This shared experience not only sharpens your skills but also deepens your appreciation for Portsmouths rich history. What's Included: Insights into the local narratives and history woven into our time together Opportunities to savour the stunning topography Safety gear and essentials are carried for a safe and enjoyable experience Memorable moments and camaraderie with fellow photographers All sprinkled with photography knowledge by an award-winning qualified photographer and educator Bring Your Sense of Adventure: Whether you're an avid photographer seeking new challenges and narratives, this hosted event promises an exhilarating journey. Limited spots are available! Secure your place now to embark on an unforgettable exploration in photography! Host : About Mark? Mark is an award-winning qualified photographer and educator, with over 30 years of experience as a freelance photographer and holds a Master of Art in Photography, in addition to a BA (Hons) in photography degree; amongst other media qualifications . On first submission, Mark was awarded by his peers at the Royal Photographic Society, both Associate and Licentiate Distinctions. Mark is now a PhD candidate in photography, researching topography, the environment and the affect theory. What do past attendees say about Mark and his events? My 21-year-old daughter and I recently joined a Photowalk with Mark, at Valley of Rocks. It was a very enjoyable and educational experience. There were just two others, so a total of 5 in our group. Mark provided a comfortable environment for discussing the art and science of photography. He emphasized how personal photography can be and the importance of focusing on what we find compelling. He also provided instruction on the mechanics of a good photo as to structure, camera settings and other details. He was patient, very knowledgeable and clearly loves what he does. Thanks, Mark! Lisa, USA I was looking for someone to help me understand my canon camera whilst on holiday in Minehead. I am so glad that I booked a one-to-one day out with Mark. I cant say enough about how professional Mark is & how wonderful our day out together was. Mark instantly put me at ease and nothing was too much trouble for him to explain. Mark does this in a way that you can easily relate to in day to day scenarios. I have since joined Marks Lightroom Monday group and now enjoy learning all about post production of my images. Joan Middlesex I joined Mark on one of his 1 to 1 workshops New to Photography Workshop back in April 2019, I wanted to rejuvenate my hobby for photography, having been a member of a local camera club where if your face fits you were ok I wanted to understand more about photography and techniques, well 18 mths on having been a regular attendee on his walks and trips I feel I have learned much more from a very motivated, experienced educator and communicator. Malcom, Somerset Many thanks for all the help on your photography workshop in getting me away from auto settings, and understanding depth of field, rule of 3rds ect, it has been a great help in improving my photography skills and making everything even more enjoyable than I ever thought possible, Many thanks, Mark. Mike, Taunton, Somerset Mark has the knack of simplifying the technical. He is always available to answer questions, even when they have been asked before. Katrina, Minehead After having owned my Nikon DSLR camera for many years and never having taken it off Auto, I decided to join Mark on one of his Full Day Camera courses. He took me through the basics and encouraged me throughout the day, by adding new skills at varying locations. By the time we had finished, I felt confident to continue learning and practising my new skills. A great day for those who need to better understand their camera. Thanks Mark. Karen, Somerset Mark has endless patience, is very encouraging and has a wealth of knowledge, he has been a great support in helping me progress my intermediate photography skills from capturing the shot to editing in Lightroom. Joanne, Somerset We had some lovely days with sun, clouds, rain and wind. Today an Exmoor photographer showed us some beautiful places on Exmoor. Thank you Mark Stothard for taking us the whole day out and giving us a lot of tips ? Elma, Netherlands Marks passion for his art of photography, comes through in the warmth and professionalism he shows in all his workshops. He makes you feel welcome, relaxed and nothing is too much trouble! He simplifies instructions so that we can all understand. We all come away feeling greatly inspired and with new knowledge to become better photographers ourselves. His variety of workshops shows his broad knowledge. I particularly enjoyed the trip out onto Exmoor to photograph ponies and Highland cattle, where his enthusiasm is evident. The ambience of the smaller groups, where everyone is friendly and Mark inspires us to help each other, as well as sharing his tips and knowledge with us. I would thoroughly recommend attending any of his workshops. 896261059957.summary: Housing Associations and Local Authorities are facing severe challenges. With increasingly restricted budgets and services being strained to support more people, these sectors are forced to do more with fewer resources. This challenge is combined with high debt interest rates, mandatory improvement of home standards, strict energy efficiency objectives, and green targets. To alleviate pressure, a drive for operational efficiency and improved productivity is central to success and technology offers the opportunity to deliver services more cost-effectively, but with so many touch points, are there more efficient ways to connect to our communities? One way of doing this is the single front door. It provides a single point of contact between citizens and services. It triages individuals to ensure they receive the right service(s) at their point of need whether adult social care; tech-enabled care; debt advice, or digital inclusion. In this roundtable we will be joined by speakers including Matt Adam, Founder of We Are Group , a champion of connecting communities to ask how we can create more integrated services and discuss whether the single front door approach improves outcomes. This roundtable is for those in senior roles in the public sector and involved in shaping the future of community support services in local government and housing. Places are limited so please register here.
896261059957.description: Housing Associations and Local Authorities are facing severe challenges.
896261059957.title: Connecting local communities: Do we need a single front door?

1042082335317.summary: Book a free 45 minute in-person 121 coaching session with Lyndsey Clay, Entrepreneur Wellbeing Coach and Founder of Connected Brighton , who has been coaching entrepreneurs and small businesses for the past couple of years. Choose from a selection of dates and times to suit you. Once you've registered, we'll pass on your details (name and email address) to Lyndsey, who might contact you with a couple of questions prior to your session with her. Coaching benefits: Habit setting - Create routines that will help you be at your best to give you more energy and drive to build your business. Prioritise tasks - Work out what's important, and what's not so you are focused on the most effective tasks. Eliminate limiting beliefs - Manage the voice that says you can't, and change your story. Take back control - Create a personalised plan based on your needs, values and priorities. The 121 sessions will be held at the BIPC on the upper floor of Jubilee Library in Brighton. On your arrival, please head to the upper floor via the stairs or lift. If you can't make the session, please cancel your booking on Eventbrite or send email to bipc@brighton-hove.gov.uk. Expert biography Lyndsey Clay, Entrepreneur Wellbeing Coach and Founder of Connected Brighton - The social network creating lasting personal and professional connections through events that support local businesses. Lyndsey is also a winner of the RWC Entrepreneur of The Year 2022, a Qualified Coach, Networking Champion, Social Concierge and Radio Host. Lyndsey qualified in Performance Coaching with The Coaching Academy and quickly began coaching entrepreneurs and small businesses part time. As well as using her skills as a Chief of Staff within the energy industry, and as Head of Corporate Planning and Performance for a Government Regulator she has also applied her coaching to her own social events business born in lockdown. In less than 6 months she created a recognised brand with 3000 social media followers, 700 subscribers and 50 members joining her events platform designed to connect people while supporting local businesses. Brighton born and bred she is a passionate champion of the city and a Visit Brighton partner. Note The adviser is an independent professional and is not an agent or employee of the Council, nor the Library. They will be regulated by their own professional body and they will be able to provide you with details of that organisation.We will not be aware of any advice that is given to you by the adviser when you consult them in the 121 session and we do not verify or approve their advice. We therefore take no responsibility and make no representations regarding the relevance, accuracy, timeliness, completeness or otherwise of any such advice or information. Any views expressed by the adviser are their own views and not those of the Council. ------------------- Following the session, the expert will send you a feedback form which we would be grateful if you could complete to allow us to monitor the success of our offered expert 121s. ------------------- Important All our expert one-to-one meetings on offer are free, but places are limited as our business expert partners are giving their valuable time to the BIPC and to you for free while fitting these sessions into their busy schedule. Therefore, if you need to cancel the session, to give a chance for others to still book it, please give at least two working days notice when possible via: email to bipc@brighton-hove.gov.uk, or cancelling your booking on Eventbrite, or email/call to the business expert. Please note down the experts' contact details when they get in touch with you prior to the session. ------------------- Increase your chances of business success Business & IP Centre Sussex supports people to start, grow and protect their businesses in Sussex. Come and access our free market research and intellectual property databases and take part in our regular programme of workshops, webinars and networking events. What if I don't live / have my business in Sussex? Find your local BIPC here to find out how they can help you: https://www.bl.uk/business-and-ip-centre/national-network ------------------- FAQs What is your cancellation policy? The majority of our events are free, but places are often limited - especially for in-person events, therefore please make sure you cancel your place, if you are unable to attend . You can cancel through your Eventbrite booking or emailing bipc@brighton-hove.co.uk . Can I attend if I'm not a member of the library? Absolutely! Any Sussex based business/ person with a business idea is welcome. Though we always recommend joining the library as it's free and will make accessing our databases, books and publications much easier. How can I find out about any news & upcoming events? So glad you asked - we have a newsletter ! You can also follow us on Twitter , LinkedIn , Facebook and Instagram for the latest goings-on.

1040894873587.summary: MEET - DISCUSS - DRINK - MENOPAUSE Welcome to The Menopause Cafe - a safe, inclusive & friendly place to talk about the menopause! The menopause cafe is a great place to come and meet others who are experiencing the peri menopause or menpause - be that yourself, as a colleague, loved one, carer, partner, child or otherwise! Come along and let's fight the unexpected anxiety, dry itchy skin & ever changing energy levels together, in a non judgemental space which is inclusive to all. This is an opportunity to remove the stigma and hear from others, share your story, ask questions and generally have a chat. Come and be surrounded by like minded inviduals who all come from a place of support and kindness. Grab yourself a water, a gin or a cup of tea and let's gather one evening a month to empower ourselves and others and talk the menopause! _____________________________________________________________________________________________________ VITAL INFORMATION: Date: Thursday 24th October Time: 6.30 - 8.30pm - You are free to arrive / depart at any point. Location: The Cosy Club, Festival Place, Basingstoke A little background if your'e interested.... (although if your symptoms are anything like mine, I'm already distracted by this point!) Facilitated by me, Carli Adby, local resident, who started early menopause at 37 years - these groups are held once or twice a month and are supported by the 'Menopause Cafe.' (Originally started in 2017 and now global! www.menopausecafe.net ) I believe that coming together like this can be powerful and empowering - there is no obligation to be going through the menopause - taking autonomy in our own health choices as women and learn about our bodies; is universal. This is just something I wanted to start after struggling to find anyone to speak with about my seeminly random, sudden and often overwhelming symptoms which then turned out to be very early menopause. ____________________________________________________________________________________________________ Please pay attention to the principles of the menopause cafe - this is a not for profit, volunteer run platform and meetings are built upon respect, inclusion, accessibility and trust. More information about the Menopause Cafe charity can be found at www.menopausecafe.net
1040894873587.description: Come together to chat all things menopause in a welcoming, inclusive and safe environment.
1040894873587.title: The Menopause Cafe, Basingstoke - OCTOBER EVENING meet up

1044254071037.summary: Imperial College London and Upstream are excited to invite you to join us at White City Innovation District for networking with the leading minds of our deep tech community. SPEAKERS- More to be announced! Alastair Hamilton, Senior Director, Econic Biosciences Econic Biosciences is pioneering new ways to eradicate cancer by targeting a largely unexplored oncogenic driver. Extrachromosomal DNA (ecDNA) is a little-known but widespread driver of oncogenic DNA amplification, which contributes to cancers evolution in unprecedented ways. It is found across most cancer types and its presence is associated with poor clinical outcomes. Econic Biosciences is building on novel mechanistic insights to develop specific approaches to therapeutically target ecDNA with the goal of improving treatment for individuals with cancer. Alastair has worked in consulting for the likes of Gartner and LEK and in industry, for AstraZeneca, before joining Econic. He has a DPhil in Systems Biology, Oncology from Oxford University. Leo Kreme, Mar ia Guerrero Jimenez and Mele Gadzama, Co-founders, Marigold : AI-enhanced audio filtering for misophonia Misophonia is a condition where specific sounds trigger strong emotional reactions, significantly affecting daily life. It can especially affect those with autism. Team Marigold are one of four teams that have made it through to the finals of the Faculty of Natural Sciences Make-A-Difference (FoNS-MAD) competition. This is an annual entrepreneurial competition open to Imperial undergraduates and gives all finalist teams funding, lab space and a bursary to work on a proof-of-concept over the summer. Koji Muto, Co-Founder & CEO at Ki Hydrogen Ki Hydrogen's mission is to make biomass the premier green resource, using biomass electrolysis to create the worlds most affordable green hydrogen and biogenic carbon as key building blocks for chemistry, products, and fuels that power a decarbonised world. Koji has experience from industry, including as an engineer for ExxonMobile, followed by time at Last Energy (reimagining nuclear) and NeoCarbon (direct air capture) before joining the Carbon13 venture builder as a co-founder of Ki Hydrogen. White City Innovation District Home to world-leading researchers and ground-breaking enterprises working on todays greatest challenges and shaping tomorrows world: https://www.whitecityinnovationdistrict.org.uk/ The DeepTech Network Community If youre a science, tech or engineering business, academic or startup using deep tech to improve our world, and are based around White Citys Innovation District, this event is for you. Free drinks and pizza! Programme 17:30 Registration and networking over refreshments 18:00 Talks begin 19:15 Networking drinks + pizza 20:30: END
1044254071037.description: Imperial College London and Upstream invite you to the White City Innovation District to hear and network with leading deep tech innovators

1044254071037.title: Deep Tech Network - Industry Showcase

1020852496297.summary: St Neots Sports Collective: Progress, Quick Wins, and Vision for the Future Building on the energy and collaboration from our first session, were excited to gather once again at the Citizen Hub to explore the 5 quick wins identified for driving sports development in St Neots. Together, well take practical steps toward building a stronger sports community and ensuring that sports remain a vital part of the towns future. Our focus will be on: Sport Dire ctory : Enhancing visibility by creating a comprehensive directory of all local sports clubs. This resource will help clubs connect with more participants and volunteers, ensuring everyone in the community knows whats available. Wintringham Development: Well discuss how to align future sports facilities with the towns development plans, especially the new Wintringham project. This is a key opportunity to integrate sports into the towns growth, ensuring facilities that support all levels of participation. Landing Page for the Collective: Unveiling the vision and goals for a centralised landing page that will serve as a hub for updates, resources, and the collectives long-term plan. Multi-Sport Day Event: Planning a community-wide event to promote local clubs and encourage participation. This will give residents a chance to try different sports and build connections with local teams. Integration with Education: Strengthening ties between local schools and sports clubs to encourage youth involvement and long-term development. Before we get into that though, we are also thrilled to welcome Xavier Wiggins, co-founder of Sport Local Action and the Dons Local Action Group, as our special guest speaker. Xavier is renowned for using sport as a catalyst for community development and engagement, creating impactful initiatives across the UK. His insights will be invaluable as we look to bring positive change to our local sports ecosystem. Sport Local Action is a national organisation dedicated to harnessing the power of sport to enrich communities, tackle social issues, and drive positive change across the UK. He is also the Co-founder of Dons Local Action Group (DLAG), a grassroots charity that has provided food for over 6 million meals, distributed 3,700 laptops, and delivered thousands of pieces of furniture to those in need across Southwest London. Passionate about the sport for community good sector, Xavier believes in sports unique ability to bring people together and address pressing social challenges like poverty, mental health, and inclusion. As an AFC Wimbledon fan, he follows the team home and away. Xavier is committed to ensuring sport plays a transformative role in building stronger, more resilient communities. Xavier was proud to receive a British Empire Medal (BEM) in the Queen's Birthday Honours List, 2021 for services to the community. Xavier will share his journey in using sports to drive social action, from tackling food poverty to supporting mentoring and environmental projects through sports clubs. His experience will inspire us to think creatively about how we can harness the power of sports to build a more connected and engaged community. Join us for this free event, generously hosted by the St Neots Initiative, as we continue to shape the future of sports in our town. Your input is crucial to making these plans a reality, so come prepared to share your ideas and work together on the next steps. Sport@stneotsinitiative.org.uk
1020852496297.description: Here at the St Neots Sports Collective, we would like to hear about your views and ideas on sport in and around St Neots.
1020852496297.event_address: Citizen Hub 58 Market Square, St Neots, pe19 2AA
1020852496297.title: St Neots Sports Collective October Meetup

1040727342497.summary: Date: November 8th, 2024 Time: 3 :00 PM - 5:00 PM, followed by networking drinks & refreshments Location: IDEALondon, 69 Wilson St, London EC2A 2BB We all know that protecting IP and entering into well-negotiated contracts is vital to the success of an early-stage business. But where do you start? How do you contract for maximum growth and innovation? **If you want the low down on everything involved with protecting your valuable IP in all of the contracts you might need to protect it in- this is the session for you ** Agenda: In this highly practical 60-minute session, we will work through the following: Why is protecting your IP so important? Confidentiality is a key issue, should you disclose confidential information and if you do, how do you ensure that your NDAs actually protect it? Your start-up is only growing from here on out. There are going to be other people, employees and contractors and consultants, helping in the development of the business and perhaps the development of the IP. How can you be sure that no one else ends up with a claim to your IP? What are the key issues and pitfalls in your out-sourcing agreements and consultancy agreements to make sure you retain ownership and control of your IP and new IP that is developed? If youre a university spin-out, then youre unlikely to have ownership of all the IP you need to develop and grow your company. What kind of licence agreement should you expect from the university? What should you be looking for in the grant funding agreements that created the IP in the first place? Collaborations are great, but how do you negotiate the key rights you need when new IP is created? Investor Due Diligence: How can you be sure that youve got the IP rights you need to give investors confidence in your start-up? How to avoid the chaos. If you use any Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning in your company, what are the legal issues and pitfalls to be aware of? Who is this for? This session is for anyone wanting to understand the legal arrangements around intellectual property in contracts and to help their company grow. Speaker Biography Dr Lisa Page is a partner in the intellectual property team who specialises in the life sciences and technology sectors. With a client base ranging from universities, pharmaceutical companies and software companies to digital and biotech start-ups and spin-outs, she advises on all stages of the innovation pathway. She has particular experience in the development stage of new products, covering collaboration, out-licensing and in-licensing arrangements including software licensing, SaaS and software development agreements, including AI. Lisa has a PhD in molecular microbiology and direct practical experience of working in the pharmaceutical industry before re-training as a solicitor. Her scientific background provides a specialist insight into the issues faced by her clients and enables her to speak their language when advising on development programmes and the exploitation of life science technologies. She has held a number of in-house legal roles, including at the Energy Technologies Institute and Coventry University, and is a director of the West Midlands Health Technology Cluster Organisation. ---- About UCL CDI's First Fridays Community Networking evenings Our First Fridays series is designed to empower the UCL CDI community by bringing together experts in academia, industry, and funding bodies to discuss essential topics surrounding funding and business readiness. It's an opportunity for you to gain valuable insights, connect with peers, and tap into the expert know-how that can fuel your entrepreneurial journey. Don't miss this opportunity to kickstart your Autumn'24 First Fridays series with us and set the stage for the November 8th event. Register now to secure your spot for an evening of knowledge-sharing, networking, and collaboration.

955835358287.summary: As a Birth Doula I want to provide a safe space where we sit together to celebrate the pregnant women and mothers in our community. Our main goal is to encourage you to pause, guide you to relax and tune in the intuition while being surrounded by other sensitive women. Become a New Mama - open, trusting and capable. Gatherings take place at The Green Door Centre in Bosham 2pm - 4:30pm . Women are bombarded with information, rules and trends when it comes to all the stages of motherhood. Transition to motherhood, starting as early as researching the options for birth, can feel overwhelming, scary and lonely. We are being taught everything, but how to trust ourselves and tap into our intuition and instincts when it comes to giving birth and raising our children. The aspect that should come so naturally to a woman, when she is in contact with herself and with the world around her. So this is the space to practice exactly that - stop the worlds chattering, learn to relax, filter through the tons of information available and tune into what FEELS right. New Mamas circle is a su pportive community for empathetic women who are passionate about all things motherhood - from fertility and birth, all the way to mothering and finding herself in the new role. This is a child free event, but mamas are welcome to join us with pre crawlers. We meditate, talk about our ideal vision of motherhood and speak our fears and struggles with no interruption, doubt or blame. Its not the place for judgment or advice, but acceptance and encouragement. What is shared in the circle stays there! You leave the circle feeling whole, powerful and part of a beautiful community. We will be building on the knowledge from one Circle to the other, but I planned all the New Mamas Circles so that they can be attended independently and in any order, before or after birth. If you want to reserve a space for all 6 Circles for 185 (instead of 210) or book a FREE ticket* space, get in touch . *FREE tickets are available at the baby fairs I attend - follow me on Instagram or subscribe to my Email linst to find out about the next one.
955835358287.description: A special kind of women's circle, where we sit together to celebrate and witness the pregnant women in our community.
955835358287.title: New Mama's Circle

1012989768667.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Your Volunteer Hosts Chris has a background in Green Chemistry and has worked in the environmental consultancy and FMCG fields. Currently, Chris works as the Environmental Social Governance Manager for Chelsea FC where his role is to work across the business to develop and deliver the club's sustainability roadmap, embed ESG into the staff culture and communicate success. Chris is incredibly passionate about all things sustainability and has experience in Carbon footprint calculations, delivering emissions reductions, BCORP certification, offsetting, and setting Net Zero targets for a business. Chris is also certified Carbon Literate and hopes to talk ESG to individuals across a wide range of industries. Guy is a keen skier and avid reader that has recently made the leap over to a sustainability-focused organisation, Position Green. Guy has a background in sport and travel and kicked off his sustainability journey in the Green Steering Group at Chelsea Football Club. To help his transition to a green tech business, Guy studied with the Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership, the GHG Protocol and GRI, and also signed up to become an IEMA Associate member.

976101635267.summary: We are delighted to be launching our new Welwyn Garden City WIBN group. Networking is all about building relationships. When you make a purchasing decision quite often people look at the recommendations of others who have already purchased before they buy and networking works on the same basis. Get to know the people in your group, find out about them and their businesses and explore how you can collaborate and help each other out. There are plenty of opportunities to network with 80 groups in the UK and 6 national online-only groups within WIBN and our social media platforms have a reach of over 60,000. Come along and see what WIBN networking is all about. We wont pressure you into joining but we will assure you of a warm welcome and some great connections. Heres what some of our visitors have said:- I really enjoyed yesterday. Much more than I thought I would if Im honest! You are all so knowledgeable and insightful. Its all so new to me and its great to feel Im in the company of those who are experienced in business in the ways you all are. Ive never done any anything like this in my 25 years of business, only training courses, I love the way the lockdown encouraged us to stretch out a bit and take new pathways. Networking is a long-term investment, and the rewards are priceless - both from a work and personal perspective. You dont have to be part of a corporate business to benefit from networking, we have a wide variety of businesswomen in the network. Some members are employed by businesses whilst others run their own. Some are full-time, some part-time and all sorts of professions are represented. We would love to meet you and here about what you do so please do take the plunge and book in a visit!

1038832334477.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Your Volunteer Hosts Anne Barrett started Climate Confidence to help small business owners feel empowered about combating climate change. She uses the Small99 Action Box, Carbon Reduction Fundamentals to help business teams develop an action plan for carbon reductions. She is also a Fresk facilitator, running workshops to help with understanding the causes and effects of climate change, also with the outcome of a plan for reducing carbon emissions. Shes proud to live in the London Borough of Lewisham. Fiona Caldwell swapped a career in TV for a new life at WRAP, a global NGO working to reduce food, textile and plastic waste and promote circularity. Among other things, she helps plan their annual summit event bringing businesses, govt and campaigners together to build a low carbon future. Prior to that she spent 20 years crafting award-winning films for everyone from the BBC to Netflix and particularly enjoyed promoting a green agenda as producer of the Channel 4 series Grand Designs. Shes also a regular for The Conservation Volunteers and can often be found building dead hedges in patches of woodland in north London (although she is a committed south London resident!)

980728233547.summary: Join our substack https://northlondonwriterscircle.substack.com/ Welcome to our script and screenplay writing circle! Open to anyone writing scripts, screenplays, pitch decks etc who wants to be part of a supportive community for feedback, advice and general navigating the industry. This is a place to discuss ideas, ask for help and guidance, and share career wins and goals! Each meet-up we will look at three samples of work from our members (first come first served for slots). Format: 20 mins share updates/wins/queries 30 mins feedback/workshop slot 1 10 mins break 30 mins feedback/workshop slot 2 30 mins feedback/workshop slot 3 LOCATION: Most of our sessions take place at The French Market, with every third session in a different location - for December 11th we will have a festive party! TICKETS: We are grateful to be supported by The French Market, who have kindly given us their welcoming space for our meets and help us avoid costs - we encourage everyone attending to consider purchasing something delicious while you're there! Tickets are free, donations appreciated which go toward our other running costs. We suggest a 2-5 donation. Spaces are limited so please reserve. If you can no longer make it please contact us so we can release the space to somebody else. Workshopping slots are allocated in advance of the event (usually at the end of the previous event) - if you would like to workshop please drop us a message. WORKSHOPPING: Workshop slots are thirty minutes long. The workshop slot can be used in whatever way is most beneficial to you - reading through a script is most popular, but you could also bring a pitch deck, a synopsis, practise pitching a script to the group etc. SPACE: This will be an inclusive and intentional space. Open to all but particularly hoping to support PoC / LGBTQIA+ / Disabled friends, and generally anyone navigating an industry not inherently set up for them.

727415518397.summary: Build your business and grow your connections via our networking events exclusively for women in business in and around the Marlow area **PLEASE NOTE** At WIBN we have a one person professional category rule ; please contact vicki.messenger@wibn.co.uk BEFORE BOOKING to check the availability of your professional category. Are you a driven businesswoman or a professional female looking to grow your network? Women in Business Network (WIBN) is the UK's leading professional women's networking organisation, focused on building our member's businesses through collaborative, supportive, and engaging networking, over a business brunch or lunch. Our events are hosted once a month and follow a structured format so you get the most from your time with us. For further information and booking queries about the Reading Group, and our other WIBN Groups within the Thames Valley and online, please CLICK HERE . Here is an idea of what happens during our meetings: Open Networking - to build relationships with like-minded businesswomen Monthly Minutes - your chance to share with the room more about you and your business and ask for introductions and support for the coming month Member Spotlight we get to know one member per month either through an interview or mastermind session Business Topic - a value-adding presentation from one of our members, or a business coaching exercise to help you move you and your business forwards Lets Talk Business everyones chance to pass referrals, request 1-2-1s, or share testimonials Our WIBN meetings are focused, supportive, and aimed at helping you build your network, and grow your business alongside an incredible group of motivated women, who in time can recommend your business with their contacts. We provide a light business lunch, or brunch (depending on the event), and refreshments, which are included in your visitor fee. Dietary requirements and food choices (if applicable) are requested ahead of the event. PLEASE NOTE: At WIBN we have a one person per professional category rule; please contact vicki.messenger@wibn.co.uk prior to booking to check the availability of your professional category. We are so looking forward to welcoming you at our upcoming meeting, and please do get in touch if you have any questions prior to booking! Many thanks, Vicki
727415518397.description: Build your business and grow your connections via our networking events exclusively for women in business in and around the Reading area
727415518397.title: WIBN Reading Women's In-Person Networking Event

1014072156117.summary: LONDON - Mama Shelter, Shoreditch Monthly Topic: Utlising AI in Business H osted by: Rosie Farrer Our October networking topic is utilising AI in business, join us for an engaging networking event where we explore how AI can be your best ally in business. In this session, you'll discover how to use AI prompts to pinpoint your ideal clients and define the transformative impact your business can have. Expect insightful discussions, practical exercises, and valuable connections. Dont miss this opportunity to see how AI can become one of the biggest assets in your business. Join the Inner Circle: Are you a woman in business looking for a supportive community to help you connect, grow, and learn? As an Inner Circle member, you can attend as many of our networking hubs as you like for FREE! This includes our hubs across Auckland, NZ, Australia and the UK. Enjoy unlimited access to our netwokring events and take full advantage of the community and networking opportunities. Join the Inner Circle Join the Inner Circle to unlock even more benefits: Monthly Masterclasses : Learn from industry experts on topics that will elevate your business and mindset. Accountability Calls : Stay on track with our supportive community and achieve your goals. Personal Branding Opportunities : Create your own masterclasses and shine as an expert. Exclusive Discounts : Enjoy special rates on Empower Her events and live workshops. Vibrant Community : Share your journey, get support, and celebrate your successes with empowering women. Join the Inner Circle now and become part of a wonderful community of women in business who are ready to build their dream life and business. Empower Her is a female networking group, based in New Zealand, that offers a welcoming and safe environment for women of all business backgrounds and experiences. Whether you're just starting out with new business ideas or have years of experience under your belt, all are welcome! Empower Her provides a safe space where you can share your business with others, connect with like-minded women in business, and prioritise collaboration over competition. Our groups value the power of connection, and we believe that together, we can achieve more than we ever could alone. That's why we're committed to fostering a supportive community that empowers each member to reach their full potential. Our groups are focused on connection, inspiring stories, celebrating each other's successes and sharing our vulnerable moments. Join our free community The Inner Circle Follow us on Instagram Empower Her Co-Founders Victoria and Charlotte are highly passionate and dedicated to empowering female leaders in the business world. By joining Empower Her, you will not only expand your professional network but also gain access to a supportive community of like-minded individuals who are committed to helping each other succeed. Find out more about us and check up our upcoming events on our website .
1014072156117.description: Empower Her female networking group that offers a welcoming and safe environment for women of all business backgrounds and experiences
1014072156117.title: London - Empower Her Networking - Women in Business October - AI

918668471127.summary: Do you desire to feel: Seen, heard, connected, valued. A women's circle is an intentional space for you to come together with other women to feel connected, there is extraordinary healing impacts of women coming together and women have been gathering for centuries. This circle is a safe space for you to unlock your inner blocks that are preventing you from living life as the true you Explore who you really are, when you are not "doing all your duties" as a woman Tap into aspects of you that have been hidden Feel connected to other women and know that you are not alone in your challenges Do you long for a space to just be you, to explore who you are and feel empowered and reveal your inner confidence. This nurturing intentional space is created lovingly for you. Bring yourself, a pen and journal, a cosy blanket to get comfy and a small offering for the middle of the circle, a flower from your garden, or something small that means something to you. Every 1st Monday of the month There will be complimentary herbal tea for you too! Note on Location: The shop does not have a sign saying "Brown Books" it will say 33@77 it has a green shop front. See two pics below. the shop number is 77 High Town Road.
