896276135047.summary: The conference is gearing up to provide attendees with seminal insights for some of the hotspot topics centred on HVDC and submarine power cable for a successful operation within a digitally shifted landscape across different countries. The forum is scheduled to explore the innovative tools and techniques that have been developed as a result of the growing demand for subsea power cables and interconnection. These cables are most common to transfer electricity from renewable energy sources including wind, wave and tidal. Findings has proven that the subsea cable market is currently increasing and extensively booming. Recent years have seen a significant increase in the use, length and capacity of submarine power cables in various sectors. In the offshore wind sector, for example, an important driver behind this increase is the transition to renewable energy resources. Any failure in such a submarine cable has a huge impact and repair costs are immense due to the inaccessible locations and specialised resources required. Submarine Power Cable and Interconnection Forum will bring together more than 70 senior practitioners and industry experts from across the sector to help identify and understand Submarine Installation processes and systems, Submarine Cable Failure reduction techniques, Recognizing smart solutions to subsea power cable needs and Identifying the major costs and risk reduction techniques in connection with submarine cables. These main market players will share their ideas and experience throughout the 2-day case studies, interactive plenaries, workshops, networking & experience exchange. The small-scale nature of the event, expert speakers and balanced spectrum of attending companies will ensure extensive networking and business opportunities as all attendees will have an opportunity for deep involvement and can actively participate in the discussions in order to overcome relevant challenges and have influence on the overall industry development. The submarine power cable and interconnection forum 2024 has been touted as a significant milestone in an effort to strengthen as well as streamline submarine power cable as well as interconnection related aspects. It is going to the fourth annual submarine power cable and interconnection events 2024. The event it slated to roll out for the time limit of 12th November to 13th November of 2024. A great deal of technical stuff will be discussed in the offshore cable event 2024. For example, the discussion of the forum will revolve around interconnections, cable faults, cable designs as well as cable installation processes etc. Electricity interconnections will be a lot easier and convenient for you to avail as well as operate. Participants in the Offshore power cable conference will highlight various measures that would let you know about various aspects of the submarine power cable and interconnection facilities. The purpose The entire purpose of the submarine power cable and interconnection events 2024 comes to be treated as an epoch making one for sure. The focus has an impeccable role to play when it comes to the development of the clean energy resources. There is going to be another focus area of the submarine power cable and interconnection conference in London, United Kingdom. It will continue to lay stress on the problem zone of the subsea communities.
896276135047.description: The forum has been touted as a significant milestone in an effort to strengthen and streamline submarine power cable interconnection aspect
896276135047.event_address: Hilton London Heathrow Airport, Hounslow, TW6 3AF
896276135047.title: 4th Annual Submarine Power Cable And Interconnection Forum

1036704560247.summary: Join us for an evening in London with guest speaker Lewis Gillhespy, Rockflow at Bentley Systems state-of-the-art facility on Bishopsgate. By bringing together Lewis and Bentley, the evening will successfully connect the roadmap for digital transformation with the art of the possible once you reach that goal. Lewis Gillhespy will offer a presentation detailing the successful digital transformation of a multi-asset upstream energy business this will be followed by an exclusive demonstration from Bentley Systems. Lewis Gillhespy has an impressive 20+ year career, marked by progressively influential leadership roles at Suncor Energy, a leading multinational E&P and mining company. His passion lies in the application of Lean Management and Continuous Improvement principles to simplify processes, data, and technology, which is increasingly sought after by clients looking to thrive in the digital age. Executives from Bentley will provide a brief overview of its software portfolio and user base across energy infrastructure, including a short demonstration of digital twin technology can provide real-time insights, enhance decision-making, and optimize asset performance. This event is for energy professionals keen to explore how the digitization of big data can drive efficiencies across the sector, with a particular focus on reducing costs and optimizing performance. Our speakers will provide a unique opportunity to gain valuable insights into the future of energy management.
1036704560247.description: Join us for an evening in London with guest speaker Lewis Gillhespy, Rockflow at Bentley Systems state-of-the-art facility on Bishopsgate.

848309605867.summary: Moving from action to delivery: fulfilling the transition to a decarbonised future Date: Thu Nov 21 2024 Time: 09:00 AM GMT Location: University of Warwick Taking the theme Moving from action to delivery: fulfilling the transition to a decarbonised future, this years Forum continues to track the evolution of decarbonisation, with sessions focused on The Conversation, The Delivery and The Future. The programme includes a trade association takeover panel, Conversations with Councils networking, an under 30s panel discussion from a group of rising stars alongside sessions on the future of energy, the changing face of EV charging and the influence of market disrupters. The agenda will include top-flight presentations, lively panel discussions and TEF (Transport + Energy Forum) Talks, our very own version of TED! Alongside the speaker line up, there will be ample networking sessions to facilitate collaboration. We are excited to announce our fresh, new venue for the Forum this year, having outgrown our original location in Central Birmingham. Warwick Conferences is part of the University of Warwick, which reflects our work with WMG, a department at the university who weve allied with on our T+E Skills initiative. As an added extra for delegates staying overnight, WMG will be lifting the lid on their key departments, with a tour of their innovation, manufacturing, apprenticeship and engineering facilities on Friday 22 November from 10:00-12:00. The tour will give delegates the opportunity to meet specialists in materials, batteries, laser welding, CT scanning and metrology. Transport + Energy Awards will take place in the evening of the Forum, recognising the brightest and best projects, collaborations, tech solutions, innovation, individual and team achievements.

857949288417.summary: What they said: I wish I'd had this training years ago! A language for exploring and discussing organisational issues issues that aren't only process-related Found the ideas of context and awareness tied well into managing different relationships This rounds out organisational change aspects any serious practitioner should know Really related to Organising at Human Scale; Energised by the mapping exercises before and after it Previously known as "Leading in a Transforming Organisation" and run in London, Berlin, Melbourne, Manchester, this is three modules of Leading with Outcomes as an integrated, workshop-style training experience: Day 1. Leading with Outcomes: Foundation Day 2. Adaptive Organisation (I): Business agility at every scale Day 3. Adaptive Organisation (II): Between spaces, scopes, and scales We'll be exploring what it means to lead in an organisation where change is happening wherever it's needed, at the pace it's needed, and engaging the people who are needed everyone whose energy, insights, and innovations you'll need. On day 1 (Foundation) we look at how to develop and pursue strategy in the language of outcomes, introducing some key conversational and organisational patterns and tools. You'll be developing skills you can not only bring to set-piece strategy events such as reviews and workshops but apply in everyday settings too. On days 2 and 3 (Adaptive Organisation parts I and II), we will be exercising those skills further as we get to grips with a classic and powerful model of organisation that we've made accessible and brought up to date, applicable to organisations of all shapes and sizes. For any given organisational scale (day 2), what are the preconditions for business agility, and what gets in the way of that? Similarly, in what practical ways can we help the relationships between organisational scales (day 3) to be more healthy and productive? You'll be learning some of the deep magic of organising how to understand it in terms of relationships and constraints and you won't look at organisations in quite the same way again! Audience You can approach Leading in a Transforming Organisation in complementary ways: As a workshop, an opportunity to explore how your organisation (or your client organisation) works and how you might influence that As leadership development, participants invited for their growth potential As technical training, participants attending out of interest in the models covered Per the final section below, as a near-alternative to Leading with Outcomes: Train-the-Trainer / Facilitator If any of those speak to you, you're invited! Venue The event will be held at Barclays Eagle Labs, Southampton, close to Southampton Station and with several hotels within walking distance. Trainer This training will be led by Agendashift founder Mike Burrows , creator of Leading with Outcomes, and four-time (and soon five-time) author: Organizing Conversations: Preparing Groups to Take on Adaptive Challenges (BMI series in Dialogic OD, 2024) Agendashift: Outcome-oriented change and continuous transformation (2nd edition 2021) Right to Left: The digital leader's guide to Lean and Agile (2019, audiobook 2020) Kanban from the Inside (2014) And to come: Wholehearted: Engaging with complexity in the Deliberately Adaptive Organisation (2025) Included free On completion, course participants gain free access to the following for 1 year: Agendashift Academy Subscriber personal access to Leading with Outcomes training in self-paced video form Leading with Outcomes Authorised Facilitator access to workshop materials and the Agendashift assessment tools Upgrade at any time to Leading with Outcomes Authorised Trainer for training materials and the ability to certify training completion and workshop participation. Visit the Agendashift Academy's Store page for further information about these programmes.
857949288417.description: Engaging with complexity in the Deliberately Adaptive Organisation a 21st-century take on a classic model.
857949288417.title: Leading for Innovation in the Knowledge Economy (Southampton)

1000645346167.summary: Spend a special day at the Science Oxford Centre. Visit the Exploration Zone, woodland and outdoor Water Lab and meet researchers, scientists and presenters! Brighton Science Festival Oxford Health Histories Oxford has a long and captivating history of medicine and healthcare! Travel back in time to uncover surprising tales of medical discovery and intrigue such as the strange case of Anne Greene who was resurrected on the dissecting table. Explore the more uncomfortable and lesser-known aspects of medical history, and take home worksheets to continue the journey at your own pace! Oxford Health Histories (University of Oxford) & Uncomfortable Oxford Star power: energy for the future What happens inside the sun? How can you contain a star? Why do scientists want to make a star anyway? Discover how magnets, robots and the fourth state of matter come together to make a star here on Earth and why fusion could be so important in our world of increasing energy demand. UKAEA

944879298417.summary: ICITM has been an annual event. The ICITM 2025 Conference will build on the success of the previous conferences.We welcome you to attend 2025 the 13th International Conference on Industrial Technology and Management that to be held in Cambridge, UK during March 26-28, 2025. ICITM Conferences look for significant contributions to all major fields of the Industrial Technology and Management in the oretical and practical aspects. The aim of the conference is to provide a platform to the researchers and practitioners from both academia as well as industry to meet and share cutting-edge development in the field. It will provide an excellent international forum for sharing knowledge and results in theory, methodology and applications of Industrial Technology and Management. Call for paper: Topics of interest include, but are not limited to: Track 1: Industrial Automation, Communication, Networking and Informatics Track 2: Control Systems, Robotics and Mechatronics Track 3: Electrical Machines and Drives Track 4: Power Electronics and Renewable Energy Conversion Track 5: Power Systems and Smart Grids Track 6: Sensors, Actuators and MicroNanotechnology Track 7: Cloud Computing, Big Data and Software Engineering Track 8: Electronic Systems on Chip and Embedded Control Track 9: Signal and Image Processing and Computational Intelligence Track 10: Production Management Track 11: Advanced Production Management Methodologies Track 12: Project Management Track 13: Research and Development Track 14: Quantitative Analysis in Industrial Management Track 15: Artificial Intelligence and Information Technology in Industrial Management Track 16: Practice and Experiences in Industrial Management Track 17: Digital Factory Track 18: Energy and Environment Management For details about topics, please visit at http://www.icitm.org/cfp.html Publication: Accepted papers with proper registration and presentation will be published in below listed journals collection. Papers will be sent for indexing services. IJEETC: International Journal of Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Telecommunications. Indexing: Scopus (since 2017), Google Scholar, Crossref, etc. IJMERR: International Journal of Mechanical Engineering and Robotics Research. Indexing: Scopus, CNKI, Google Scholar, Crossref, etc. JAIT: Journal of Advances in Information Technology. Indexing: ESCI (Web of Science), Scopus, CNKI, etc. IJIMT: International Journal of Innovation, Management and Technology. Indexing: Google Scholar, CNKI, Ulrich's Periodicals Directory, Crossref, Electronic Journals Library. JOAMS: Journal of Advanced Management Science. Indexing: CNKI, Google Scholar, Crossref. Submission: Full submission should be at least 4 full pages, and within 12 pages. Official language is English in paper writing and presenting. Paper/Abstract for oral presentation only must be submitted with abstract, too. Submission System: https://www.zmeeting.org/submission/icitm2025 Paper Template: https://www.icitm.org/template.doc More details about submission, please via: http://www.icitm.org/sub.html Conference Schedule: Day 1, March 26, 2025 Check in for ICITM 2025 and Conference Material Collection Day 2, March 27, 2025 09:00 18:00 Opening Remarks & Keynote Speech & & Plenary Speech & ICITM Parallel Sessions Day 3, March 28, 2025 09:00 16:45 ICITM Parallel Sessions Cambridge, United Kingdom: Abounding with exquisite architecture, exuding history and tradition, and renowned for its quirky rituals, Cambridge is a university town extraordinaire. The tightly packed core of ancient colleges, the picturesque riverside 'Backs' (college gardens) and the leafy green meadows surrounding the city give it a more tranquil appeal than its historic rival Oxford. Like 'the Other Place', as Oxford is known locally, the buildings here seem unchanged for centuries, and it's possible to wander around the college buildings and experience them as countless prime ministers, poets, writers and scientists have done. Sheer academic achievement seems to permeate the very walls: cyclists loaded down with books negotiate cobbled passageways, students relax on manicured lawns and great minds debate life-changing research in historic pubs. First-time punters zigzag erratically across the river, and those long past their student days wonder what it would have been like to study in such splendid surroundings. Contact: Secretary Assistant: Ms. Eileen Wu E-mail: icitm_icitm@outlook.com
944879298417.description: Get ready for the 13th International Conference on Industrial Technology and Management - it's going to be a blast!
944879298417.title: 13th International Conference on Industrial Technology and Management ICITM

929630859927.summary: This course has been designed for learners from a heating background (wet central heating systems) and covers the Installation and Maintenance of Air Source Heat Pumps Systems (non-refrigerant circuits). Attendees will learn: Core Unit 2 days: What a heat pump is, the principle of the vapour compression system and system components. The different operational characteristics of each type of heat pump unit and system arrangement. The fundamental principles of heat pump efficiency and design selection that are common for heat pumps. The learner will know the fundamental principles of domestic hot water cylinder selection and system design that are common for heat pumps. The fundamental principles of hydraulic system design that are common for heat pumps. The fundamental principles of heat pump controls. How to plan and prepare for the installation of heat pumps. The requirements to install and test heat pump systems. The requirements to commission heat pump system installations. The requirements to handover heat pump system installations. The requirements for the handover of a heat pump installation The requirements for routine service and maintenance of a heat pump system installation. Undertake fault diagnosis work on a heat pump system installation. Air Source Unit 1 day: The preparatory work required for the installation of an air source heat pump. The common requirements for the installation of an air source heat pump connected to hydraulic emitter circuits. Install heat pump units (non-refrigeration units). How to test and commission an air source heat pump system (non-refrigerant circuits). How to undertake the non-refrigerant circuit routine service and maintenance of an air source heat pump system (non-refrigerant circuits).
929630859927.description: Learn all about Air Source Heat Pump Systems (Non-Refrigerant Circuits) at our in-person event discover how these energy-efficient systems
929630859927.title: Air Source Heat Pump Systems (Non-Refrigerant Circuits)

1043873412477.summary: The UK and the EU both see hydrogen as essential to achieving net zero and both have extensive and well-funded policies to support it. Yet progress is far too slow. Green hydrogen represents less than 1% of total production and still costs 6-14 times more than grey hydrogen. Only a tiny fraction of green or blue hydrogen projects have reached final investment decision. In many proposed applications, hydrogen is being eclipsed by electrification. But in other areas, hydrogen and its derivatives still look like the best or possibly only option: fertilizer, shipping, jet aviation and long-duration grid balancing. Whats more, regardless of the higher production costs of cleaner forms of hydrogen, its system benefits in terms of greater energy security and lower overall energy system costs still look potentially enormous. It is therefore time to take stock. Both the UK and the EU need to ask what their policy is getting wrong and whether they could make faster progress, and at lower cost, by working together. In 2024, HyDEX (Hydrogen Development and Knowledge Exchange) and ERA (Energy Research Accelerator) held a series of summits in Brussels and London where academics, policymakers and industrialists examined the issue of hydrogen collaboration between the UK and EU. At this FREE event at the Institution of Mechanical Engineers in London, ERA and HyDEX will be launching their 'UK-EU Hydrogen Policy Report' with a host of speakers from industry and the public sector, outlining the case for UK-EU collaboration, with specific recommendations to develop hydrogen infrastructure, markets and policy.
1043873412477.description: The UK and EU both see hydrogen as essential to achieving net zero, yet progress is slow. Faster progress is possible by working together.
1043873412477.title: Hydrogen: The case for UK-EU Collaboration, London

1003107259817.summary: Women make up more than half of would-be lawyers graduating from law school and while women are well represented in law firms - they make up over half of lawyers in law firms - the underrepresentation of women becomes more apparent at senior levels, and many leave the industry at Associate level. But retaining female talent is key to ensuring not simply diversity in law firms, but fresh perspectives, clearer thinking, innovation, collaboration, and trust as well. Lawyers, law firms, businesses, and organisations need to open access to a wide and diverse pool of talent at entry level, and provide support, sponsorship, and working flexibility to remove the structural barriers that cause women lawyers to leave their professions before they are ready to do so. The discussion will be based on personal experiences in the legal profession, looking at some of the most pressing issues faced by women in law today. Agenda Guests arrival from 5.30pm to 6pm 6pm Introductions to Panel One Moderator - Jennifer Keogh - Of Counsel at DLA Piper Future Leaders Panellists Amy Marren MBE PLY - Double Paralympian and Solicitor Apprentice Afrose Ameen - Law Student and Renewable Energy Engineer Isabella McWilliams - Law Student at University of Surrey Darcey Cunningham - Solicitor Apprentice at CMS UK Alix Dalton - Sustainability Regulatory Lawyer at EY Law Hayley Kinsey - Sustainability Associate at DLA Piper Chloe Harper - 1st Class Honours Law LLB Graduate, Risk and Compliance Associate at Kindleworth LLP 6.40pm to 7.10pm Moderator - Anna Mills - Partner, Solicitor, Barrister at DLA Piper Today's Leaders & Role Model Panellists Fiona Reilly (FEI, Hon FNucI) - CEO at FiRe Energy , Chair, NED, Strategy & Board Advisor and Consultant. Fiona is an Energy & Infrastructure specialist with over 20 years of experience encompassing nuclear, oil & gas, renewables and thermal power. She is often involved in large scale energy & infrastructure projects, particularly the development, structuring, international regulatory development and compliance, licensing and financing (most recently on the renewable energy project Atlantic SuperConnection). She is recognized as an expert in the development and financing of nuclear projects by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) and has served as a designated expert on the financing, development and structuring of nuclear projects at special meetings of the IAEA. She has also served as an IAEA expert on decommissioning and waste management issues, chaired technical meetings, and sits on IAEA committees. She is also designated as Expert by the International Framework for Nuclear Energy Cooperation (IFNEC) and the International Project on Innovative Nuclear Reactors and Fuel Cycles (INPRO). Previously Fiona was Partner and Global Head of Nuclear Services at law firm Norton Rose Fulbright before moving away from the law to join PriceWaterhouse Coopers (PwC) as Global Nuclear Lead for Capital Projects and Infrastructure. She now has her own Energy Consultancy Practice FiRe Energy Julia Pyke FEI, HonFNucl - Joint Managing Director at Sizewell C . With over 15 years of experience advising infrastructure and energy projects around the world, Julia joined EDF Energy in July 2017 to focus on Hinkley Point C, Sizewell C, Bradwell B and the decommissioning of advanced gas-cooled reactors. Prior to her present role, Julia led a cross-practice team advising on power projects as Partner and Head of Power and Renewables for UK, US & Europe at Herbert Smith Freehills LLP, focusing on defence, nuclear decommissioning and transport projects. Julia is now working with Government to identify an innovative way for Sizewell C to be funded at best value to electricity consumers, and with potential investors. Michelle T. Davies - EY Global Sustainability Legal Services Leader; Partner, Law, Ernst & Young LLP. Michelle is qualified as a solicitor in England and Wales and as an attorney in New York. She is a Fulbright Scholar and a John Rankin Scholar with a first class LLB from UCL and an LLM from UC Berkeley. Michelle has been granted industry recognition including being listed as a leader in renewables by 'The Lawyer Hot 100 Lawyers, being named Solar Woman of the Year for MENA by the Middle East Solar Industry Association (MESIA), being invited to the UK Governments POWERful Women Group and named for the last 3 years as being one of the top 100 people in global wind power and one of the top women in global wind power by A Word About Wind. She is on the Advisory Boards of the Climate Bond Initiative and Dii and other key bodies and Chairs the REA Finance Group and Climate Change Committee Advisory Group. Dana Denis-Smith - CEO of Obelisk Support | B Corp Certified and founder of the First 100 Years campaign. In 2018, she was voted Legal Personality of the Year. In 2019, she was awarded the Outstanding Achievement in Legal Services by the Legal 500. In 2020, she was recognised for her work as a women's advocate and champion of gender equality with the Special Contribution Award at the Women in Law Awards. Dana was shortlisted in the 2022 FT Innovative Lawyers Europe awards, and was awarded her second honorary doctorate in laws from the University of Glasgow in recognition for her contribution, achievements and positive impact on the legal profession in June 2022 Carol Cloughley - Head Of Legal Solar, Storage & Private Wire at EDF Renewables UK & Ireland. Previously, Carol held the position of Legal Director (London) with international law firm Bird & Bird in their Energy & Utilities sector group. In 2022, she was voted as one of the Top 40 Women Leaders in Energy Storage, by Energy Storage Report Natasha Luther Jones - Partner, International Head of Sustainability and ESG Global Co-Chair, Energy and Natural Resources Sector at DLA Piper Natasha has over 20 years' experience of helping a range of clients with renewable energy (with a particular focus on wind, solar and storage) and other energy transition projects in the UK and internationally. Natasha advises on developments, investments, financings, refinancings, acquisitions, disposals, and all the key project documentations (EPCs, O&Ms, service agreements and PPAs). She works with developers, contractors, equity investors, purchasers, sellers, utilities and off-takers in respect of the development, construction and operation of energy transition projects. 7.10pm to 7.30pm - Audience Q&A Session to all Panellists 7.30pm to 9pm - Drinks Reception, Networking & General Conviviality
1003107259817.description: Women Powering Smart Energy in collaboration with DLA Piper. 2x Panel Discussions, Audience Q&A, Drinks Reception and Networking
1003107259817.title: Young Lawyers - Future Leaders in Law

1000765264847.summary: In 2009 Fiona Candlin and Raiford Guins collaborated on The Object Reader (Routledge). Since then, they have individually pursued diverse research on the histories of objects, curation, design, and disposal. This conversation brings Fiona and Raiford together again with their longstanding collaborator, interlocutor, and friend Joanne Morra to discuss their current work in progress on the afterlife of objects: Fiona is currently driving around the UK visiting closed museums for her new book on the subject, while Raiford is on a world tour of video game museums researching his next book, Museum Games: Journeys in Search of Playable Media . Both are investigating the process of collecting, exhibiting, experiencing, caring for, and scrapping objects. They share a mutual fascination with where stuff goes. Jo and Ray were Founding Principal Editors of Journal of Visual Culture (2001-2019), and previously worked together on the journal Parallax . Fiona and Jo read each others material. Joanne Morra is Professor of Art and Culture and Programmes Research Director at Central Saint Martins, University of the Arts London. She writes on contemporary art and psychoanalysis. Her publications include Inside the Freud Museums: History, Memory and Site-Responsive Art (IB Tauris, 2018), Intimacy Unguarded ( JVAP , co-edited with Emma Talbot, 2017). She is now working on a book provisionally titled Holding Art: Women and Radical Care . Raiford Guins is Professor & Chair of Cinema and Media Studies in the Media School and Adjunct Professor in the Luddy School of Informatics, Computing, and Engineering at Indiana University, Bloomington. He is the author of Feeling Leeds: Notes on Loving a Football Club from Afar (Pitch Publications, 2022), Atari Design: Impressions on Coin-Operated Video Game Machines (Bloomsbury, 2020) , Game After: A Cultural Study of Video Game Afterlife (MIT 2014), and Edited Clean Version: Technology and the Culture of Control (Minnesota, 2009) . Guins also co-edits MIT Presss Game Histories book series with Henry Lowood. His newest book, Changing the Game: How Ataris Pong Bounced Across Markets to Make Million s, is forthcoming with MIT Press in 2026. Fiona Candlin is Professor of Museology and Director of the Mapping Museum Lab at Birkbeck, University of London. She is author of Art, Museums and Touch (Manchester University Press 2010), Micromuseology (Bloomsbury 2016), and Stories from Small Museums (Manchester University Press 2022). Her new book is provisionally titled Stories of Closed Museums . For information contact Katy Pettit k.pettit@bbk.ac.uk or mappingmuseums@bbk.ac.uk
1000765264847.description: Fiona Candlin and Raiford Guins discuss their current work in progress on the afterlife of objects with Joanne Morra
1000765264847.event_address: 27 Torrington Square Clore Lecture Theatre, London, WC1E 7JL
1000765264847.title: Afterlives of Objects

981828384127.summary: This October, Pitchflix in partnership with mediaforgrowth is transforming the fundraising landscape for Seed to Series-B B2C startups as well as B2B enablers for the consumer sector. rev: Consumer Investors taking center stage We're flipping the script on the traditional pitch, with 15 groundbreaking reverse pitches from the industry's leading and emerging VCs. If youre a Seed to Series-B consumer startup or B2B enabler for the consumer sector currently fundraising or looking to fundraise in the next 6-9 months, you simply cannot afford to miss this event! Why rev? Pitching to VCs takes a chunk of time and loads of energy, and every rejection takes a little chip out of the soul, as an entrepreneur, you'd better be pitching to the right investors! As a startup founder, you have hundreds of other things to do, so weve structured rev to deliver fast, efficient insights to make the best use of your time. What happens at rev? rev is more than finding alignment with a VC's investment thesis, it's about finding where your personalities and chemistry resonate. We're here to help you discover the right investors efficiently. Each VC has five minutes to pitch, followed by your questions. Afterwards, immerse yourself in networking and leave a lasting impression! What do you mean by Consumer Investor We define a consumer investor as someone who invests in businesses across diverse sectors including but not limited to traditional CPG brands, whose technologies and innovations have mass consumer appeal e.g. the Creator Economy. We welcome VCs, CVCs, Angel Investors/Syndicates and other finance providers backing DTC/e-commerce startups including debt financing, media capital, revenue share, working capital, and other innovation capital solutions. We have a limited number of investor-speaking slots. If youre a consumer VC, CVC, e-commerce/DTC finance provider including debt financing and brave enough to pitch in front of 100+ founders, please register with this link , and well coordinate with you. By presenting at rev, you're not just gaining access to a select group of founders, you're contributing to a larger mission. Together we can eliminate the "spray and pray" approach to fundraising, and foster more meaningful and productive connections that benefit both founders and funders. More about the organisers About Pitchflix Pitchflix is your investor network powered by pitch videos. Investors can discover investment opportunities across the startup ecosystem from the UK and internationally, and founders can look for their future investors on the platform. Video provides a richer experience and more efficient review process for investors compared to a pitch deck. About mediaforgrowth (MFG) mediaforgrowth is a global media capital data platform specialising in media for equity fundraising. They are the go-to platform for growth-stage founders to amplify reach, and finance mass-media advertising costs; for media companies to attract a new category of advertisers and diversify cash flows; and for investors, to deploy capital in MFG-curated businesses alongside strategic media partners. They run Media Capital Fundraising Programmes for Series A consumer internet companies to optimise their first media capital fundraise. MFG alumni companies have secured up to $17M in media capital commitments from MFG media investors. For more information about upcoming editions, please visit https://www.mediaforgrowth.co/fundraising-programme .
981828384127.description: Leading and emerging Consumer Investors showcase their propositions to investment-ready Seed to. Series-B B2C and B2B2C founders.
981828384127.title: rev London Consumer Investors Pitch Event - powered by mediaforgrowth

1043964143857.summary: Climate change has disastrous consequences for the natural water cycles in South Asia and the Indus basin, leading to frequent floods and droughts, elevated food & energy insecurity, and the depletion of critical water resources. For communities, the availability of timely information about uncertain hydrometeorological variables has become extremely important for achieving high crop water productivity, signaling the onset of heatwaves, and the early warning of floods & droughts. Hidden state variables such as soil moisture, snow depth, and local meteorology provide critical insights for attributing extreme events to climate change. In light of these needs, we summarize our work on indigenously building large-scale earth observation networks using a fusion of many technologies and with the participation of communities. This presents many opportunities for systems thinking . Our data-collection efforts, combined with agent-based socio-hydrological models and basin-scale integrated assessment models have enabled large-scale policy interventions for irrigation demand management, the exploration of nature-based solutions in agriculture, preparation for rare events in transboundary rivers, and generation scenarios for investment options in the Water-Energy-Food-Climate nexus. Dr. Abubakr Muhammad is an associate professor of electrical engineering, the founding director of the Center for Water Informatics & Technology (WIT), and the lead for NCRA Agricultural Robotics Lab at LUMS, Pakistan. He received his Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from Georgia Institute of Technology, USA winning an institute-wide best Ph.D. Dissertation Award. Following postdoctoral fellowships at the University of Pennsylvania and McGill University he joined LUMS in 2008, where his group does research in agricultural robotics, human-water systems and climate analytics. He has held visiting positions at other top institutes including the University of Oxford, ICTP, and KAUST. He serves on various advisory panels to government agencies and industry on the use of emerging digital technologies for tackling issues related to climate change, disaster management, water management and food security.
1043964143857.description: From behavior to policy: a systems perspective on establishing hydrometeorological monitoring networks in complex river basins
1043964143857.venue_name: School of Geography and the Environment, Oxford
1043964143857.title: Establishing hydrometeorological monitoring networks in complex river basin

929563398147.summary: British Weight Lifting is delighted to launch a coaching conference dedicated to helping coaches cultivate their ability to develop competitive athletes and foster their passion for lifting. In a world where knowledge is freely accessible online, we bring you the opportunity to gain wisdom in person from champions and those who have coached them and also to have enriching discussions face-to-face with other coaches. Places are limited to 130 so if you want to attend and to have an opportunity to shape the conference, sign up to receive an email before the release date, by selecting the free "Keep Me updated" Ticket now. As we build up to the Stronger Together Conference, those who have selected keep me updated will be invited to attend one-off live podcasts with British Weightliftings Performance Team including a Q&A session. The first Stronger Together Conference was a massive success, with coaches moving away from arguments about technique to instead focus on how to coach for long-term performance development. Our speakers Danny Lennon, Spencer Arnold, Zoe Smith Chris Murray and Giles Greenwood stole the show. The second one is going to be even better as we again bring some of the most experienced people on the planet and ask hard questions about performance. Our confirmed speakers for the 18 th of January, 2025, from 9:00 to 18:00 are: Emily Campbell (Oly), Adam Bishop, Dr Meghan Bentley, Dr Sinead Roberts and Aimee Anaya Everett. The topics of the talks will be released in due course but for now, read our speakers biographys. Tickets are released 12 noon 31st July 2024 Aimee Anaya Everett Aimee Anaya Everett is a Senior International Coach, co-owner of Catalyst Athletics , and Head Lifting Coach for Mat Fraser's HWPO Training. After a standout career on the platform, including time at the Olympic Training Center, Aimee retired as an athlete to coach for and operate Catalyst Athletics. Aimee has devoted the last 29 years to the sport of Olympic Weightlifting as an athlete and a coach. In her time as a coach, Anaya Everett became the second female International Coaches, and the first American female to coach at the Olympics in USA Weightlifting a very prestigious accomplishment. Aimee coaches Olympic Weightlifting across all levels she has youth athletes, national level athletes, masters athletes, and has coached athletes to multiple American and Pan Am records, as well as Youth World, Pan Am, and World Championship medals. She has coachedathletes to the Youth World Championships, Junior World Championships, World Championships, Pan Am Championships and Olympics. She also loves coaching beginners and garage lifters with no desire to compete. Aimee has a passion for mental training and toughness, and coaching the person, not just the athlete. She loves coaching and believes the mental side is what separates the elite from the true champions. Aimee dedicates her life to helping others achieve their goals, and welcomes all levels whether it be a grandmother wanting to have the strength and energy to chase her grandchildren, an individual who never wants to compete and only trains for fun, an aspiring Olympian, someone who wants to be mentally stronger, or an athlete with dreams to podium at National Championships. Aimees goal is to help people become better in life and sport through mental work, strength, fitness & health, and happiness in and outside of the gym. Those who master themselves find strength. www.catalystathletics.com instagram- @aimeeanayaeverett Dr Sinead Roberts Sinead is a SENR registered Performance Nutritionist and Lecturer in Sport Nutrition & Exercise Physiology (University of Westminster), specialising in weight making and strength-power sports. Dr Sinead Roberts joined British Weightlifting (BWL) in 2024 as their nutritionist, quickly making herself an invaluable part of the multidisciplinary team, travelling to competitions. Her podcast and website is an archive of invaluable information on nutrition and she has contributed to the wider development of coaches on the BWL Coach development program through her work. Sinead graduated from the University of Nottingham with a degree in Biology, before undertaking a PhD (UCL) where she focused on understanding how cells regulate the addition of mass and volume, in response to growth factor signals, stress signals and nutrient availability. From here she ultimately transitioned to Sport Nutrition and Exercise Physiology. She is now a SENR registered Performance Nutritionist and Lecturer in Sport Nutrition & Exercise Physiology (University of Westminster), specialising in weight making and strength-power sports. Her research is focussed on weight-cutting strategies and performance in combat sports, and intra- and inter- individual variability in energetic and cell signalling responses to training. Dr Meghan Bentley Meghan is a research fellow in sports nutrition and psychology, and sports nutritionist for BWL para-powerlifting. She graduated from Sheffield Hallam University with a BSc (Hons) in Nutrition, Health, and Lifestyles, for which she was awarded the Yakult Award for outstanding academic achievement. Following this, Meghan completed her MSc in Sport and Exercise Nutrition at Leeds Beckett University, where she was awarded the Dean's prize for outstanding achievement. She then went on to complete her PhD in partnership with Leeds Beckett University and the English Institute of Sport. Her PhD applied behavioural science to understanding the dietary behaviour of elite athletes in order to advance the professional practice of sports and exercise nutritionists. Meghan is a Practitioner Registrant of the Sport and Exercise Nutrition Register (SENR) and Fellow of the Higher Education Academy (HEA). Adam Bishop Adam Bishop is a renowned strongman competitor known for his impressive performances on the international stage, including the Worlds Strongest Man competition. With a background in sports science and a career in professional rugby, Adam transitioned to strongman events, quickly rising through the ranks to become one of the best in the world. Adams dedication to strength training and his meticulous approach to fitness have earned him numerous titles and accolades. His achievements include being crowned Britains Strongest Man twice (2020 and 2023) and multiple top 10 finishes at the Worlds Strongest Man competition. Known for his exceptional work ethic and strategic approach to events, Adam consistently showcases his prowess in feats of strength, endurance, and power. In addition to his competitive success, Adam is also a respected coach and fitness expert, sharing his knowledge and passion for strength sports with aspiring athletes. His contributions to the strongman community, both as a competitor and mentor, have solidified his reputation as a key figure in the world of strength athletics. Social Media Links: IG: @adambishopstrongman FB: AdamBishopSC Emily Campbell Emily Campbell, from Nottingham, England, is a prominent British weightlifter renowned for her exceptional strength and achievements in the sport. Specialising in the +87 kg weight category, Campbell has become a significant figure in the world of weightlifting, making history with her performances on the international stage. Campbells journey in weightlifting began relatively late; she initially pursued a career in track and field before discovering her passion for lifting weights. Her dedication and talent quickly shone through, leading her to make rapid progress in the sport. Emilys hard work and determination paid off when she won her first major international medal at the 2018 Commonwealth Games, securing a bronze in the +90 kg category. Emilys career reached a new pinnacle at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics (held in 2021 due to the pandemic), where she made history by winning a silver medal in the womens +87 kg weightlifting category. This achievement made her the first British female weightlifter to win an Olympic medal, earning her widespread recognition and admiration. In addition to her Olympic success, Campbell has also excelled in European competitions. She clinched gold at the 2021 European Weightlifting Championships, further establishing herself as a leading contender in her weight class. Her consistent performances and remarkable strength have made her a role model for aspiring athletes, particularly women in weightlifting. Emily Campbell continues to train and compete at the highest level, aiming for further success in the Paris 2024 Olympics. Her legacy as a trailblazer in British weightlifting and her contributions to the sport make her a celebrated and influential figure in the athletic world. Accessing this discount without BWL membership will result in no ticket and non-refund of any payment. 995353799007.summary: Economists Haizhou Huang (Managing Director and Management Committee Member at China International Capital Corporation Limited) and Patrick Bolton (Professor of Finance and Economics and Imperial College London) will visit London Business School to lead a discussion on, equity capital, fiscal policy and the Economic Development of China based on their recent title, Money Capital: New Monetary Principles for a More Prosperous Society . Richard Portes, Professor of Economics at London Business School will be the moderator for this discussion. The principle concept of this book considers that fiat money represents the equity capital of a nation, while the cost of inflation mirrors the dilutions faced by the shareholders. The authors explore two central questions: How does money flow into the economy, and what is it used to purchase? The book presents a comprehensive framework that links the real economy with its monetary counterpart, emphasising the critical role of the banking sector and debt. This session will take place in collaboration with the AQR Asset Management Institute at London Business School.
995353799007.description: Join us for a discussion on, equity capital, fiscal policy and the Economic Development of China
995353799007.event_address: Old Marylebone Town Hall 97-113 Marylebone Road London NW1 5PT LT 17
995353799007.venue_name: LT18/LT19, Sammy Ofer Centre / London Business School
995353799007.title: Money Capital: New Monetary Principles for a More Prosperous Society

1043557808497.summary: Emotions are our bodys reactions to our thoughts. Ekhart Tolle Join this EFT workshop to help your body and mind. This technique works by tapping on acupressure meridians whilst gently focusing on problem feelings that are affecting our experience. The process starts with a beginning statement of what the issue is and includes a complete acceptance and acknowledgement of the problem. It therefore releases blockages and the problem feelings are relieved, moving through the body. You may feel lighter, calmer and at peace with these emotions. *Free workshop for Registered Clients and Carers. 10 for General Admission at the TAC Wellness Centre and via Zoom. *Donations welcome Please Note When booking your ticket, Together Against Cancer will add you to their monthly mailing list and keep you informed of upcoming events. You can unsubscribe from this by following the unsubscribe me option at the footer of the email.
1043557808497.description: This workshop aims to release emotional blockages by combining gentle touch with mindful and vocal attention to thoughts and feelings.
1043557808497.title: Emotional Freedom Techniques (EFT)

1038789105177.summary: ESG Huddle Welcome to the ESG Huddle, this event is designed for small and medium businesses (SMBs), to explore how to move beyond a "defensive" approach to Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) factors, and towards an "offensive" one, focused on value creation and growth. Attendees will learn: How a robust ESG strategy can lead to a strong business case, including enhanced profitability, talent acquisition and retention, and future-proofing for a changing world. Practical strategies to transition from a "check-the-box" ESG approach to one that unlocks financial benefits through proactive, value-driven initiatives. Actionable insights from leading experts with experience in navigating ESG complexities for businesses of all sizes. The event features a panel discussion with three experts: David Carlin , Founder of D.A. Carlin and Company, advisers to The United Nations Environment Programme will draw upon his experience advising financial institutions and other organisations on climate and ESG-related topics. He will offer insights into the evolving regulatory landscape and how businesses can adapt to thrive, a theme frequently addressed in his Forbes contributions. Jay Mukhey , CEO of My Eco Energy and Founding Partner at Outsourced Chief Sustainability Officer Group (OCSO), will share his practical experience assisting businesses in implementing profitable ESG initiatives. Jennifer Crowley, an Executive Director specialising in sustainable business transformation, will draw upon her experience leading the global responsible business strategy at Kin + Carta, the first listed B Corporation on the London Stock Exchange. She will share insights on fostering a purpose-driven company culture and achieving success across environmental, social, and financial markets. Attendees will benefit from : The opportunity to participate in a Q&A session, directly engaging with the panel experts. 15-minute individual sessions with the panel after the discussion, allowing for more personalised guidance. Join us to gain a comprehensive understanding of ESG, acquire practical tools and strategies, and leave inspired to take action.
1038789105177.description: Move beyond defensive ESG! Learn how a proactive approach can unlock value & future-proof your SMB. Expert panel, practical strategies & 1:1
1038789105177.title: ESG Huddle

1028125700647.summary: Field Forum is a series curated by curated by Jingru (Cyan) Cheng and Chen Zhan that centres the interconnectedness embedded in the built environment, attuning our senses to material flows, planetary scales, intergenerational times and all the life entangled in these processes. Tim Ingold is Professor Emeritus of Social Anthropology at the University of Aberdeen. He has carried out fieldwork among Saami and Finnish people in Lapland, and has written on environment, technology and social organisation in the circumpolar North, on animals in human society, and on human ecology and evolutionary theory. His more recent work explores environmental perception and skilled practice. Ingolds current interests lie on the interface between anthropology, archaeology, art and architecture. His recent books include The Perception of the Environment (2000), Lines (2007), Being Alive (2011), Making (2013), The Life of Lines (2015), Anthropology and/as Education (2018), Anthropology: Why it Matters (2018), Correspondences (2020), Imagining for Real (2022) and The Rise and Fall of Generation Now (2023). Ingold is a Fellow of the British Academy and the Royal Society of Edinburgh. In 2022 he was made a CBE for services to Anthropology. Michaela Bsse is an interdisciplinary researcher and artist based in Berlin. She is currently a postdoctoral fellow at the Technische Universitt Dresden and the Research Institute for Sustainability Helmholtz Centre Potsdam, as well as an Associated Investigator at the Cluster of Excellence "Matters of Activity. Image Space Material" at the Humboldt-Universitt zu Berlin. Her research focuses on spatial and material transformations in the context of speculative urbanism, climate change mitigation, and energy transitions. Drawing on environmental humanities and feminist science and technology studies, she examines how design practices and technologies govern environments and define who and what is rendered inhuman. Image: Chen Zhan, Peeling Beach, 2024, Vietnamese Mekong Delta. Please get in touch to let us know of any access requirements that you might have and how we can best accommodate these. If you are unable to attend physically but would like to participate in the event remotely please email publicprogramme@aaschool.ac.uk
1028125700647.title: Senses & Sense-Making

1040710963507.summary: In this event, Professor Sufian Jusoh will speak about the ASEANs role in fostering unity and solidarity among its member states during geo-economic challenges. The Leaders of ASEAN during the 42nd and 43rd ASEAN Summits in Indonesia in 2023 agreed to work towards an ASEAN Vision 2045, which will replace the current ASEAN Vision 2025: Forging Ahead Together. The ASEAN Vision 2045 is set to shape the destiny of the ASEAN region, which is one of the most economically dynamic economic regions and predicted to collectively be the 4th largest economy in the world. ASEAN faces a lot of challenges and uncertainties in moving towards the next phase of regional integration. Firstly, ASEAN needs to foster unity and solidarity among its member states in facing the regional and global geo-economic challenges. ASEAN has to be able to address the elephants in the room, i.e. the uncertainty in Myanmar, and the more assertive China in its own backyards. ASEAN Member States have also not been able to specifically find common grounds on other conflicts such as in the Middle-East and the Russia-Ukraine, what more with Taiwan facing a much greater threat from China. Secondly, ASEAN will have to address the inclusive growth and economic disparity among its own member states, including Timor-Leste. The economic disparity is further exacerbated by issues like climate change; rapid technology changes where most ASEAN Member States are technology adopters instead of technology frontrunners; competition for resources such as critical minerals, renewable energy, and food security and the uncertain global and regional financial landscape. Finally, ASEAN may have to play an important role in the re-globalisation, where ASEAN as a region plays an important role in re-igniting the multilateral trading system, whilst continuing addressing the regional trade and investment priorities like the full and effective implementation of the RCEP. Most importantly, ASEAN Vision 2045 will be the catalyst for regional and global economic growth, setting the pace for peace, stability and prosperity in this region. This event is being run in collaboration with Malay World Studies, St Catharines College, and will be followed by a drinks reception. Malay World studies events | St Catharines College, Cambridge About the speaker: Professor Sufian Jusoh is the Director and Professor of International Trade and Investment at the Institute of Malaysia and International Studies, Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia. He is also an FDI Advisor, ArtNet, UNESCAP, International Investment Policy Consultant at the World Bank Group, External Fellow at the World Trade Institute, University of Bern, Malaysias representative to ERIA RIN and a delegate to the ASEAN High Level Task Force for ASEAN Community Vision Post 2025. In APEC, Sufian played a key role in the success of Malaysias chairmanship of APEC 2020, leading to the APEC Putrajaya Vision 2040, Malaysian representative to the preparation of the APEC Food Security Roadmap 2030, and a delegate to the APEC Investment Expert Group. Sufian plays a key role in the reform of the investment policies in Bangladesh, Malaysia, Laos, Myanmar, Timor-Leste, the Federated States of Micronesia and Pakistan. Sufian is a Barrister-at-Law (England and Wales) of Lincolns Inn, London, and holds an LL.B (Hons.) from Cardiff Law School, LL.M, University College London, and a Doctor of Law from University of Bern, Switzerland.
1040710963507.description: Professor Sufian Jusoh will discuss ASEAN's role in fostering unity and solidarity among its member states during geo-economic challenges
1040710963507.title: Geo-economic challenges in the ASEAN integration towards 2045

1011133305937.summary: Join the African Leadership Organization at the UK-Africa Partnerships Forum on the 21st of November 2024 at the House of Lords, UK . The forum will bring together top policymakers, industry leaders, and visionaries from across the UK and Africa to explore and harness the continent's burgeoning potential. The UK has maintained a long-standing relationship with Africa, historically focused on trade, investment, and development aid. However, the UK's exit from the European Union has prompted a rethinking of its foreign economic policies, particularly toward Africaa continent poised for significant economic growth. In 2023, Africa was seen as one of the fastest-growing regions in the world, with a collective GDP of over $3 trillion. Despite global economic challenges, Sub-Saharan Africa's economy grew by an estimated 3.6% in 2023, with projections to reach around 4.1% by 2024 due to robust performance in key sectors like agriculture, energy, and telecommunications. The UK has responded by recalibrating its relationships through bilateral agreements. In 2021, the UK signed Economic Partnership Agreements (EPAs) with countries like Kenya, Ghana, and the Southern African Customs Union, ensuring continuity in trade post-Brexit. By 2023, UK-Africa trade was valued at approximately 40 billion, with major exports including machinery, pharmaceuticals, and financial services. However, there is untapped potential to expand trade beyond traditional sectors and drive innovation-led growth across both economies. Though trade between the UK and Africa continues to grow, there is still significant room for expansion. Relatedly, Africa accounts for about 2.5% of total UK exports, and UK Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in Africa reached 50 billion by 2023, largely concentrated in extractive industries, financial services, and infrastructure. The African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA), which came into effect in 2021, and covers 54 African nations with a combined market of over 1.3 billion people, represents a transformative opportunity for UK businesses to access new markets and diversify trade relationships. In 2023, the AfCFTA's potential to boost intra-African trade by 52.3% by 2025 and increase trade with external partners like the UK presents enormous opportunities for collaboration. However, Africa still faces significant challenges in infrastructure development, trade facilitation, and financial inclusion, areas where UK expertise could play a pivotal role. One of the main challenges to expanding UK-Africa partnerships is the need for better policy alignment and regulatory cooperation. Africas regulatory landscape is complex, with varying rules on investment, trade, and digital services across the continent. The UK, through its Department for International Trade and Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office (FCDO), has been working on developing more harmonized trade and investment frameworks with African governments. The UK-Africa Partnership Forum would therefore create a platform for advancing mutual interests and unlocking new opportunities in trade, innovation, and sustainable development. The event will build upon the strong foundation of existing trade, investment, and development relationships between the UK and Africa, reinforcing established partnerships while identifying areas for expansion and deepening engagement, facilitating discussions and interactions that uncover and develop new avenues for collaboration, as well as influence the future trajectory of UK-Africa relations through high-level dialogue and strategic partnerships, ensuring that both regions benefit from shared prosperity and development. Key Highlights of the Forum 1) Keynote Addresses & High-Level Thematic Panel Discussions 2) Bilateral Meetings, Policy Alignment Discussions & Exclusive Networking Sessions 3) Workshops and Breakout Sessions 4) Exhibition and Showcase (Countries and States Governments Investment Showcase) 5) Unveiling of the African Leadership Magazines special publications
1011133305937.description: THEME: Deepening UK Africa Partnerships in Trade, Innovation, and Development
1011133305937.title: UK-AFRICA PARTNERSHIPS FORUM 2024

1015466877767.summary: Please note: this event is for London-based organisations with minimum 50k turnover and 2 full-time or equivalent part-time employees. Do you want to build a more sustainable future for your business and community, but dont know how to fund your vision? Come to our Funding a Sustainable Future event where we will showcase the range of funding available to founders and businesses driving sustainability and the transition to Net Zero. Through facilitated conversations between funders such as the National Lottery Community Fund; Green Angel Ventures; Crowdfunder and funded organisations, this event will give you an insider scoop into the process of raising funds for your sustainable venture or initiative. We will highlight the range of options available to you. Whether youre needing venture finance, grants or startup capital, weve got you covered. We want to inspire founders and business leaders from the startup and SME space to become more sustainable by providing a combination of inspiring stories and practical know-how. Youll come away better-informed, energised and with the tools needed to become greener. The evening will conclude with an opportunity to network with fellow founders and speakers. Speakers Nick Lyth President & Founder, Green Angel Ventures Nick Lyth is Founder and President of Green Angel Ventures, which he founded in 2013 as an experiment to fight climate change and global warming, with ten members, and two company investments. It now has more than 300 members, 46 companies in its portfolio, has launched its first EIS Climate Change Fund, attracted a 10 million commitment from BBIs Regional Angel Programme, and was UK Angel Syndicate of the Year in 2019. It is about to launch its first Series A/B Fund, for Institutional and Corporate Investors, as well as Family Offices. Nick Gardner Head of Climate Action, National Lottery Community Fund As Head of Climate Action, Nick is responsible for delivery of the Funds 100 million Climate Action Fund, awarding money raised by National Lottery players to help communities take the lead in tackling the climate emergency Nick was the CEO of ActionFunder, an organisation he co-founded with the goal of bringing businesses and community projects together to make impactful changes from the grassroots up. During his time there, the organisation was selected by the Sustainable Development Commission as a Breakthrough Idea for the 21st Century, and he established purpose-led, business-backed campaigns such as Outdoor Classroom Day (winner of the Global Good Award for best global education project). More speakers announced very soon! About Social Founders: For more information about Social Founders, check out their website . Where you can read about events, listen to the Social Founder Stories podcasts, and check out just a few of the founders in our network in the Gallery, blogs and Founder Features. And be sure to sign up to our newsletter if you haven't already Please reach out caroline@socialfounder.org with any questions. About Green Business Action: The Green Business Action team has been delivering fully funded support to London SMEs for more than seven years. Theyre a small, dynamic, and friendly team that is dedicated to getting your business to the next stage, whether thats progressing on your Net Zero goals or access to markets for your cleantech start-up. Now theyre providing free holistic Net Zero support to hundreds of SMEs as part of the Levelling Up Agenda with the UK Shared Prosperity Fund . 137815037487.summary: 21st Anniversary Conference and opening of the Celebratory year of the Green Economics Institute 2 Days over a weekend. Saturday and Sunday 18th and 19th January 2025 Please obtain your tickets directly from www.geiconferences.org/tickets / where you will find more information and the timetable, programme, speaker list and practical information about participating in the conference. This year the world is in flux with a large part of the world re electing new governments and the balance of power shifting rapidly around the world. The Green Economics Institute has been active on the world stage for the last 21 years and this conference is an exciting chance both to reflect on the changes in the last 21 years and to actively plan for the next 21 years of humanity, nature, the planet and its systems and come up with new narratives,solutions and philosophy and science for the next milenia. We are calling for speakers, reflective papers, presentations, exhibition stands, side events, workshops and posters. We are also keen to encourage art, sculpture, pottery, music and dance. We are planning multi generational sessions from the very youngest to the very oldest. If you would like to apply to join any of our United Nations Delegations for climate change or biodiversity loss, indigenous peoples, desertification or climate finance please email us to ask about opportunities and visit www.geiconferences.org/tickets where we post our sign ups and expressions of interest. All our United Nations delegate participants are full members of the Green Economics Institute. If you would like to donate or support our charity work or are interested in becoming a trustee of our Institute Charity, please visit www.greeneconomicsinstitutetrust.org to find out more. Donations can be made at www.greeneconomicsinstitutetrust.org/donate Please email us to discuss your ideas and inspiration for the 21st anniversary conference at greeneconomicsinstitute@yahoo.com or info@greeneconomicsinstitute.org.uk If you would like to join The Green Economics Institute please visit www.geimembership.org For the latest draft of the programme please visit www.greeneconomicsinstitute.org.uk and www.geiconferences.org Please register and buy your tickets directly from www.geiconferences.org/tickets/

137815037487.venue_name: Crowne Plaza Reading, an IHG Hotel
137815037487.title: 21st Anniversary Conference - January 18th & 19th 2025

180938520987.summary: 21st Annual 3 day Green Economics Institute Conference and Celebration July 25th -27th 2025 Said Business School. 3 day Conference and Celebration after 21 years of the Green Economics Institute. The Conference will take place at the Said Business School, University of Oxford. Speeches and papers are invited on the following: 21 years of Green Economics 21 years of the Green Economics Institute 21 years of Economics-Past Present and Future 21 years into the future- how will economics look? 21 years into the future- how will the world look? 21 years into the future- what future scenario choices do we have and what is our role going to be? We are calling for papers which will be adjudicated by our academic committee. We are also calling for speakers and workshops and participants. Other services at the conference The Conference will also consider the next steps in our Academic Journal, Our magazine, our TV station, our educational programmes. It will also provide networking among participants. It will also offer volunteering opportunities- for people willing to help over the few months leading up to the conference via on line work and in person as well during the conference days. The conference will also publish the above papers in a book, and in proceedings. There are opportunities for exhibition stands -please enquire. There are opportunities to post adverts or promotions or artwork of compatible similar organisations on our many websites for several months in the run up to the conference and beyond. A brochure will be published shortly offering the options. Please contact us if you would like to take up this opportunity. The conference will provide a retrospective overview of economics and green economics and social and environmental justice over the previous 21years. Programme of Events During the Conference 21st Green Economics Institute Annual Summer Conference, To be held at Oxford University 25-27th July 2025 at the Said Business School, University of Oxford Call for Papers 21 st Annual Green Economics Institute Conference To be held at the Said Business School, University of Oxford United Kingdom Friday, Saturday, Sunday 25 th -27 th July 2025 We are inviting papers, speeches, workshops exhibition stands, volunteers, participants for our 21 st Anniversary Conference 2025. Programme of the Conference Friday Paper presentations and lectures and debates Lecture Theatres at Said Business School Friday Evening Dinner at a typical Oxford College, Dinning Hall Friday Evening Late Night Tea and Scones at the Randolf Hotel Oxford Saturday Paper Presentations and Debates Lecture Theatres at Said Business School Saturday evening 21st Birthday party, DJ and accoustic music and dancing at Voco Hotel, Oxford Sunday Walking tours of Oxford, Outings and Lunch in a typical Oxford Pub Sunday Lunch in a typical Oxford Pub Sunday afternoon Possible Punting on the River Thames Sunday afternoon possible wildlife field trip walk round Oxford Sunday Tea Time a Typical Oxford Alice in Wonderland Tea. Publications of the Conference www.geibooks.org.uk A book of the conference -The next 21years of Green Economics A book of the conference the past 20 years of Green Ideas and Philosophy The Green Economist Commemorative Magazine Issue The International Journal of Green Economics IJGE Volume 20, Issues 1-4 Academic double blind peer reviewed, Scopus Listed Journal Reflections on 21 years of Green Economics Special Commemorative Issue Research papers and findings publications we will publish research papers, thesis, and other conference papers. Please ensure you submit early by end of February 2025 if possible to allow time for publication and launch at the conference. Poster Presentations Academic Committee An academic Committee for the Event will be announced Themes and Further Particulars will be announced shortly Conference Flyer For Information oxfordaid2025flyerno12 University Accommodation This is currently available -please send expressions of interest early to info@greeneconomicsinstitute@yahoo.com and look out on the website www.geiconferences.org/tickets/ for accommodation offers at the University of Oxford where currently they have enough beds for the conference. Exhibition Stands, sponsorship and partnership with other organisations If you or your organisation would like to partner with us for this historic event please email us early at info@greeneconomicsinstitute.org.uk A detailed information sheet will be issued shortly. We are happy to partner with other organisations to sponsor individual sessions -usually half and hour 1 hour or 2 hours. Make use of our websites we can host information about your organisation We also host your information for your organisation on one of our website for 6 months prior to the event or 6 months after the event. Please ask for more details of our packages. We have very active websites plus social media on which to host your information, subject to suitability and governance issues and approval by our team. Our rates are geared to smaller charities and organisations as well as larger ones. Volunteers for the Event If you would like to volunteer to help us plan and deliver this conference please email us today to express your interest- we have 20 places for work experience and academic accreditation for this conference for anyone who enjoys interesting, fascinating, innovative hard work and group participation but is also a self starter, cheerful positive, future thinking very kind, a team player, caring and can think outside the box. We require people who can meet on zoom one evening a week for 3 months before the event to help us plan it. We are an inclusive organisation which walks the talk with zero tolerance for abuse, racism, sexism, ageism of any kind etc. Dont be shy to apply. Please submit abstracts, ideas and initial interest to info@greeneconomicsinstitute@yahoo.com and info@greeneconomicsinstitute.org.uk www.geiconferences.org /tickets/ Please keep a watch at this page for more details www.greeneconomicsinstitute.org.uk

756319310417.summary: This conference is designed for private individuals investors who want to know that their money goes where they choose. Investors who understand that both financial success and positive impact can go hand-in-hand. PART 1: 10.45 am - 11.25 am PART 2: 11.35 am - 12.15 pm Speakers: Danyal Sattar, CEO Big Issue Invest; Arielle Schacter of KIKO Ventures. Learn how easy it can be to align your financial goals with a greater sense of purpose Sustainable investing goes beyond traditional investment methods in a time where companies are acutely aware of their social and environmental impact. Sustainable investors contribute towards the long-term well-being of society, and our planet. . Attend Sustain.Social and Discover how sustainable investing can generate financial returns whilst promoting positive change Develop a deep understanding of sustainable investing and the potential impact on the world Learn more about various investment approaches, including ESG integration, impact investing, socially responsible investing and ethical investing Explore real-life case studies and success stories from the world of sustainable investing Take part in an interactive Q&A session with expert panelists in Sustainable investing goes beyond traditional approaches by considering environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in investment decisions. By incorporating these considerations, investors can support companies that prioritize sustainability, ethical practices, and social responsibility. Discover how sustainable investing contributes to the long-term well-being of both society and the planet. Whether you're an experienced investor looking to diversify holdings or just starting out and keen to explore new avenues, Sustain.Social provides you with a live forum to gather valuable information and meet other investors. Don't miss this opportunity to be part of a growing movement that aims to transform the investment landscape for a sustainable and equitable future. Spend some time in the company of like-minded people, sharing ideas and networking. Sustain.Social offers you the chance to learn more about the various options available to become a truly sustainable investor. How to avoid the greenwashing and the marketing and how to check under the bonnet to make sure your investments are delivering not only great financial returns to you, but also supporting the issues that matter to you. Learn how to choose investments that deliver both solid returns as well as supporting the things you care about Meet other investors, who share your views, and discuss ideas about how to create a sustainable portfolio Hear from professional investors who put together sustainable funds and portfolios find out how what criteria they use
756319310417.description: An event for investors who want their money to be a force for good.
756319310417.title: The Sustainable & Social Investing Conference 2024
