897724858217.title: Rise & Thrive Community Networking

1035370971447.summary: Join us at Glassbox Ironside! 7520 NE 4th Court, Miami 33138 7:30am doors open for networking. A breakfast spread, coffee and juice will be provided. The meeting starts at 8:15am sharp. Event officially ends at 10am. We'll have the space for another hour for more networking after. About the Event: -Connect with high level Miami Founders, entrepreneurs and Startups! -Celebrate wins, and share your breakthrough story! -Mastermind and brainstorm ways to grow your business! Cultivate Inspiration! Each month we have a different theme, with a Founder leading a talk. Their "Founder Story" will allow you to learn and expand your knowledge through their unique experience, valuable insights and resources! -Gain the support and collaboration within the Miami Entrepreneur Ecosystem! -Share your business gifts and services with the community, find the aligned opportunities! Parking: Best place to park is street parking on the cross streets of 4th Ct (75th, 76th St). To enter the Glassbox area, go through the main courtyard of Miami Ironside, and continue left outdoors to see the Glassbox entrance. About Miami Made: Miami made. is a grassroots Founder-led movement for a thriving startup ecosystem. Over 150 Founders united as one tribe to create a more supportive ecosystem that enables Founders in South Florida to build better companies and live more balanced lives. Our mission is to leverage the diversity, collective knowledge, and creative energy of founders to lead Miami's startup ecosystem to its next evolution as a premier place to start a company that thrives. We have a lot of fun too!
1035370971447.description: Connect, Collaborate and Elevate with Entrepreneurs and Founders at Miami Made Thrive Together Tuesday!
1035370971447.title: Miami Made Thrive Together Tuesday!

1013140940827.summary: So Bloom Social Presents: A Color Bar Experience at Kendra Scott Date & Time: Thursday, October 24th, 2024 4:00 PM 6:00 PM Location: Kendra Scott, Winter Park Village 460 N Orlando Ave D110, Winter Park, FL 32789 Event Overview: Join So Bloom Social for a delightful evening of creativity, connection, and style at Kendra Scott in Winter Park Village! This special FREE event invites you to step into the Kendra Scott Color Bar , where you'll get the opportunity to design your very own custom jewelry piece. Whether you're creating a beautiful necklace or earrings that reflect your unique personality, the experience is all about having fun and letting your creativity shine! Enjoy light refreshments while mixing and mingling with other inspiring women in business. What to Expect: Hands-On Jewelry Design: Explore the fun of Kendra Scott's Color Bar, where you can mix and match gemstones and settings to design a piece that's uniquely yours. Exclusive Shopping Perk: As a special thank-you, all attendees will receive 15% off any jewelry purchased during the event, making this the perfect opportunity to treat yourself (or grab a gift for someone special)! Network with Like-Minded Women: This event is more than just jewelry-making. It's a chance to connect with a vibrant community of businesswomen from various industries. Bring your business cards, your ideas, and your energy for an evening of great conversations. Relaxed and Fun Atmosphere: With refreshments served throughout the event, you'll be able to enjoy a laid-back and friendly atmosphere that encourages both creativity and conversation. Why Attend? Its FREE! Who doesnt love a complimentary evening of creativity and networking? Youll walk away with a stunning piece of jewelry you designed yourself. This event offers a perfect balance of fun and business, combining hands-on crafting with a relaxed networking session. The exclusive 15% discount at Kendra Scott is an incredible bonus for attendees! RSVP Now to secure your spot and get ready for a fun-filled evening of style, networking, and good vibes!

1035103140357.summary: Could mastering your unique DRIVE type potentially revolutionize every aspect of your life, relationships, and business? Let's find out together! Join us at our enlightening event as we delve into the heart of the DRIVE Sales System, providing you with actionable insights and advice tailored to your individual DRIVE type. Personal and professional enrichment isn't a 'one size fits all' proposition. That's why understanding your unique DRIVE typeDirector, Relator, Intellectual, Validator, Executiveis irreplaceable. Your primary DRIVE type represents your core motivations, while your secondary DRIVE type reflects how you likely achieve your goals. Our DRIVE-focused event is centered on helping you understand and leverage your unique combination, empowering you in all areas of your life. What the event covers: Leadership Style: Uncover your inherent leadership capabilities based on your DRIVE type, and how to effectively motivate and inspire your team. Challenges: Explore the unique obstacles your DRIVE type might face and learn adaptive strategies to overcome them with finesse. Influence & Internal Validation: Understand your abilities to sway opinions, how to effectively influence others and bolster your self-confidence. Relationship Dynamics: Learn how your DRIVE type impacts your relationships, be it romantic, professional or platonic, enabling a deeper level of connection and understanding. Career Fit: Discover which professions are best in line with your DRIVE type, formulating a career path that is not only successful but equally fulfilling. Sales Techniques: Uncover powerful sales strategies, closing techniques, and rebuttals specifically effective for your DRIVE type, beautifully complementing your unique strengths. Whether you're a self-assured Director, a relationship-driven Relator, a knowledge-focused Intellectual, a strength-spotting Validator, or a goal-oriented Executive, this event is an unmissable opportunity for self-discovery and growth. Your journey to self-understanding and personal as well as professional enrichment starts here. Don't miss this opportunity to reignite your passion and create the life you desire. Register today to Discover What DRIVES You!
1035103140357.description: Discover what motivates and moves you so you can have more energy and passion to create the life,relationships and business you desire.
1035103140357.title: Discover and Leverage Your Unique Personality Traits - Tampa

942828755187.summary: Event Description: Join Beto Matheus for an exciting birdwatching adventure at one of the largest National Wildlife Refuges in the contiguous United States. Explore the Cypress Boardwalk and Marsh Trail, where you'll have the chance to spot both resident birds and migratory visitors. This immersive birding experience is perfect for enthusiasts of all ages. Event Details: Location: Cypress Boardwalk & Marsh Trail Meeting Point: Visitors Center Parking Lot Entry Fee: $10 per vehicle (unless you possess a park pass) Restrooms: Available inside the Visitors Center (opens at 9:00 AM) and outdoor facilities beside it. Important Notes: Registration Required: Advance registration is mandatory, and walk-ins cannot be accommodated. Limited Group Size: To ensure a personalized and enriching experience, the group size is kept small. eBird Participation: A shared eBird list will be available. Please ensure you have an eBird account, including a user ID and password, to access the list. Discover more about eBird here: eBird . Photography Notice: We encourage photographers to capture the beauty and fun of our birding adventures. By signing the AE consent, you agree to having your photo taken and used on our social media pages. If you prefer not to have your photos shared, please inform us in advance. Consideration for Others: If you register and find yourself unable to attend, please cancel your ticket to allow others the opportunity to participate. Your cooperation is greatly appreciated. Additional Information: No need to print your ticket; well have your registration on file. For any questions or additional information, feel free to reach out to us at fieldtrips@auduboneverglades.org . We look forward to sharing this birdwatching experience with you!
942828755187.description: Birdwatching Adventure with Beto Matheus at Cypress Boardwalk & Marsh Trail
942828755187.venue_name: Arthur R. Marshall Loxahatchee National Wildlife Refuge
942828755187.title: Arthur Marshall Loxahatchee NWR

942816378167.summary: Join us for a birding adventure led by Beto Matheus as we explore the scenic paved paths of this beautiful park in search of migratory warblers. Last year, we witnessed an incredible eruption of Red-legged Honeycreepers and Tennessee Warblers, and were hopeful for another exciting birding experience this year. Who knows, we might even spot a Black-billed Cuckoo! This event is open to bird enthusiasts of all ages and abilities. The path is wheelchair and assistive walking device accessible, ensuring everyone can participate. Restrooms are available at the park for your convenience. Important Details: Registration Required: Advance registration is required. Walk-ins will not be accommodated, so be sure to secure your spot early. Limited Group Size: To provide a personalized and enriching experience, group size is limited. Please register promptly. Cancellation Policy: If you register but cannot attend, kindly cancel your ticket to allow others to join. Your consideration is greatly appreciated. Photography Notice: We encourage participants to take photos during the event for personal use and to share them on social media. By signing the AE consent, you agree to having your photo taken and used on our social media pages. If you prefer not to have your photos shared, please email us and inform the field guide. eBird Option: If the trip leader chooses to maintain an eBird list, a shared list will be available. To access it, ensure you have an eBird account with a user ID and password. Come join us for a fantastic birding experience, and let's see what avian wonders await us! About your Field Trip Leader: Luis "Beto" Matheus has always been interested in nature and wildlife. Even as a kid growing up in Venezuela, he always kept a copy of "A Guide to the Birds of Venezuela" by Rodolphe Meyer de Schauensee and William H. Phelps (1978), the first bird field guide for any Latin American country, within reach. Yet he only became a "serious" birder around 2006 when he joined his father on a birding trip with Venezuela's Audubon Conservation Society to Yacamb National Park, at the northernmost edge of the eastern Andes. After seeing a male Golden-winged Manakin (Masius chrysopterus) take off in front of him in the cloud forest, he went home, bought a pair of binoculars and was hopelessly hooked...Turned into a fully-fledged bird nerd, Beto has been actively birding ever since, often with his birding parents, serving as a voluntary eBird reviewer for Venezuela since 2008 and joining several Audubon chapters as he moves around for work. A civil engineer working in renewable energy development, Beto has lived in Mexico (Mexico City and Pachuca), Colorado (Boulder) and, now Florida (Boca Raton) with his wife and two teenage kids.
942816378167.description: Join Beto Matheus as we walk along the paved path of this jewel of a park looking for migratory warblers.
942816378167.event_address: 4060 Old Germantown Rd, Delray Beach, FL 33445
942816378167.venue_name: City of Delray Beach Orchard View Park
942816378167.title: Orchard View Park

490812131297.summary: * This event is FREE for all job seekers & new recruiters. The event is conducted on the First Friday of Every Month, 11 am - 2 pm in your local timezone! FAQ: Q: What is the CareerClub Virtual job fair ? A: CareerClub Virtual job fair is conducted on the first Friday of every month, from 11 am to 2 pm, in your local city. It is a global virtual job fair for effective hiring among local professionals and recruiters and to promote healthy professional networking. CareerClub Virtual job fair, started as a small project to take the anxiety away from recruiters and professionals by making it available every month, and delivering it virtually, has now been deemed an industry standard and has encouraged several other organizations to join us and make their job fair monthly. Few even took it to the next level and joined us by taking their job fair globally through our platform. CareerClub Virtual job fair is conducted on the first Friday of every month from the convenience of their home, with no travel, no dressing formals, and no anxiety-led career event. A community-driven job fair where professionals, recruiters, and service providers come together to promote happy and healthy hiring. Q: Why should I attend the #CareerClub #Virtual jobfair? A: This global event is attended by thousands of recruiters to connect with 100s of thousands of seekers. This community-led event is where professionals spread the word and invite communities to job fairs. Some benefits: 1. Connect with local/global talent and opportunities 2. Collaborate with other professionals and never grow alone 3. Get access to resources to support long-lasting career growth Have more questions? Visit Event FAQ/Reachout Page at: https://jobfair.nwlb.app Q: Where is the event conducted? A: This is a virtual event, which means no travel is required. The event is conducted over your favorite internet browser. All you need is the following: Email(sent 24-78hours before) confirming you are assigned a room. An ability to chat, and if there is a common interest, go to a video/audio session( virtual rooms are provided ). A well-lit and quiet room where you could have a good session. Q: Is there a dress code? A: If you have received a note about your confirmed room, you would be encouraged to attend with respectable, semi-formal, and comfortable clothing. Q: Who could attend the event? A: This event is designed to help professionals [who are looking for work or exploring the market], recruiters [who are on the lookout for talent for their open roles], and service providers [who could assist professionals with their pursuit of a successful career]. Q: Which companies are attending? A: Amazon, Apple, CVS Health, United Health Group, Microsoft, Walgreens Boots Alliance, Kroger, The Home Depot, Verizon, Ford, General Motors, Anthem, Comcast, Bank of America, Target, UPS, Procter & Gamble, PepsiCo, FedEx, Disney, Albertsons, Prudential, Sysco, Best Buy, Allstate, AIG, Progressive, Bristol-Myers Squibb, Caterpillar, Dow, VA, Northrop Grumman, USAA, Dollar General, TJX Companies, Walmart ... and 8000 other businesses trust the platform for their recruiting. Q: Is this ticket enough, or do I need anything else to join the event? A: Participation is simple and effective: 1. Signup/register & RSVP with the platform at https://jobfaircc.nwlb.app 2. Stay on your emails for the next steps to attend. Q: What are the system requirements for attending the event? A: All you need to attend the event: Computer or Mobile Phone [No App is required] Broadband access [we advise 1.5 Mbps minimum for the best experience] A webcam(in case of a video call) Q: Which industries are visiting this event? A: This is a global event, and our communities are a mix of several industries, some of them include: Advertising, Aerospace, Agriculture and Agribusiness, Air pollution, Arms, Automotive, Broadcasting, Chemical, Computer, Construction, Creative, Defense, Education, Electric power, Electronics, Energy, Entertainment, Fashion, Film, Financial services, Fishing, Floral, Food, Healthcare, Horticulture, Hospitality, Industrial robot, Information, Insurance, Internet, Leisure, Low technology, Machine tooling, Machining, Manufacturing, Market research, Mass media, Mass production, Materials science, Meatpacking, Mining, Music, News media, Occupational injury, Occupational noise, Oil shale, Petroleum, Pharmaceutical, Pricing, Professional Services, Publishing, Pulp and paper, Raw material, Real estate, Robber baron (industrialist), Semiconductor, Services, Shipbuilding, Software, Sport, Steel, Telecommunications, Textile, Tobacco, Trade association, Transport, Video game, Water, Wood, etc. Q: Who are the people behind this event? A: #NoWorkerLeftBehind *, a global non-profit, is behind this event to democratize healthy career development for all, using technology to assist the global workforce to stay closer to their aspirational success through a healthy network, adequate knowledge and more opportunities. * NoWorkerLeftBehind is always on the lookout for professionals/organizations who want to actively work to help create a more equitable and just workforce that provides opportunities to everyone and creates an ecosystem of mutual growth and success. Interested in assisting us? Signup our volunteer list at https://one.tao.ai/nwlbvol Keywords: CareerFair, JobFair, JobFair, JobExpo, CareerExpo, Career Fair, Job Fair, Career Expo, Job Expo, Recruiter Event, Diversity, Equality, Equal Opportunity, Equal Opportunity, #jobsforall, #community, #employment, #skilled, #virtual, #online, community #Virtual #ONL

490812131297.title: Career Club Virtual Job Fair / Career Fair #Miami

894445068277.summary: Event Description: Join Alice Terner for a guided birding walk along the elevated boardwalks of Delray Beach's beautiful created wetlands. This is a fantastic opportunity to experience an up-close encounter with both resident birds and migratory visitors at this renowned birding hotspot. Whether you're a seasoned birder or a newcomer, this event is open to all ages and abilities. The boardwalk is fully accessible for those using wheelchairs or assistive walking devices. Meeting Point: Location: Please meet by the Visitors Center. Restrooms are available at this location for your convenience. Registration: Please register in advance to secure your spot. Walk-ins cannot be accommodated. Cancellation Policy: Considerate Cancellations: If you are unable to attend after registering, please cancel your ticket as soon as possible to allow others the opportunity to participate. eBird Participation: Shared eBird List: A shared eBird list will be available for this event. To access and contribute to the list, ensure you have an eBird account with a user ID and password. You can create an account here: eBird . Photography Notice: Encouragement: We encourage participants to capture and share the beauty of this birding adventure. By signing the AE consent, you agree to having your photo taken and used on our social media pages. If you prefer not to have your photos shared, please notify us in advance. Contact: For any questions or additional information, please contact fieldtrips@auduboneverglades.org. Come explore the wetlands and enjoy a memorable birding experience with us!
894445068277.description: Enjoy an morning with Alice Terner. along this birding hotspot.
894445068277.event_address: 12800 Hagen Ranch Road, Boynton Beach, FL 33437
894445068277.title: Green Cay Wetlands

997686867277.summary: This monthly book club led by Doug Knowlton is for those who like to read and discuss poetry. It celebrates the integral role of poets and poetry in life and literature. Decembers selection is To 2040 , the visionary new poems of Jorie Graham's fifteenth poetry collection. We will meet in person in the loft at our store at The Mark, 117 S. Pineapple Ave. The book club is $22, which includes a copy of To 2040 to be picked up at Bookstore1 any time before our meeting. About the book: It is rare to find in one collection an entire skyline burning and the quiet to follow a single worm, to hear soil breathein Jorie Graham's fifteenth poetry collection, you do. Jorie Grahams fifteenth poetry collection, To 2040 , opens in question punctuated as fact: Are we / extinct yet. Who owns / the map. In these visionary new poems, Graham is part historian, part cartographer as she plots an apocalyptic world where rain must be translated, silence sings louder than speech, and wired birds parrot recordings of their extinct ancestors. In one poem, the speaker is warned by a clairvoyant the American experiment will end in 2030. Graham shows us our potentially inevitable future soundtracked by sirens among industrial ruins, contemplating the loss of those who inhabited and named them. In sparse lines that move with cinematic precision, these poems pan from overhead views of reshaped shorelines to close-ups of a worm burrowing through earth. Here, we linger, climate crisis on hold, as Graham asks us to sit silently, to hear soil breathe. An urgent open letter to the future, with a habit of looking back, To 2040 is narrated by a speaker who reflects on her own mortalityin the glass window of a radiotherapy room, in the first claw full of hair placed gently on a green shower ledge. In poems that look to 2040 as both future and event-horizon, we leave the collection warned, infinitely wiser, and yet more attentively on edge. Inhale. / Are you still there / the sun says to me. And, from the title poem, what was yr message, what were u meant to / pass on? Poet Jorie Graham was born in New York City, raised in Rome, and educated in France. Trilingual in English, Italian, and French, she studied philosophy at the Sorbonne in Paris before attending New York University to study filmmaking. She holds an MFA in poetry from the University of Iowa and is the author of fifteen collections of poetry. Her work has been widely translated and she is the recipient of multiple honors including a John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Fellowship, the International Nonino Prize, and most notably the 1996 Pulitzer Prize for Poetry for \ . Currently, Graham is the Boylston Professor of Rhetoric and Oratory at Harvard University. ........................................................................................................... All signed up and unable to go? Please let us know! Seating is limited and there may be people on our waitlist who would like to to take your place. Please send an email to bryn@sarasotabooks.com ASAP and hopefully we'll see you next time. Click here to go to the Bookstore1 Sarasota website.
997686867277.description: The Poetry Book Club led by Doug Knowlton. Our selection for December is "To 2040" by Jorie Graham.
997686867277.title: Poetry Book Club "To 2040 " by Jorie Graham

661746350147.summary: On May 31st, we will be at Vale Food Co in Mary Brickell Village at 6pm, and then head over to Citizen M rooftop afterwards for an event on Urbanism Join Brickell Advocates for networking, and community building! We're looking for a core group of residents who are currently volunteering or interested in leading initiatives to better the neighborhood. Brickell is a vibrant community with a lot of potential, but it also faces several key issues. Traffic congestion, lack of green spaces, and affordable housing are just a few examples. As residents, we have a unique opportunity to drive change and make a real impact on the issues that matter most to us. At this event, we'll discuss these challenges and brainstorm ways to address them. By bringing together a diverse group of voices and perspectives, we can develop creative solutions that benefit the entire community. Plus, we'll enjoy some delicious pizza and get to know our fellow Brickell residents. Whether you're a long-time resident or new to the neighborhood, we welcome you to join us and be a part of shaping Brickell's future. Let's work together to build a better community for all of us!
661746350147.description: Brickell Advocates brings together local residents who want to help make the neighborhood better
661746350147.title: Brickell Advocates

778222292827.summary: DECEMBER 6, 7 & 8 - 3 DAY EVENT Tickets from $25 per Adult or Over 13 - "General Admission" includes: Single-day or 3-day admission includes access to the all Car Show/Display Vehicles, Celebrity Q&A Panels, Main Stage Presentations by Automotive Creators & TV Celebrities, Spectating the High Speed Live - Circuit Action and Live VW Golf Gti Giveaway Build - your General Admission Ticket is your entry into the Live Build Draw! See Details Below: "VIP" includes: 3-day admission, WrenchWerx t-shirt, lanyard, sticker, wrench set, and meet & greet invites. "Platinum Package" includes: 3-day admission, WrenchWerx t-shirt, lanyard, sticker, wrench set, and meet & greet invites, PLUS a high speed passenger ride with Ben Collins, 'the Top Gear Stig'! Additionally, you'll be guaranteed a celebrity meet & greet, and an invitation to the exclusive Saturday night WrenchWerx party! Anyone 12 years of age or under is FREE and do not require a ticket WrenchWerx is revolves around four primary elements: 1) Top Tier Content Creators: Q & A Creator Stage answering your Questions plus Main Stage Presentations, Fun & Your Favourite Automotive Personalities We feature the biggest names in the automotive world from YouTube, TV & movies, automotive journalism, racing, as well as industry professionals. These legends of the car industry will be participating in various WrenchWerx events such as: Q&A panels, custom builds, track driving, VIP meet & greets, and more. Thats rightat WrenchWerx our attendees have the chance to meet their favorite automotive icons! 2) Live Track Action: From mind-blowing exotic supercars, to legendary classics and custom builds, we put the pedal to the metal on the race track. WrenchWerx is the high-energy haven for car lovers to witness the pulse pounding driving, hear the engines howling, the tires screeching, and even experience from the passengers seat, the most exciting vehicles in the world do what they do best. 11am, 1pm & 3pm Supercar & Hypercar Parade Laps 3) Mega Car Show: Prepare to be dazzled! You might be thinking, What kind of cars? Theres no telling exactly what might show up to WrenchWerx, but theres a good chance youll see exotics and luxury hallmarks such as: Bugatti, Ferrari, Lamborghini, McLaren, Rolls Royce, and Bentleynew and vintage. You might see some vintage American gems such as a Shelby Cobra, Ford Mustang Boss, Plymouth Superbird, or Dodge Charger Daytona. Its possible youll also come across an Acura NSX, Toyota Supra, Nissan GTR, and Mazda RX-7. As you can see, from elegant European exotics, to vintage American, and the finest Asian imports, we love them all, so we strive to bring them all. 4) The VW Golf GTi Giveaway LIVE Build: Customizing, fixing, and improving automobiles is what we do! You've watched Tavarish and many other automotive personalities create their own dream machines on YouTube for years. At WrenchWerx, you'll get to see the builds happen in person! BUT WAIT--there's more! At the end of the show, one lucky attendee will be the recipient of the live build vehicle. All attendees 18 and over are automatically eligible and entered to win; each single-day ticket purchased equals one entry to win, and each 3-day ticket purchased counts as 3x entries to win.

952865435167.summary: The 2024 CNU Florida Summit will take place on October 16-18, 2024 in Downtown Tampa. Join us as we bring together professionals from a dozen fields to celebrate building a better Florida for the next generation and explore the latest developments in one of the fastest growing cities in the United States. We'll garner key insights, lessons learned and effective approaches to New Urbanism against the backdrop of Tampa's rapidly redeveloping urban core. We'll tackle real-world challenges and solutions, share best practices, connect with peers, and learn from industry leaders who are implementing the principles of the new urbanism throughout Florida. The 2024 CNU Florida Summit is one you won't want to miss. Inspiration guaranteed. Summit Add Ons There are two tours and a training offered Wednesday, October 16 from noon to 1:30 p.m. before the Summit begins. There is an additional chage for these. There are three tour options on Friday, October 18 from 1:00 p.m. to 2:30 p.m. These tours are offered at no additional charge; however, space is limits so we request that you select a free add on ticken when you register for the summit. Game of Zones Training: Hacking Comprehensive Plans and Zoning to Achieve Walkable Urbanism A hands-on session on how to run a zoning code stress test to demonstrate the barriers to Missing Middle Housing. Places seeking more housing choices are often stymied by their existing land development code requirements regarding lot size, parking minimums, setbacks, frontage, and lot coverage. We will examine a conventional, Euclidean code as participants try to try to create a missing middle building type on a traditional, urban lot. (Hint its not on a cul de sac) Drawing skill is not necessary for this exercise, as the lot, a scale, parking spaces, and various missing middle housing types will be provided for participants to arrange. An additional exercise will address the question of whether the building can meet the financial requirements for construction to determine where the barriers to development lie. The Game of Zones Training is offered before the Summit. The cost is $20 with a Summit registration or $65 without a Summit registration. Hotel Information A block of rooms is reserved at the Hotel Tampa Riverwalk. Reservations can be made online or via telephone at 1-800-774-1500. The group code is 91D.
952865435167.description: Join us in Downtown Tampa as we garner key insights, lessons learned, and effective approaches to New Urbanism across the Sunshine State.
952865435167.title: 2024 CNU Florida Summit

885578347677.summary: 2025 Air Force Contracting Summit April 13 - 15, 2025 at the Rosen Centre Hotel in Orlando, Florida Join us for an exclusive Summit tailored for professionals in the defense contracting industry at the 2025 Air Force Contracting Summit. Experience the pinnacle of National Defense Contracting at the forefront of 2025 by attending the Summit! The Summit stands as a premier cornerstone within the landscape of National Defense Contracting events by the participation of esteemed figures including Members of Congress, Pentagon Officials, representatives from Multiple Air Force Commands and Bases, alongside Military Contracting Officers, Financing Sources, Prime Contractors, and Small Businesses from across the Nation. Delve deep into the intricacies of the Air Force FY2025 Budget and gain invaluable insights into Air Force and Department of Defense Contracting Priorities. Explore a wide spectrum of topics ranging from Air Force Mission & Contracting Priorities, including AI, Cyber, Aircraft, Air Warfare, Armaments, Avionics, Logistics, Facilities, Energy, Construction, Engineering, Weapons Systems, Space, Special Operations, and more! Be at the forefront of innovation with discussions on the Air Force 'Base of the Future' initiatives and Energy Resilience Opportunities. Acquire a thorough understanding of Air Force Command Mission & Contracting Priorities, and immerse yourself in discussions on Multi-Year Contract Vehicles that offer Dedicated Prime Contractor & Small Business Tracks. Unlock the potential of New Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Contracting Opportunities and get acquainted with cutting-edge acquisition strategies such as OTA's and other Accelerated/Fast-Track Acquisition Programs. Identify emerging Contracting Opportunities for Prime Defense Contractors & Subcontractors and stay ahead of the curve with analyses of new Pentagon and Air Force Cyber Protection/CMMC Strategies. Forge strategic partnerships through Prime Contractor-Small Business Teaming, Subcontracting & Mentor Protg Opportunities. Access a diverse array of Public and Private Financing Sources and gain insights into New Air Force Small Business Contracting Opportunities. Maximize your networking potential with Matchmaking Sessions featuring Air Force Commands, Government Agencies, and Prime Contractors. Additionally, gain access to Small Business/Diversity Supplier Resources, ensuring you have all of the tools necessary to thrive in the Air Force Contracting landscape. Don't miss this unparalleled opportunity to Connect, Collaborate, and Capitalize on the future of Air Force Contracting. Join us at the 2025 Air Force Contracting Summit and position yourself for success in the evolving defense industry landscape!

Participants learn about product selection, weigh the advantages and disadvantages of filler administration, and explore biostimulants and energy-based devices to diversify their service offerings and boost revenue in their aesthetic practice. In today's dynamic field of aesthetic medicine, there's a growing demand for advanced procedures like buttock augmentation. However, many practitioners lack specialized training in this area, creating an opportunity for professionals to distinguish themselves by acquiring refined skills in minimally invasive techniques. As patient expectations rise, the importance of safety and patient satisfaction cannot be overlooked, making it crucial for practitioners to receive training that emphasizes both advanced skills and a commitment to patient care. Empire Medical Training's program aims to fulfill this need by providing flexible training options that fit into practitioners' busy schedules while offering substantial real-world benefits.

1009343693157.summary: Welcome to the registration page for the 12th Integrated Mathematical Oncology (IMO) workshop at the Moffitt Cancer Center. Now in its 12th year we are supported by our recent grant from the Cancer Systems Biology Consortium (CSBC) on the Delta Ecology of Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer and the Moffitt Cancer Center of Excellence for Evolutionary Therapy (CoE). The IMO workshop is designed to motivate and facilitate a hands-on modeling experience focused on understanding and reducing treatment toxicity. The workshop is comprised of both an educational event and competition and divides participants into multiple teams combining clinical, experimental and theoretical members. These teams integrate their energies to develop and implement a mathematical model focussed on treatment toxicity to facilite treatment discussions across a range of cancers. The teams are expected to come up with a model, solve it and give a presentation all within 4.5 intense days. As always, we will have several independent judges to view both the specific aims and the closing presentations to decide the winning team. To facilitate integration and motivate participation we are offering an Amazon gift voucher to active participants of the winning team and to the runner up team. In addition, to facilitate further development of the winning project we are offering a $50K pilot grant (generously funded by Moffitt Cancer Center) to the leaders of the winning team. As with last years workshop there will be a "speed dating for scientists" to break the ice among diverse group of participants on the 3rd. The opening presentation on the 4th will summarize what is expected of the teams and serve to motivate the subsequent hands on model development sessions. We plan to have a separate poster session on the evening of the 4th to allow participants to showcase their own research. Participation in the workshop requires registration in order to generate the teams and give numbers for the food and beverages we are providing throughout the workshop. We are offering deluxe travel awards for external participation!!! Each award will cover flight + accommodation + meals for up to 6 nights and allow for both national and international scientists to participate in this unique hands on educational event. If you are either a PhD student, Postdoctoral student or junior faculty with a passion for research and a desire to better understand the role of cancer evolution in shaping therapeutic strategies as well as how to build integrated models then please apply during the registration process. Please note: the travel awards are extremely limited and will be offered on a competitive basis, application does not guarantee participation. If you are able to cover your own expenses, please indicate this during the registration process. Please note TRAVEL AWARD APPLICATIONS WILL BE CLOSING ON Wendesday the 2nd of October 2024 at 5pm EST. AWARD WINNERS WILL BE CONTACTED before the 7th of October 2024. What Moffitt Cancer Center under the auspices of the Center for Evolutionary Therapy has been developing evolutionary therapies with the goal to control cancer rather than eradicate it. Across multiple clinical trials this has led to a significant decrease in the amount of time patients are on treatment. As a result treatment driven toxicity has significantly decreased. Currently most cancer treatments only react to toxicity effects and are consistently given at the maximum tolerable dose. Mathematical models of cancer treatment rarely consider toxicity effects and if they do its often through surrogates such as cumulative drug dose. Toxicity impacts many normal homeostatic processes and can be especially harmful to a patients immune system and have long terms impact on heart health, brain health and even drive the emergence of secondary cancers. A question we hope the teams will tackle is how to best balance toxicity and efficacy for treatment of an evolving cancer ? This motivates many more questions: (i) How should toxicity be modelled? (ii) Are drug holidays or drug sequences better for toxicity control? (iii) How long do toxicity effects persist for a given treatment? (iv) Which drugs are the least toxic, would dose reduction help? Therefore, the ambitious focus of this year's workshop is to try, in under week, to come up with novel therapuetic strategies, across a number of cancers, with the explicit goal of reducing toxicity but maintaining efficacy. When Sunday, 6PM, 3rd November 2024 - Friday 2PM, 8th November 2024. Where Speed dating: SRB Atrium, 6PM 3rd November. Intoductory presentation: SRB Murphey, 9AM 4th November. Poster session: TBD, 7PM 4th November. Working group sessions: Various rooms, 4th November - 7th November. Closing presentations: SRB Murphey, 9AM 8th November. Chair and contact The IMO Workshop is chaired and organized by the IMO Department Chair, Sandy Anderson . For more information concerning participation or about the workshop in general please contact IMO Department Assistant Danae Paris directly at Danae Paris .
1009343693157.description: Join us for the 12th IMO Workshop on Cancer Treatment Toxicity.
1009343693157.event_address: 12902 Magnolia Drive Stabile Research Building, Tampa, FL 33612
1009343693157.title: IMO Workshop 12: Toxicity

1031196455357.summary: Learn to enhance your yard with native plants with advice from expert speakers & local environmental organizations. Native plants for sale. Tickets are $25 per person and includes a box lunch. Learn to enhance your yard with native plants 6th Transforming Landscapes for a Sustainable Future January 18, 2025 at the Emerson Center - 1590 27th Avenue Vero Beach, FL 32960 Conference Schedule 8:00AM Online Registration-PelicanIslandAudubon.org-Tickets $25 & includes box lunch. $35 after Jan 12. Native plants on sale from Native Plant Nurseries 9:00- 9:50 Dr. Craig N. Huegel, Curator, University of South Florida Botanical Garden, owner and operator of Hawthorn Hill Native Wildflowers, and teaches biology at St. Petersburg College. Native Trees for Birds 10:00-10:50 Troy Springer, Founder & President, Springer Environmental Services, Taking Green Landscaping to the Next Level 10:50-11:10 Break | Native plants on sale from Native Plant Nurseries 11:10-12:00PM Emily Bell, Communications Coordinator, Florida Wildflower Foundation. Bring on the Butterflies 12:00-1:00 Lunch with Box Lunches included in the $25 admission ticket for those attending in person. 1:00-1:50 Tia Silvasy, University of Florida Residential Horticulture Extension Agent, Hillsborough County, No Mow Lawns in Florida 2:00-2:50 Dr. Lyn Gettys, Associate Professor of Agronomy (Aquatic and Wetland Plant Science) University of Florida/IFAS Fort Lauderdale Research and Education Center in Davie, FL. Healthy Ponds Using Native Plants for a Sustainable Future 2:50-3:20 Break | Native plants on sale from Native Plant Nurseries 3:20-4:10 Eric Draper, Retired Florida Park Service Director & Former Audubon Florida Society Executive Director. State Parks and Wildlife Corridors: Strategies for a Sustainable Future 4:10-4:30 Dr. Richard Baker - Discussion and Summary Speaker Biographie s Dr. Craig N. Huegel , Curator, University of South Florida Botanical Garden, owner and operator of Hawthorn Hill Native Wildflowers, and teaches biology at St. Petersburg College. Former faculty member , Department of Wildlife Ecology and Conservation, University of Florida where he cofounded the Cooperative Urban Wildlife Extension Program. Author of Native Florida Plants for Shady Landscapes, Native Wildflower and Other Ground Covers for Florida Landscapes, and Nave Plant landscaping for Florida Wildlife. Uses central Florida landscapes as laboratories to evaluate native plants and grows a wide variety of species (mostly wildflowers) that are not commonly propagated elsewhere. T roy Springer , Founder & President, Springer Environmental Services, Landscape Professional. 27 years of experience in landscaping and maintenance. He closed Springer Lawn Care and opened Springer Environmental Services to design, build, and maintain high end wildflower meadow projects ranging from urban landscapes to restoring natural areas for private landowners from small installations under $5,000 to projects over $100,000 using 98% all natives plant materials. Active in the Florida Native Plant Society for over fifteen years, including the Suncoast Chapter and state board and received a Green Palmetto Award for service. Emily Bell joined the Florida Wildflower Foundation in 2022 as its communications coordinator. Prior to that, she spent four years coordinating invasive species programs within UF IFAS Extension and for the Florida Invasive Species Partnership. She began her conservation career as an intern for The Nature Conservancy and went on to work for the Florida Department and Environmental Protection and Hawaii Invasive Species Council. She has over a decade of experience with environmental outreach, planning and network building. Emily was born and raised in the wilds of Florida. Tia Silvasy is a Residential Horticulture Extension Agent in Hillsborough County. She leads the Master Gardener Volunteer program and provides educational programming to help homeowners work towards more sustainable landscapes. She got her agricultural roots from growing up on her grandparents farm in Pennsylvania. Shes been working in the horticulture field for over 30 years. Tia received her undergraduate degree from the University of Central Florida and her masters degree from the University of Hawaii. Dr. Lyn Gettys research is focused on the biology and ecology of native and introduced aquatic and wetland plants, developing restoration strategies for native aquatic plants, and evaluation of control methods for managing invasive species. She coordinates the UF/IFAS Aquatic Weed Control Short Course and is an author on more than 300 publications, including 75 refereed papers and 33 articles in Aquatics magazine, and was lead editor Aquatic Ecosystem Restoration Foundations Best Management Practices Manual. Was the 2022 President and currently President-elect of the Florida Aquatic Plant Management Society and the 2022 President of the Florida Weed Science Society and Board Member of Directors and the Science Advisory Panel for the Aquatic Ecosystem Restoration Foundation. Eric Draper advises agencies, non-profits, and businesses on environmental finance and policy. He serves on the boards of the Florida Bicycle Association and Conservation Florida. As former Florida Park Service Director, Florida State Parks increased acreage, revenue, and environmental education programs and were awarded an unprecedented fourth gold medal as Americas best state parks. Over a 40-year conservation career as Executive Director of Audubon Florida, Senior Vice President National Audubon Society, and working for The Nature Conservancy. he has been a leading advocate for land preservation, water resource protection, and Everglades restoration. 1010763690407.summary: Twenty years ago, the world saw the largest NATO enlargement ever when seven nations Bulgaria, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Romania, Slovakia and Slovenia joined the defense alliance. This Big Bang enlargement was intended to help heal painful Cold War divisions and increase the hopes for a lasting security built on shared aspirations for peace and freedom. Today at 75, NATO is bigger, more powerful, and more diverse, yet facing an aggressive war on its eastern doorsteps. The participants in this panel, experts in international security policy and military strategy, will assess the geopolitics of enlargement, the current challenge of Russias return as NATOs main adversary, and the future of the Trans-Atlantic security cooperation. Panelists: Admiral Andrew L. Lewis , Retired Vice Admiral in the United States Navy Retired NATO Officer Distinguished Fellow, Transatlantic Defense and Security Program Center for European Policy Analysis Zachary Selden , Ph.D. Associate Professor, University of Florida Former Deputy Secretary General for Policy at the NATO Parliamentary Assembly, Brussels, Belgium from 2008-2011; Former Director of the Defense and Security Committee of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly, Brussels, Belgium (2000 to 2003) Michael Williams , Ph.D. , Associate Professor, Public Administration and International Affairs Department, Syracuse University Moderator: Tatiana Kostadinova, Ph.D., Professor of Politics & International Relations; Director European & Eurasian Studies, Florida International University Co-sponsors: Miami-Florida Jean Monnet Center of Excellence Department of Politics and International Relations Ruth K. and Shepherd Broad Distinguished Lecture Series Dorothea Green Lecture Series Vclav Havel Program for Human Rights & Democracy
1010763690407.description: Twenty years ago, the world saw the largest NATO enlargement. Meet experts in international security policy and military strategy.
1010763690407.venue_name: Florida International University - Green School International Pavilion (SIPA II, Room 102)
1010763690407.title: Twenty Years after NATOs Big Bang Enlargement

989031017397.summary: This talk will excavate the complex semantic history of the terms rjanya and katriya to gain insight into the Vedic political imagination, as well as challenge a century of scholarship that has retrojected a much later conception of vara onto the past, creating the illusion that caste is a timeless and immutable feature of South Asia. On the contrary, vara is a concept with a surprising history, and there was nothing inevitable about its final development. Join us also for a lighting ceremony, Indian food and classical dance performance in celebration of Diwali 2024.
989031017397.description: The Birth of the rjanya and the Rebirth of the katriya
989031017397.title: Diwali Celebration 2024

1014017602947.summary: Come and discover the world of raw desserts as you learn to make tasty, nutritious sweets. Raw food desserts are healthy, tasty, and free from all the sugar, flour, butter and cream of traditional recipes. Often people cant believe raw desserts can be this tasty. They are also ideal for anyone who loves sweets but is avoiding refined carbohydrates and sugars, dairy products, and unhealthful fats. If you want to experience new flavors and you want your family to eat the best and most nutritious desserts, this class is for you. Hosted by plant-based, certified ACE health coach Julie Ward, you will learn techniques and tips for introducing raw desserts into your diet. Sample recipes include: Raw Strawberry Cream Truffles and Healthy No Bake Snickers Pie. There is no heating involved, so these treats will also maintain their original whole food nutrient dense value. Julie will be using some nuts in the recipes. Nuts and seeds are a great source of heart-healthy fats, fiber and protein, and they pack a number of vitamins and minerals. If you have an allergy, please let the host know. Cancelling Your Reservation: In order to receive a full refund, participants must cancel their program registration at least 72 hours prior to the scheduled start of the program. Center for Health & Wellbeings Refund Policy This program is presented by Julie Ward and is hosted by the Winter Park Health Foundation. About the Presenter: Julie Ward invites audiences to approach health differently. Her presentations merge the power of plant-based nutrition, the spirituality of food, and her own relatable stories. As a 100% plant-based, certified ACE health coach, Julies passion for plants enlivens her presentations. Her wealth of firsthand experience makes her presentations personal and inspiring. As an international health speaker who overcame her own digestive issues and depression using food as medicine, Julie gives hope to those facing chronic health challenges. Educating audiences and clients about how we can nurture our digestive systems stands at the forefront of her work. Emphasizing the interconnectedness of our health, Julie challenges audiences to connect their mental, physical and spiritual experiences. Her presentations provide participants with a foundation of understanding and knowledge that empowers listeners to make better health choices, connect with their food, boost energy, and improve mental clarity. Julie holds a certificate in PlantBased Nutrition from eCornell, a Masters in Public Policy from USC and a B.S. in Mathematics from Spelman College. She is also a Plant-Based Chef, certified ACE Health Coach, and an herbalist. To learn more about Julie Ward, please visit https://freshfoodalchemy.com/
1014017602947.description: Come and discover the world of raw desserts as you learn to make tasty, nutritious sweets.
1014017602947.title: Fall-themed Raw Desserts

Get ready for an evening of glamour and inspiration at the 4th Annual Gala: V oice of Valor Join us at Celebration Hall in beautiful St. Augustine, Florida near St Augustine beach and Vilano Beach. It's a night you won't want to miss, filled with music, art, theatre, comedy and a whole lot of heart. Let's come together to celebrate courage and resilience. Save the date and bring your voice to this amazing event! Walk the Red Carpet and get your pictures taken with Antique Cars and Inside with Photo Booth - Evelyn Toro with Toro Photos. Night filled with Theatre , presenting Kim Mullins , Comedian Daisy Tackett , Musician and Anthem Singer Shayla Nelson and Emcee Latoya Calhoun . When you arrive you will be greeted with red carpet and a touch of History as Classic Antique Cars from 1950-1960 for photo shoot outside. You and your guests will get red carpet grand entrance. Inside we will tell the stories of military women from She Served and through P2P therapeutic Art Program. If you feel a sweet tooth coming on we will have dessert and candy table just for our guests, along with Alcohol. 1044867786677.summary: Join the Maurice A. Ferr Institute for Civic Leadership for a fireside chat with Dr. Antonia Coello Novello, a dedicated public health administrator, who in 1990 became the first woman and first Hispanic U.S. Surgeon General. Dr. Novello will discuss her life and the lessons she learned, as documented in her memoir "Duty Calls: Lessons Learned from an Unexpected Life of Service." Dr. Antonia Coello Novello was the first woman and the first Hispanic Surgeon General of the United States. Among the priorities during her tenure, she focused on the health of young people, women, and minorities. She also issued reports and spoke out on underage drinking, smoking, drug abuse, AIDS (especially among women and adolescents), childhood immunization and injury prevention, and improved healthcare for minorities. As an MD, her medical specialties are in pediatric and adult nephrology, and she also received a doctorate in public health. In 1999, she was nominated as the New York State Commissioner of Health. Event Partners: FIU Herbert Wertheim College of Medicine FIU Kimberly Green Latin American and Caribbean Center FIU Adam Smith Center for Economic Freedom FIU Department of Public Policy and Administration FIU in DC Borinquen Medical Centers We Are Ms Sponsored by: The Ruth K. and Shepard Broad Distinguished Lecture Series The Dorothea Green Lecture Series
1044867786677.description: Join the Ferr Institute at FIU for a fireside chat with Dr. Antonia Novello, the first woman and first Hispanic to be U.S. Surgeon General.
1044867786677.event_address: 11200 Southwest 8th Street Green Pavilion - SIPA II 102, Miami, FL 33199
1044867786677.venue_name: Florida International University - Modesto Maidique Campus
1044867786677.title: "Duty Calls" - A Fireside Chat with Dr. Antonia Novello

1017189540297.summary: What is Tech Weekend and Founders Village: Founders Village is close-knit community that exclusively exists to support founders. We are based in San Francisco, Bayarea. Over 2.5 years, we've cultivated a close-knit, give-first culture where most founders regularly attend and actively contribute. Our Signature event Tech Weekend repeats every 5 weeks. Tech Weekend attracts founders from 20+ US states and 15+ countries, mostly aged 25-55, from solo founders & scientists to CEO's of 150 people companies. Our Slack and Whatsapp groups connect attendees prior to the event, so by the time you arrive at the event, you have already met one another and are ready for your face-to-face meeting. It is common for them to keep in contact long after the event, and they are often able to find co-founders, investors, partnership opportunities or exchange introductions. Beyond workshops and networking events, Tech Weekend creates a unique environment for building lasting relationships. Through shared meals, collaborative activities, and even shared accommodations, you'll have ample opportunities to connect with fellow founders on a deeper level. Consider Tech Weekend a curated community of like-minded entrepreneurs, where you can learn, grow, and support each other on your entrepreneurial journey. This Tech Weekend, our mission is clear: connect founders with as many investors as possible to fuel their fundraising success. From our VC Mixer and talks to the Pitch Competition, we're doubling down on opportunities for face-to-face interaction. Plus, we've added technical sessions for insights into the latest industry trends. Intrigued? Check out the full agenda for all the details! CONNECT EARLY ON A WHATSAPP & Slack GROUP: Start connecting with founders before the Tech Weekend. Get to know who's coming. Increase your chances of finding co-founders, investors and users. Stay connected with hundreds of founders part of the tech Weekend Community and get real-time updates, networking and sharing insights. 2- Overnight Stay at a Hotel: Traveling from out of town, no worries. We've partnered with hotels Close to the event venue to offer you a seamless overnight stay over the Tech Weekend. ======================================================== Curious about what Tech Weekend looks like? Check out our Instagram For any questions, please feel free to reach out at events@foundersvillage.co
1017189540297.description: Non-stop networking gathering for Founders, Investors, and Tech Professionals

1013191000557.summary: Five startups have completed the Cal Poly Center for Innovation & Entrepreneurship's (CIE) two-year Incubator program. Join us to celebrate their achievements and learn what is next for each company! The startups we are celebrating include: AcreCloud has a farm-management platform that offers growers and contractors customized control over their operations, extensive auditing capabilities and access to new products, such as AcrePay and AcreAnalytics VETAMA is a mobile veterinary franchise. Veterinarians get the freedom of mobile practice ownership without having to do it alone. Quantum Energy, Inc. is driving a clean energy future by providing data that quantifies the hidden emissions and environmental impacts of energy. Their platform equips decision-makers with the insights needed to invest in clean energy, reducing harmful emissions and supporting a healthier planet. Farm to Table Co. is significantly improving independent access to quality food and maximizing crop yields while reducing the environmental costs of food production in a meaningful way in our communities. Little Place Labs is a software company that specializes in building advanced machine-learning solutions for deployment and execution on satellites and other space infrastructures. We are so excited to showcase these startups as well as meet the next group that is coming through our program. Light appetizers and drinks provided. Seating is limited. Please RSVP by October 31st.

1042419884937.summary: Did you know you can cook traditional Mexican cuisine using an induction cooktop? Learn about the magnetic magic of induction cooking and how you can make the switch from gas with no compromise and many benefits! The County of Santa Clara's Office of Sustainability and Resilience is pleased to invite you to a FREE live cooking experience featuring celebrity and Michelin star chef at Auro in Napa Valley , Rogelio Garcia . Chef Rogelio is a first-generation Mexican-American chef, Top Chef alum, and James Beard Foundations Best Chef in California shortlist. He uses his culinary skills to demystify the art of induction cooking, while highlighting traditional Mexican flavors with Californias local ingredients. We will also be joined by special guest, Sylvia Arenas, Santa Clara County Supervisor, District 1, along with our MC Glorybella from Amor 100.3. Join us as Michelin Star Chef Rogelio Garcia makes his delicious homemade tacos with fresh salsa while discussing the benefits of electric induction cooking a safer, healthier, and higher-performance cooking alternative to natural gas. In addition to learning about induction cooking, you will also have the chance to learn about energy saving programs and community resources: Save energy & lower your utility bills by signing up for your no-cost energy efficiency kits from Rising Sun Center for Opportunity. Talk to Silicon Valley Clean Energy about your energy bill and ways to save. Learn about and provide input on the County's climate action planning efforts. All attendees are eligible to be entered into a drawing for a portable induction cooktop and a full set of induction cookware + other giveaways. The presentation will be in English and Spanish. For more information, contact (408) 993 4760 or Sustainability@ceo.sccgov.org. Photo/Video Disclaimer: A professional videographer will be present to take photos and video for BayREN promotional purposes. If you do not want to appear in any photos, please make yourself known to the videographer or staff at the registration table upon check-in at this event. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Sabas que puedes cocinar cocina tradicional Mexicana usando una estufa de induccin? Conoce la magia magntica de las estufas de induccin, sin concesiones y con muchos beneficios! La Oficina de Sostenibilidad y Resiliencia del Condado de Santa Clara se complace en invitarte a una experiencia de cocina en vivo GRATUITA con el chef famoso y estrella Michelin, Rogelio Garca , en Auro en Napa Valley. El chef Rogelio es un chef mexicano-estadounidense de primera generacin, ex concursante de Top Chef y est en la lista de los mejores chefs de California de la Fundacin James Beard. Utiliza sus habilidades culinarias para desmitificar el arte de la cocina por induccin, mientras resalta los sabores tradicionales mexicanos con los ingredientes locales de California. T ambin nos acompaar la invitada especial, Sylvia Arenas, Supervisora del Condado de Santa Clara, Distrito 1, junto con nuestra anfitriona Glorybella de Amor 100.3 . nete a nosotros mientras el chef de estrella Michelin Rogelio Garca prepara sus deliciosos tacos caseros con salsa fresca, mientras habla sobre los beneficios de la cocina por induccin elctrica: una alternativa de coccin ms segura, saludable y de mayor rendimiento en comparacin con el gas natural. Adems de aprender sobre la cocina por induccin, tambin tendrs la oportunidad de conocer programas de ahorro de energa y recursos comunitarios: Ahorre energa y reduzca sus facturas registrndose para recibir un kit para ahorrar energia de Rising Sun Center for Opportunity. Habla con Silicon Valley Clean Energy sobre tu factura de energa y maneras de ahorrar. Infrmate sobre otros reembolsos y recursos para hacer tu hogar ms cmodo y eficiente por menos. Todos los asistentes son elegibles para participar en un sorteo de una cocina de induccin porttil y un juego completo de utensilios de cocina de induccin, adems de otros obsequios. Presentacins ser en ingls y espaol. Para obtener ms informacin, comunquese al (408) 993 4760 o Sustainability@ceo.sccgov.org . Descargo de responsabilidad sobre fotografas y vdeos: Un camargrafo profesional estar presente para tomar fotografas y vdeos con fines promocionales de BayREN. Si no desea aparecer en ninguna fotografa, dse a conocer al camargrafo o al personal en la mesa de registro al registrarse en este evento.

795003876997.summary: Introduction We are a team of business owners and sales leaders who have come together to build a successful network. Whether you're looking to refine your business skills, improve your speaking, or connect with industry leaders, our diverse group can help you grow your business. The Challenging Economy for Businesses Businesses face the ongoing challenge of attracting new customers, retaining existing customers or they struggle to expand into new markets. Without an effective plan, businesses will limit their growth potential, have inconsistent customer acquisition which may lead to revenue fluctuations. Do you want to face this challenge by yourself? The Benefit of Business Networking Networking often leads to Word-Of-Mouth Referrals , which can be a powerful & cost-effective way to acquire new customers. Happy clients & business associates can become advocates for your business, helping to expand your reach for new customers. Through networking, business owners can find opportunities for joint marketing efforts, such as co-hosting events, cross-promotions, or shared advertisting campaigns. Collaborative Marketing helps our members grow their reach into a broader audience of potential customers. Networking can also help business owners with Access to Marketing Expertise like marketing professionals, consultants, or agencies who can provide solutions and implementation to help business owners stay focused on running their businesses. Are you Eligible? Are you Ready? Unfortuantely, everyone cannot join our successful networking team because we only permit one person per industry. We do not permit category competition within our group instead we promote power partnerships to grow member's businesses. The following categories are closed: Bakery, Bankcard Services, Business Funding, Cemetery Plots (Funeral Services), Contractor: General, Contractor: Roofing, Data Analytics Consultant, Financial Advisor, Health & Fitness, Hotelier, Insurance: Commercial, Insurance: Employee Benefits, Insurance: Life, Health & Accident, Insurance: Medicare, Internet Consultant, Mortgage Loans, Payroll Service, Photographer, Real Estate: Commercial, Real Estate: Residential, Screen Printing, Social Media Marketing, Solar Energy Systems, Water Ionization, Websites The following categories are open: Accountant, Advertising Specialties, Architect, Auto & Truck Repair, Auto Body Repair, Auto Detailer, Banker, Bookkeeper, Business Attorney, C.P.A., Carpet Cleaner, Chiropractor, Commercial Painting, Dentist, Elder Law, Electrician, Employee Law, Estate Planning Attorney, Family Law, Floor Covering, Handyman, Heating & Air Conditioning, Home & Property Inspector, Insurance: Employee Benefits, Interior Designer, IT Consultant, Massage Therapist, Personal Injury Attorney, Pest Control, Plumber, Printer, Property Manager, Real Estate Attorney, Residential Cleaning Service, Residential Painting, Restoration Damage & Clean Up, Security Systems & Title Insurance. If your business category is not listed in either, please email john@insureyoursuccess.com to confirm eligibility. Event Details We meet Wednesdays 11:30 AM to 1:00 PM at the Downtown Anaheim Community Center located at 250 East Center Street, Anaheim, CA 92805 . Free parking is available in the parking lot directly to the East of the community center and in the parking structure directly north of the community center. Ticket Details IMPORTANT STEPS BEFORE BUYING TICKETS SEND email to john@insureyoursuccess.com to confirm your category is available. WAIT to receive the confirmation to purchase your ticket(s). APPROVED confirmation email, then you can buy your ticket. If you get a denial, we will still help you find a networking chapter. Just reply to the denial email requesting introduction to another chapter. We will handle the rest. Eligibility for a guest will be confirmed within 24 hours via email with a link to register. Attendees interested in lunch, must purchase their tickets by 5:00 PM Tuesday, the day before the event. How Do We Measure Success? When you visit our events, join our team and close business with us, you are supporting the Orange County business community. In 2023, we closed $4,942,367 in new business for our members! In 2022, we closed $2,671,252 in new business for our members! Be a part of the solution.
795003876997.description: Discover North Orange County's Top Event for Business Owners & Sales Leaders | Build Your Sales Pipeline with Referrals
795003876997.title: Business Networking for Growth: Meet Key Contacts in Anaheim

509636896677.summary: Please Note: WAIVER: Please sign our online liability waiver before the event. You'll only need to sign this once, and it's good for all CCA volunteer events for 2024! Sign Here . SUPPORT: Our programs are funded and equipped by donations from supporters like you! Consider pitching in $5 or more each time you volunteer , to help keep these volunteer events going. In 2023 we had about 30 events. Donate to Support Our Programs: Choose the ticket 'Free + Donation' or go to our Donations page with more options. If you are having any issues with registering for the event please call (949)216-0880 for further assistance. Join Forces With Your Friends & Neighbors The Coastal Corridor Alliance (CCA), formerly Banning Ranch Conservancy, is taking the Santa Ana River Coastal Corridor (the tidal influence zone) under our wing to help clean it up and restore its habitats. Join us! Fairview Park, Every 3rd Saturday You and the community are invited to join the Conservancy at Fairview Park in Costa Mesa from 9 am - 11:30 am, every 3rd Saturday . We've adopted a degraded area in Fairview Park to restore to native habitat. We... Remove invasive plants Collect native seeds Plant natives Care for the young plants until they are established, by watering and maintaining the soil Remove debris in the soil Along the way we'll be learning which plants we see around us and what their role or impact is on our local habitats, which animal species they attract, and more. This is an amazing opportunity for hands-on learning for how to better care for our local environment! We also need additional local volunteers to help with maintenance and monitoring . Please click here to learn more about joining our Maintenance and Monitoring Team . Register today, and we'll follow up with the details!
509636896677.description: In 2023, CCA adopted an area of Fairview Park for community-led habitat restoration. Join the journey!
509636896677.title: Fairview Park Habitat Restoration Days [Every 3rd Saturday]

1049207526957.summary: The Heart Center Women's Circle: A Gathering for Women Empowerment in a Quantum Transformation Field An in-person and online gathering of women who are ready to connect deeply inside their soul heart mind energy body and to empower each other in a nourishing and transformative vibrational field. Agenda Do you want to nourish your health, relationships, and finances within a loving and authentic sisterhood? For centuries, women have empowered each other in Womens Circles. On November 9th @ 1pm PT , join us to discover your true purposebecause the purpose of life is to serve. When we serve, we help others become happier, healthier, and empowered. Were thrilled to feature our special guest Kalika Yap serial entrepreneur, branding coach, host of the EO Wonder Podcast, and author of The Little Brand Book. Together, Winnie and Kalika will guide us with practical techniques and inspiring messages to help you clarify your service to the world. Join us in person or via Zoom! Register now at HeartCenter.LA/women . The Heart Center Women's Circle -A Gathering for Women Empowerment in a Quantum Transformation Field Join us for an empowering and transformative Women Circle at the Heart Center. This experience is designed to help women connect to their inner truth so they can be loved for the totality of who they are. The quantum field carries the most nourishing love to help us accept and release. We grow simply by sharing our breaths into this sacred space. If you are looking for a community that will love you for your authenticity, this is the place to be held. We believe that the greatest love melts all blockages! The Heart Center Women's Circle offers four elements: -> Soul level upliftments -> Heart centered connections -> Enlightening wisdom -> Movement in the energy and body For the best experience, please arrive 10 minutes before the start with a water bottle, a journal and a yoga mat. Please kindly fill out a class waiver prior to the event. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- What is a Heart Center Womens Circle and who is it for? Quantum physics tells us that everything and everyone is a vibrational field. The vibrational field carries information (made up of soul, heart and mind), energy and matter. Vibrational field is something that can extend over time and space. This is good news, because even though science tells us the Body Keeps the Score and the traumas are stored in our body, we are not stuck. Here at Heart Center, we are committed to delivering the fastest, easiest and safest way to transform our negative information into positive information. Negative information leads to sickness, relationship challenges and financial challenges. The good news, everything we experience is a manifestation of information, and Tao Calligraphy carries the sources most positive information to help us prosper in health, relationships and finances. If you are looking for everything in a womens circle (connection, empowerment and rejuvenation), and you want to experience a quantum shift, join a circle at the Heart Center! -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- A lovely gem of a space for connection and soulful support. Winnie is so knowledgeable and so strongly tapped into her heart. She is authentically loving, and her intuition is on fire - she is SO quick to grasp and articulate deep insights about me and the people around her. Each session offers profound insights and attunement that create a powerfully healing space that is accessible and inviting to All. It is a community service at the highest level. - N.S. " First of all, the center is very beautiful and gives you an overwhelming sense of calm. The women's circle is wonderful and will leave you feeling loved and understood. After the session, we did a fun tarot card reading, and it was eye-opening for me. I highly recommend the women's circle. Winnie is a lightfunny, caring, and full of insight. - A.R. I had the honor of experiencing each Tao Calligraphy session at the Heart Centre with Winnie Wang and her dedicated team. The energy was undeniable, and the heart-opening effects were profound. Each session brought a sense of serenity and enlightenment, significantly enhancing our energy and emotional balance. The transformative power of Tao Calligraphy was unmistakable, and we left feeling rejuvenated and deeply connected. Winnie and her teams heart-centered approach made the experience truly special and impactful. We highly recommend the Heart Centre to anyone seeking deep healing and personal transformation. - C.J. If you want to feel rejuvenated, empowered and uplifted in a circle of women, this event is for you. Get ready for your quantum nourishment and transformation at The Heart Center Women's Circle . Questions? Email info @HeartCenter.LA Hello! I'm Winnie, a beautiful, loving, powerful female leader living in South Pasadena, CA After 4 science degrees including Computer Science and Electrical Engineering from MIT and spending most of her professional life diagnosing the problem as a Traditional Chinese Medicine practitioner, Winnie is an enlightened being thanks to her intensive training and authorities as received from world renowned spiritual healer, Dr. and Master Zhi Gang Sha. Through healing her own childhood traumas, immigration traumas, sexual traumas, divorce and parental alienation, she is like a phoenix that has risen from the ashes. Because of all the mud she had to rise above, Winnie is passionate and empowers people to step into their source power to heal themselves. Her special gift is in seeing the Perfection and knowing how to balance the yin yang so that you can be strong in discipline and soft in surrender at the same time. To check out her lifes work, visit https://www.MindfulHealingHeart.com -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Love is the answer and the flourisher. Love and serve with our unique gift. Love our teams, our numbers and our systems. Jay + Winnie + Howie = Greatest Harmony Team. Our pillars are love, authenticity and community. We are most honored to welcome anyone who wants to improve all aspects of their health, relationships and finances by aligning themselves with the source's 10 greatest attributes: love, forgiveness, compassion, light, humility, harmony, flourishing, gratitude, service and enlightenment. Every Wednesday 7pm PT, come grow with us in the Ten Da Tao Calligraphy field, which contains the source's most positive information as created by Dr. and Master Zhi Gang Sha. In person and on zoom. We welcome you to bring food. Food is one way we share and give love! It is FREE so please share this with all your loved ones. Each week Heal one, heal all. Flourish one, flourish all. Here at @heartcenterLA, we are really committed to your health, relationships and finances because we are ONE. Your wellness is our wellness. https://heartcenter.la/connect

1021320295497.summary: Join us at Network with NAWBO: Kendra Scott Shop for Good at Westfield UTC. As a creative mind with a love of natural gemstones, Kendra designed her first collection of jewelry in 2002. The foundation of Kendras success has been her infectious energy and entrepreneurial spirit, which took her from a $500 project in the spare bedroom of her home to a billion dollar fashion brand loved globally. Since she began her company, Kendra has lived by three core values: Family, Fashion and Philanthropy. She created a brand and culture that authentically values giving back and making a positive difference in the community. Staying true to the CEO's vision to give back, Kendra Scott will donate 20% of their profits at this event in support of NAWBO San Diego's mission to propel female entrepreneurs. We will have sips, sweets, jewels and shop for good! *Note: Please make sure to read our Photography Disclaimer statement upon completing registration.

1044224322057.summary: Cuties Los Angeles Presents: Let's Werk ~ A Weekly Coworking Date Just for Queers! Join us on Thursdays for queer coworking! Well be popping up each week at The Ruby Fruit in Silverlake from 11a-3p. Feel free to join for the entire time or just a portion. The Ruby Fruit is a lesbian-owned wine bar & has an amazing selection of food and bevvies. We are so excited to be holding space with them! To show your support for this queer-owned space, you are required to purchase food or drink! Please do not bring in any outside food or beverages (aside from water)! Why is a purchase required? The Ruby Fruit is a small biz with a full staff of Cuties working together to keep this space going! In exchange for them sharing their space with us, it's important to support them by making purchases and tipping your servers! Because of this change, we are now making registration free for everyone! Street parking & a small lot. Indoor and outdoor seating available, Cuties. Limited outlet availability so come charged up! Meet new people & share what you're working on, brainstorm a new project together, read a book, or quietly work and enjoy the energy.
1044224322057.title: Let's Werk ~ A Weekly Coworking Date Just for Queers

1044665150587.summary: Led by Camille Ora-Nicole Join us for a productive afternoon of writing at Confidential Coffee! Whether you're a seasoned writer or just starting out, this meetup is the perfect opportunity to connect with fellow queer writers and get some work done in a supportive environment. Bring your laptop, notebook, or whatever you use to write, and prepare to be inspired by the energy of the group. We'll have dedicated time for writing, as well as opportunities to share your work and receive feedback. All that identify as LGBTQ+ are welcome to join, however BIPOC participants will be centered. This session is PAY WHAT YOU CAN. The Queer 26 is a 501(c)3 nonprofit; all donations support our programming. All donations are tax deductible. About The Queer 26 The Queer 26 is a media arts non-profit supporting QTBIPOC creatives. Through our workshops, events, and media projects, we help our communities thrive while pursuing their dreams. We understand that in order to fully support our community, we must take a holistic approach to attend to the needs of burgeoning creatives.
