921837519837.summary: Are you a woman seeking a deeper sense of passion, vitality and connection with other femme-identified beings? Join us on second Saturdays at Green Yogi Telegraph for a monthly womens circle, where we will dance, move, sing, and co-create rituals to return to our sacred wisdom within! This is a safe space where we practice living life from our authenticity and expressing ourselves freely to awaken, connect, and practice our innate magic. The Goddess Temple is a sacred and mystic gathering, facilitated by somatic coach and movement artist Magali Clazon, to heal and awaken our creative forces, our bodies and to remember our ancestral wisdom . It is time to root into our sacred gifts and gain confidence to bring them to life! When we do this work collectively in ceremony with other women, the energy rises, and fears dissipate and transform into something new. We gather to regenerate our collective and individual forces. Rituals, conscious dancing, chants, prompts, movement & breath, animal wisdom, somatic coaching are designed to make this experience unique, as we are. The Goddess Temple is a safe place to be who we truly are and to inspire others and be inspired by our natural wisdom. Tickets for this special event are $30. **We offer student, educator, elder and BIPOC discounts! Reach out to events@mygreenyogi.com for more info.

1042493926397.summary: E.P.I.C. CONNECTION AUTHENTIC RELATING NIGHTS! Embodied Presence in Community! Have you been feeing the collective trauma and tenderness? This weeks theme will make space to explore how we can "TEND THE TENDER" Come share in an engaging blend of practices in community that supports deeper connection, creativity, vulnerability and presence. Well play games and explore forms that welcome all parts of ourselves. A welcoming, safe space to reveal and share from your authentic, genuine,real and maybe raw embodied experience. Come be seen, felt & received. A great way to explore your edges, make new friends, have real, engaging, embodied conversations, know yourself better and meet others from an authentic, heartfelt, honest & vulnerable space. First and third Tuesday Starting October 15th 7:15-9pm $35-$25 sliding scale A few scholarship tickets available if finances are a hindrance. Led by Rani Joy Rani Joy has been leading Embodiment Practices since 1997. She has a Masters's Degree in Transpersonal Psychology and is a Somatic Therapist specializing in Hakomi ~ A healing mindfulness based form of Body Centered Therapy. She is also a Transformational Life Coach, Bodyworker, Energy Worker & leads Yoga, Contact Dance & Authentic Movement.Rani Joy has been sharing in Authentic Relating Practices for over a decade starting with the wonderful and active Boulder community. She did a facilitator training in Bali and has shared this work around the Bay Area, Hawaii, Mexico and wherever she can sprinkle some connection inspiration along her travels! Her offerings create a safe, fun, engaging, and welcoming space to dive into deeper self-discovery, embodiment, connection and play!

We're inviting local photographers and creatives to use our store as a coworking space. We've got free wifi, bottomless coffee, a big wooden table with power outlets, a clean bathroom, a friendly and knowledgable staff of pro photographers and creatives, and we're located in Hayes Valley, where food and libations abound. Please RSVP to reserve a spot . We kindly ask that you remove your RSVP if you don't plan to come so that somebody else can nab your space. We're a store in a rad part of town, so we can't always guarantee that we'll have space for you, so please plan accordingly. About The Space Quite simply, it's retail space. We have big communal tables that our neato staff, rad customers and you will all use and share. This is not a quiet working space, it's meant to be a place to chat, share, learn, discuss and meet like-minded creative folks. About Us: We're Peak Design, an SF-based product design company. We specialize in carry goods: products that help you carry, organize, and manage your things. We make gear for photographers, creatives, travelers, commuters, and everyone in-between. 1014884836867.summary: Positive Cre(Asians) Sunday, 10/27/2024, 3PM-5PM Location: TogetherSF , 2505 Mariposa Street Tickets: $5 Description of Event: Join us for a dynamic and inclusive event celebrating the fusion of creativity and mental health healing! Our program features a diverse array of talents, including artists, dancers, comedians, DJs, mental health experts, and more! This event will explore how DJs balance performing and their mental well-being. We will take a deep dive into getting to know our panelists, and their process of practicing, performing, and their journey to where they are now.. But that's not all! We're honored to have representatives from Kaiser Permanente organization joining us, underscoring the importance of holistic health. Your questions are important to us, and we will be hosting a Q&A session featuring our showcased creatives. Along with the Q&A, we will have an interactive portion workshop/activity led by our panelists! About the Panel of Creatives: DJ Dailo Mac (she/her) , is a seasonedopen-format DJ with more than twodecades of experience. She has aknack for thrilling audiences ofdiverse ages and cultural ackgrounds, whether it's atcorporate functions, intimate private events, collaborative performances with other artists, wedding receptions, bustling clubs, or high-energy K-pop dance soires. DJ Dailo Mac is deeply committed to her community, collaborating with various local organizations, including Dear Community, Frameline, the City of Hayward, and the Oakland Asian Cultural Center. DJ Dailo Mac's musical expression knows no bounds, as she seamlessly blends a variety of genres including hip-hop, R&B, reggaetn, freestyle, pop, edm and old classics. Her unique style involves skillfully intertwining beloved tracks from the past with the latest hits, creating a dynamic and nostalgic atmosphere that resonates with audiences of all ages. Velvet Pistol is a rising DJ and music curator hailing from the vibrant Bay Area, known for blending deep grooves, electrifying beats, and soulful rhythms. With a style rooted in house, tech house, and disco, Velvet Pistols sets are a dynamic fusion of old-school vibes and cutting-edge sounds that move dance floors from dusk to dawn. Velvet Pistol has quickly built a reputation for delivering immersive, high-energy performances. Whether spinning at an intimate afters or headliner event, Velvet Pistols eclectic taste and intuitive mixing keep crowds captivated, creating unforgettable sonic experiences. Passionate about connecting with audiences through music, Velvet Pistols sets are more than just performancesthey are journeys that transcend genre and space, with a focus on community, freedom, and expression. With a growing presence in the Bay Area and beyond, Velvet Pistol continues to push boundaries, staying true to the roots while always keeping an ear to the future. JP Breganza - Our Sponsor, Kaiser Permanente has been providing high-quality health care and coverage for more than 75 years. By connecting care with coverage, we pioneered a new model for health care, where things are designed to work together and help our members thrive. Our care model enables our teams to think and work as one, coordinating your care seamlessly, so you dont have to and delivering better care when it matters most.
1014884836867.description: This program invites different creatives that incorporate mental health healing into their art; DJ's, performers, comedians, etc.
1014884836867.title: Dear Community: Positive Cre(Asians)- Feel the Beat, Heal the Mind

787911212647.summary: LA Kinky Weirdos is a collective of kinksters in the LA County area. We originally started on our sizeable Discord server during the pandemic and have since expanded into a monthly meetup and munch, quickly becoming one of the biggest in LA! The LA Kinky Weirdos Munch is not a play party but a large gathering at the beautiful bar/restaurant The Trophy Wife in Silverlake! We host on the outside patio as we try to be covid-conscious. If you're worried about being an introvert, you'll be in good company! Everyone who comes to this event is eager to meet new people. LA Kinky Weirdos was created out of a desire for a more thoughtful and inclusive space for kinksters to socialize. Created by a black transgender woman, LAKW prides itself on being the kind of event where the full diversity of our community is on full display! Come as yourself! We are an entertaining and often fashionable bunch, so this year, we wanted to have monthly prompts to add more fun! It's not required, just fun. Jan - Y2K Feb - Wear Something Red/Pink March - Wear Something Green April - Super Hero May - Wear Something Floral June - 90s Grunge July - Cosplay Aug - Ren Faire Sep - Back to School Oct - Wear your Halloween Costume Nov - Gothic Dec - Glitter/Sequins Rules: This is a vaccinated only event. We respect that rules around vaccinations have been lifted for public gatherings, but we want to protect those in our community who are more vulnerable to the virus. Out of respect for those people and our community, please only come to the event if youve been vaccinated. You must be 18+ to attend this event. Please keep your attire vanilla. We are a group of very fashionable folks, but we do not want to draw unwanted attention to our group. Please do not, for example, walk your submissive in on leash. Respect the boundaries and consent of others. Just because this is a kink-positive space does not mean everyone in this space is comfortable with touch or the rapid assumption of familiarity. Do not touch, grope or in any way molest someone without their consent. Additionally, keep any that does happen to a minimum. This is still not a kink party and still a very public venue where children are occasionally present. A lcohol Consumption is for people who are 21+ only. Our current venue is a restaurant and a bar, meaning people under the age of 18 are technically allowed at the venue. However, alcohol consumption is still illegal for those under the age of 21. We are in good standing with the venue and we do not want to risk that by allowing or covering underage drinking. If you are under the age of 21 and over the age of 18, you are allowed to come to our munch, but you will be asked to leave if we catch you consuming alcohol. Those who provide the alcohol will also be asked to leave as well. Providing and consuming alcohol illegally at this event is grounds for removal from our community. Please respect this rule. If youve been banned from our community, you are also banned from our events. While you do not need to be part of our server to attend this event, if youve been banned from our server, you are also banned from our in-person events and will be asked to leave. Generally speaking, if youve been banned from our server, youve done something particularly heinous or violated someone in some way. We do not want that energy around our in-person gatherings Respect the boundaries and consent of others. Just because this is a kink-positive space does not mean everyone in this space is comfortable with touch or the rapid assumption of familiarity. Do not touch, grope or in any way molest someone without their consent. Additionally, keep any that does happen to a minimum. This is still not a kink party and still a very public venue where children are occasionally present. Please report bad behavior to the organizer
787911212647.description: The LA Kinky Weirdos Munch is one of the most inclusive and diverse BDSM munches in the city. A perfect event for newcomers to the scene!
787911212647.event_address: 3715 Evans St W, Los Angeles, CA 90027, Los Angeles, CA 90027
787911212647.title: The LA Kinky Weirdos Munch

965393537057.summary: LOS ANGELES ASTRO SALON New Monthly Astrology Gathering! In the Lecture Room! Please join us for the launch of a new astrology-themed gathering at PRS: Los Angeles Astro Salon is a monthly meetup for professional astrologers and serious astrology students of all levels. Hosted by Vivi Henriette of ART of the ZODIAC . This months (October) salon opens with a brief conversation with the Los Angeles-based occultist and author Gabriela Herstik . Afterwards, well open it to the group for a discussion of the current astrological weather. The remaining time will be for mingling and making friends! ABOUT GABRIELA Gabriela Herstik has been a leading voice in witchcraft and the occult for nearly a decade, exploring the erotic and esoteric. Shes a bestselling author of "Inner Witch," "Bewitching the Elements," "Embody Your Magick," "Sacred Sex," and "Goddess Energy," and co-creator of the "Goddess of Love Tarot" deck. Gabriela hosts the podcast "Love, Lust & Magick," discussing kink, occultism, and more. Featured in Vogue, Cosmo, and Nylon, shes also a priestess of Slut Coven, blending her 5+ years of BDSM work into her spiritual and creative practice. FOLLOW GABRIELLA IN ALL THE PLACES: instagram.com/gabyherstik https://www.threads.net/@gabyherstik gabrielaherstik.com https://open.spotify.com/show/4bajQKjLC8EMyG5TTssWpO?si=d9e8876b9aa04b1 ABOUT VIVI Vivi Henriette is an LA-based astrologer and tarot reader whose collaborative approach to divination weaves in storytelling and mythology to create a container for her clients to explore their personal narrative. Shes also the host of the podcast TALKTALKTALK . FOLLOW ART of the ZODIAC & Vivi Henriette on INSTAGRAM + YOUTUBE + SPOTIFY for the latest TALKTALKTALK. Ticket Price: This event is Free with RSVP on Eventbrite, limited to 35 persons max in the Lecture Room. We suggest a donation of $5 - $10 to help PRS maintain its historic space. Please Note : The PRS Lecture Room is only accessible via stairs. PRS wants all guests to be able to enjoy our events safely and comfortably. If you require any accessibility accommodation, please reach out to events@prs.org before showtime and we will be happy to assist you. Email events@prs.org or phone 323-663-2167 with any questions.
965393537057.description: Please join us for the launch of a new astrology-themed gathering at PRS: Los Angeles Astro Salon!
965393537057.event_address: 3910 Los Feliz Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90027
965393537057.title: LOS ANGELES ASTRO SALON Monthly Astrology Gathering!

902774852887.summary: Love to meet dynamic people who inspire? Love to network? Inspired by Cher? Then you'll love the March 7, 2025 special Cher'd "She Inspires" V.I.P. Networking Event & Cher'd "Vegas Style" show at the Historic Ritz Grand Theater in Escondido. You are invited to attend this event to connect with and celebrate trailblazing women & the dynamic men that support them. This event includes a V.I.P. Networking afternoon, The Daily Show with dynamo Host Shonna Daily, more networking time. Then- doors open for general admission seating as all attendees get ready to have a night of world class entertainment with the V.I.P. Cher'd VEGAS STYLE Show (with up to 15 amazing costume changes!) Get your tickets today. This spectacular event showcases the incredible live music performance of Cher'd. Debbra Sweet dazzles as she pays tribute to the legend with new songs, new costumes and new interactive moments for all during this "She Inspires" event. DOORS OPEN for V.I.P She Inspires Networking time 3:00- 4:30 pm PST The Circle of 10 Power Hour - Network IN. Network UP. 4:30- 5:30 pm PST General Admission Doors open & more networking time 5:30 - 6:30 pm PST CHER'D Vegas Style Show takes center stage 6:30 - 9:30 pm PST "Cher'd" is something not only to see, but EXPERIENCE! This is an exclusive, up-close-and-personal performance...a rare, almost behind-the-scenes opportunity in a closed set that YOU can be a part of! Make this a date night to remember! An epic girls night out! Or simply say YES! to enjoying top talent, high energy, live music, filled with fun, friends, fantastic costumes and topped of with music you know, like and love. Have a business? A women's organization? Are you a dynamo at your corporate gig? Be here. Represent! Let us get to know you too! SEE YOU THERE! For in person attendance : Please grab your tickets by Feb 28, 2025 so we can prep your bling bag. Light refreshments and beverages are included for the V.I.P. Tickets. Concessions available for purchase during evening performance. Scroll below for a quick view of the theater seating. Your tickets will get you into your chosen section. Seating in that selected section is first come, first served. Sponsored seating will be designated & reserved with your sponsorship package. Timeless. Trailblazing. Strong. Bold. Daring. Energetic. Fascinating. Powerful. Dynamic . Those are words used to describe the original Cher. Cher is larger than life in more ways than one. She made her mark on the male-dominated music industry for the past five decades. Rightfully referred to as the Goddess of Pop, she is a tireless champion for social issues and women's rightsas well as the power of love, imagination, and taking risks. INSPIRATIONAL. TRAILBLAZING. STRONG. BOLD. DARING. ENERGETIC. FASCINATING. POWERFUL. DYNAMIC. Those are words used to describe Debbra Sweet. Debbra is a visionary trailblazer. She's San Diego's own "Cher". Triumphing over extreme trauma, she takes risks and has built her brand on innovation, inspiration and helping others go from "I Can't to I AM." A tireless champion for empowering others, she exudes the power of love, imagination, and tenacity. Debbra connects to you with words, music and movement. When Debbra becomes "CHER'D" it's a blend of the best of Cher & Debbra! This "Vegas Style" Cher'd show will be live at the Historic Ritz Grand Theater. Be one of the exclusive attendees to experience the show up close in person. Get your tickets early! This will sell out fast. Take an intimate look at CHER'D as you enjoy songs you know, discover new ones, and see what tenacity, passion and decades of talent have brought to life! Get your tickets today and be ready to kick up your business & inspiration CHER'D Style! CHER'D came to life in 2020. When everyone else was locking down, CHER'D was rising up. Backed by an amazing band of seasoned pro musicians, CHER'D moves through decades of music with songs you love, looks that captivate and a collaboration that creates lasting memories! Cher'd includes, Grammy Award Winner Roger Friend, the Multi-talented Barry Brown and includes the talents Chris Yates. NOTE: VIDEO FILMING WILL BE TAKING PLACE AT THIS EVENT.

Complimentary/No Cost. Donations are Welcome ( before, during, after class) Via cash, or cash App , Zelle using my phone #. Kindly reminder, Absolutely no refunds, NO exceptions. PLEASE READ!!! Friendly reminder to text me after you sign up for the class. State your name, and to confirm there will be class" 1 hour prior to class start "the morning /evening of class that Saturda or Sunday . I need at least 2 people confirmed for the class to happen. Or if weather permitting. Yoga & Big Sur Adventure Hike- A group of us, meet after yoga, and refueling our bodies. at 2Pm for a hike in the Big Sur area . Morning yoga, grab breakfast, and gear up for an evening hike. Inquire for more info, if you plan to join the adventure hike. 3. Bring your own personal yoga mat, rug, blankett, beach, hotel towel 4. Free Parking By Beach: Enter ASilomar Beach Conference grounds Parking on GPS , and head towards Conference grounds Beach Entrance by Phoebe Cafe. 5. Direct Donations welcome on day of class via phone app pay . Please make sure to still text to confim attendance. 6. 1+ Attendee in a single transaction: For reservation involving more than one attendee on a single transaction, consider making a payment based on each attendee headcount, and text me with number of attendees. Example select Donation ticket type X1 and make $15payment, followed by Texting me I just reserved for 2, 3 people etc... ABOUT INSTRUCTOR Sara has been practicing yoga since 2000. She has taken classes with the best yoga instructors through her international travels: from Madrid, London, Miami Beach, to Cruise Ships instructors. Sara works for a local hospital as a Nurse Practitioner, she is passionate about helping others and volunteer work. Obtained her 200 hour Yoga Certif. Teacher. I believe in a holistic approach to health: Body, mind and soul. I find balance with daily challenges through my yoga practice. Yoga should be available to everyone. Young and not so young. Beginner and advanced students All welcome. "The state of well-being feeling after each yoga session is worth sharing, and it goes deeper than being able to touch your toes" (Sara). 1. YOGA STYLE The foundations of my yoga classes are heavily influenced from what Ive been exposed to, which is mainly a combination of Ashtanga, Vinyasa combined with Yin, Hatha yoga. Be prepared to stimulate your bdy and maybe break out a sweat! 2. YOGA CLASSES TIMES 3. Class Shceudle: November- to- August starts @ 9AM-10:30Am September and October: Sunset Yoga 6PM -7:30PM Class length: 60-75 mins approximately with meditation.Please allow 5 mins prior for quick introductions. Attendees can leave early at their discretion. YOGA CLASSES BEACH LOCATION - Time may changes with Daylight Savings. 4. Asilomar Beach: Asilomar Ave, Pacific Grove, CA 93950. By the Asilomar Conference grounds crosswalk entrance, away from Spanish Bay. Where the Surfers gather. Park by Beach pull ~ road side. - Every Saturday/Sunday 9AM-10:30AM and repeats weekly - Sunsets classes held in September and October 6PM-to- 7:30PMsunset. - Yoga & Hike- A group of us, meet at 2Pm for a hike in the BIg sur area . Morning yoga, breakfast, and gear up for an evening hike. Inquire for more info, if you plan to join. 5. Must Text to notify that you made a reservation/ Once you make a Reservation + 1 (786) 444-0626 . Class Maybe cancelled if it is raining and or low attendees, or class may be held at 5PM instead. 6. Free Parking By Beach pull out road. Look for sign on one of the pictures. 7. TIPS to optimize your Yoga Class Experience: Bring a yoga mat, blanket, towel, dress in layers as it can get cold by the ocean and during meditation segments. - Do not eat at least 2- to- 4 hours prior to class. Make time for you and stick to it:) Practice makes progress. - Notify me of any past/recent healed injuries: Modifications offered during class. - Please Note this class is not recommended, for the inpatient student, or someone that has never done yoga before. - Get clearance from your Medical Provider if any recent acute injuries, illness, or surgery before attending class. - Safety Reminder: Always, Always consult with a medical professional or physician before participating in any exercise program. Always practice mindfully with caution and listen to your body. If you feel discomfort, pain, or lightheadedness, come out of the pose or exercise Immediately. 8. FQA: - Do I need to have done yoga before and be super flexible to attend? No, show up as you are, with an attitude of beginner's mind reagrdless of your previous yoga experience, and be patient, and willing to put in the work. - Is yoga only for the young? No, 15.8 million Americans who practice yoga regularly 3-5 times per week, are 55 or older. ( Yoga's Journal Magazine, 2005) - Children must be 12 years or older and accompanied by parent or guardian to attend. 9. Key Terms Definitions Ashtanga Yoga : Ashtanga Yoga classes are usually high energy, linking every single movement in the class with breath and physically challenging Vinyasa Yoga: often referred to as "Vinyasa Flow", focuses on the transition between poses.Due to its faster class pace, many people are drawn to Vinyasa classes for its fitness applications. Yin Yoga: provides a slower and more meditative style of yoga. In Yin, different poses are held for longer periods of time for a deeper stretch. Hatha Yoga: combines the use of deep breathing and different postures to achieve a meditative Restorative state. Yoga for Seniors: Focus in steadiness and ease of exploring asanas to aid in ( arthritis, osteoporosis, heart disease, and difficulty with balancing) over attainment of poses for performance in breathing practices. To make the class productive to all : beginners, intermediate students are encouraged to use props, blocks, blankets, and modification poses. While advanced students can continue to push themselves. PRIVATE YOGA CLASSES AVAILABLE ON DEMAND Sat/Sun 1-4 people max` $150 for a 90 minutes yoga session. +1 (786) 444-0626 "The state of well-being after each yoga session is worth sharing." See you on the mat Namaste Sara -:)

1037059471797.summary: Join Team AVMC! Antelope Valley Medical Center is seeking candidates that have high energy, are eager to learn, and demonstrate a compassion and caring attitude. We're looking for both clinical and non-clinical positions in areas such as Surgery, Lab, Oncology, Emergency Department, Respiratory Services, Labor & Delivery, and Security, to name a few. Whether you would like to stay local, or have a scenic & traffic-free commute to the Antelope Valley, AVMC is the right place for you. AVMC is ideal for professionals who want to reach their maximum potential and enjoy what they do, so come grow your career with us and make a difference in the Antelope Valley community. Perks to working at AVMC: Medical, Dental, and Vision Defined Benefit Pension Plan with Employer Contribution Flexible Spending Account (FSA) 403(b) Life Insurance Long-Term Disability PTO and SSL Paid Education Hours Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) Eligible Employer Educational Assistance and Employee Assistance Program Other great optional benefits: Short-term Disability, Legal Services, Pet Insurance, Accident Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance Please bring your resume. Check out our Careers Page for all open positions at www.avmc.org/careers On-site interviews and contingency offers will be made on the spot, so come prepared to land your next job.
1037059471797.description: Antelope Valley Medical Center is Hiring!!
1037059471797.venue_name: AVMC's Community Resource Center (next to City of Hope)
1037059471797.title: AVMC Job Fair

1024957414217.summary: WELLNESS MARKETING POWER HOUR -- 11:00am-12:00pm New for October's meetup! Let's gather to talk all things marketing! Marta Giri, the editor-in-chief of Locally Well San Diego, will share the latest insights and trends in marketing for the wellness industry. She will also discuss the value of building a referral network and will make time for Q&A / hot seat coaching. Then stay for our free networking session or head out if that's not your vibe! NORTH COUNTY WELLNESS NETWORKING -- 12:00pm-1:00pm Our FREE monthly networking meetup is the perfect opportunity to: Build strong professional relationships: Connect with other industry leaders and potential collaborators. Expand your client base: Discover new referral sources and strategic partnerships. Gain valuable insights: Learn from the experiences of other successful practitioners. Boost your visibility: Increase your brand awareness within the local community. Who should attend: Naturopathic doctors Reiki / energy healers Personal trainers Nutritionists Physical therapists Yoga and fitness instructors Massage therapists Acupuncturists Chiropractors Health + wellness coaches Anyone interested in wellness! Service providers (marketing, insurance, law, real estate) also welcome Event Details: Date: First Monday of the month Time: 11:00am Wellness Marketing Power Hour 12:00pm Health + Wellness Networking Location: California Institute for Human Science, Encinitas Cost: Free Don't miss this incredible opportunity to grow your business and expand your network! RSVP to save your spot!
1024957414217.description: Join us for a FREE monthly meetup for health, wellness + fitness professionals in San Diego looking to expand their referral network.
1024957414217.title: North County Health + Wellness Networking

1014922078257.summary: Every week at our events we hear other singles discuss how bad the dating scene is, how the apps just aren't working, or trying to meet eligible singles in the wild.... Forget about it. We invite you to try meeting other singles in a low pressure and fun way for free, YES it is possible. Plus 2-for-1 on bottomless bloody marys or mimosas to get everyone pumped up and feeling good! Our Pitch-A-Friend Events Our Pitch-A-Friend events usually have about 12 presentations and a bar full of single people, it's a great chance to meet someone new! The presentations were fun and engaging, you could tell they had a lot of fun making their powerpoints. The audience asked questions to get to know the person, but also some fun questions that kept the energy high and everyone laughing. There is plenty of opportunity to meet another single person, we saw several numbers get exchanged and are awaiting the news of a couple dates! This is such a fun event, we are thrilled to do it again! What is Pitch-A-Friend? In a 3-5 powerpoint presentation you can present your awesome single friend to a group of other singles. The audience will have the opportunity to ask questions based on the presentation and if someone vibes with the brave presentee they have the opportunity to strike up a conversation with that person! Our emcee will help steer questions and make sure they aren't anything too crazy. This is a low stress presentation, meant to be fun and show how fun your single friend is! IT doesn't have to be elaborate, add some information, some stories, anything that makes your friend stand out from all the rest! How to Apply to be on Pitch-A-Friend: https://forms.gle/jpUqBrd7wrLrxf888 Please reserve your presentation spot via the above link. You can email your presentation to info@SD-Hosted.com on a later date. If you'd rather be an audience member thats fine, we still want you to come! DISCLAIMER This ticket is meant for promotional purposes, reserve one ticket per group . Anyone can attend, with or without a ticket. We Will See You November 2nd! This free singles event is slowly spreading across the country, with matches being made at each event! If you're tired of the same old dating experience, come to Cabo Cantina on November 2nd at 1 pm! We do not tolerate hecklers or any form of negativity, you will be removed from the venue for doing so.
1014922078257.description: Calling awesome singles people who are tired of the same dating experience, give Pitch-A-Friend a try! Matches are being made at every event
1014922078257.title: Pitch-A-Friend: Singles Brunch

1039161478957.summary: Chelsea Gastelum, Busy Bee Garden Co-op, is commited to integrating native plant species into the local ecosystem while promoting conservation through community engagement. She is dedicated to making sure pollinator gardening is equitable for all.
1039161478957.description: Free event for the whole family. Learn about pollinator gardening and conservation efforts in your town!
1039161478957.title: Community Gathering - Busy Bee Garden Co-op

490290902287.summary: * This event is FREE for all job seekers & new recruiters. The event is conducted on the First Friday of Every Month, 11 am - 2 pm in your local timezone! FAQ: Q: What is the CareerClub Virtual job fair ? A: CareerClub Virtual job fair is conducted on the first Friday of every month, from 11 am to 2 pm, in your local city. It is a global virtual job fair for effective hiring among local professionals and recruiters and to promote healthy professional networking. CareerClub Virtual job fair, started as a small project to take the anxiety away from recruiters and professionals by making it available every month, and delivering it virtually, has now been deemed an industry standard and has encouraged several other organizations to join us and make their job fair monthly. Few even took it to the next level and joined us by taking their job fair globally through our platform. CareerClub Virtual job fair is conducted on the first Friday of every month from the convenience of their home, with no travel, no dressing formals, and no anxiety-led career event. A community-driven job fair where professionals, recruiters, and service providers come together to promote happy and healthy hiring. Q: Why should I attend the #CareerClub #Virtual jobfair? A: This global event is attended by thousands of recruiters to connect with 100s of thousands of seekers. This community-led event is where professionals spread the word and invite communities to job fairs. Some benefits: 1. Connect with local/global talent and opportunities 2. Collaborate with other professionals and never grow alone 3. Get access to resources to support long-lasting career growth Have more questions? Visit Event FAQ/Reachout Page at: https://jobfair.nwlb.app Q: Where is the event conducted? A: This is a virtual event, which means no travel is required. The event is conducted over your favorite internet browser. All you need is the following: Email(sent 24-78hours before) confirming you are assigned a room. An ability to chat, and if there is a common interest, go to a video/audio session( virtual rooms are provided ). A well-lit and quiet room where you could have a good session. Q: Is there a dress code? A: If you have received a note about your confirmed room, you would be encouraged to attend with respectable, semi-formal, and comfortable clothing. Q: Who could attend the event? A: This event is designed to help professionals [who are looking for work or exploring the market], recruiters [who are on the lookout for talent for their open roles], and service providers [who could assist professionals with their pursuit of a successful career]. Q: Which companies are attending? A: Amazon, Apple, CVS Health, United Health Group, Microsoft, Walgreens Boots Alliance, Kroger, The Home Depot, Verizon, Ford, General Motors, Anthem, Comcast, Bank of America, Target, UPS, Procter & Gamble, PepsiCo, FedEx, Disney, Albertsons, Prudential, Sysco, Best Buy, Allstate, AIG, Progressive, Bristol-Myers Squibb, Caterpillar, Dow, VA, Northrop Grumman, USAA, Dollar General, TJX Companies, Walmart ... and 8000 other businesses trust the platform for their recruiting. Q: Is this ticket enough, or do I need anything else to join the event? A: Participation is simple and effective: 1. Signup/register & RSVP with the platform at https://jobfaircc.nwlb.app 2. Stay on your emails for the next steps to attend. Q: What are the system requirements for attending the event? A: All you need to attend the event: Computer or Mobile Phone [No App is required] Broadband access [we advise 1.5 Mbps minimum for the best experience] A webcam(in case of a video call) Q: Which industries are visiting this event? A: This is a global event, and our communities are a mix of several industries, some of them include: Advertising, Aerospace, Agriculture and Agribusiness, Air pollution, Arms, Automotive, Broadcasting, Chemical, Computer, Construction, Creative, Defense, Education, Electric power, Electronics, Energy, Entertainment, Fashion, Film, Financial services, Fishing, Floral, Food, Healthcare, Horticulture, Hospitality, Industrial robot, Information, Insurance, Internet, Leisure, Low technology, Machine tooling, Machining, Manufacturing, Market research, Mass media, Mass production, Materials science, Meatpacking, Mining, Music, News media, Occupational injury, Occupational noise, Oil shale, Petroleum, Pharmaceutical, Pricing, Professional Services, Publishing, Pulp and paper, Raw material, Real estate, Robber baron (industrialist), Semiconductor, Services, Shipbuilding, Software, Sport, Steel, Telecommunications, Textile, Tobacco, Trade association, Transport, Video game, Water, Wood, etc. Q: Who are the people behind this event? A: #NoWorkerLeftBehind *, a global non-profit, is behind this event to democratize healthy career development for all, using technology to assist the global workforce to stay closer to their aspirational success through a healthy network, adequate knowledge and more opportunities. * NoWorkerLeftBehind is always on the lookout for professionals/organizations who want to actively work to help create a more equitable and just workforce that provides opportunities to everyone and creates an ecosystem of mutual growth and success. Interested in assisting us? Signup our volunteer list at https://one.tao.ai/nwlbvol Keywords: CareerFair, JobFair, JobFair, JobExpo, CareerExpo, Career Fair, Job Fair, Career Expo, Job Expo, Recruiter Event, Diversity, Equality, Equal Opportunity, Equal Opportunity, #jobsforall, #community, #employment, #skilled, #virtual, #online, community #Virtual #ONL

965421480637.summary: About Our Speaker: Nick Bellizzi Nick Bellizzi is the Head Grower at Gotham Greens Davis California greenhouse where he leads the grow team in growing high-quality lettuce and basil, in a high-tech hydroponic greenhouse. Nick had previously worked with Tanimura and Antle, an innovative grower of both indoor and outdoor-grown vegetables. Nick entered his Agribusiness career with a B.S. in Agriculture from CSU Chico, attended a greenhouse horticulture program at Wageningen in the Netherlands, and is currently studying for his M.B.A. at the University of California Berkeley Haas School of Business. About Gotham Greens Gotham Greens is an indoor farming pioneer and fresh food brand on a mission to transform how and where fresh produce is grown. More than a decade after launching the nations first commercial-scale rooftop greenhouse in New York City, Gotham Greens remains committed to bringing more local and sustainably grown greens to consumers across the country while conserving vital resources through innovative technology. We build and operate one of the largest networks of climate-controlled, hydroponic greenhouses, allowing us to grow and deliver long-lasting and delicious leafy greens, herbs, salad dressings, dips and cooking sauces to our customers, 365 days of the year. About The Series: Learn From a Local Learn from a Local is an on-going speaker series hosted by AgStart, a non-profit organization supporting entrepreneurs advancing innovation in agriculture, food, and health. Typically on the 1st Thursday evening of every month, AgStart hosts a local speaker from the agriculture, food, and health world to speak on a topic relevant to our entrepreneurial ecosystem. Our goal is to offer a space to connect with local individuals and learn from leaders in our local AgriFoodTech sector on topics relevant to our AgStart community. Events take place in our AgStart Event Center: 1100 Main St., Suite 170, Woodland, CA 95695. An approximate event agenda is detailed below. Learn more at www.agstart.org
965421480637.description: Join us to hear Nick Bellizzi, Head Grower at Gotham Greens, share his firm's journey disrupting the traditional leafy green supply business
965421480637.title: Learn from a Local: Nick Bellizzi, Head Grower, Gotham Greens

1028668263467.summary: Get ready to be part of something exciting! In response to the growing urgency of the climate crisis and our need to make a bigger impact together, we're thrilled to announce that the Central Coast Chapter is teaming up with other USGBC-aligned communities across California to form USGBC California. This collaboration will open up incredible opportunities for statewide advocacy, workforce development, training, education, and more. Plus, it will accelerate innovation to drive building decarbonization in the Central Coast region, while giving each member the power to amplify their impact and seize new opportunities for growth and influence. With this unified, statewide organization, we're set to supercharge the green building movement across California, boosting engagement and resources locally and positioning our state as a leader in sustainable building design, construction, and operations on both the national and global stage. Together, well ensure that the Central Coast and all of California have a voice in creating a more sustainable, resilient, and equitable future for everyone. We want you to be a part of this exciting journey! Join us for a fun and informative town hall meeting at the Community Environmental Council on October 30th. Grab a drink and a snack, and get all your questions answered from 5:30 - 7:30pm. We can't wait to see you there!
1028668263467.description: Join us for a town hall at Santa Barbara to learn about USGBC California! Enjoy snacks and drinks while exploring how to get involved!
1028668263467.event_address: 1219 State Street #Suite A, Santa Barbara, CA 93101
1028668263467.title: Central Coast Town Hall & Green Drinks

1030539991857.summary: Join The Aware Project and Kindra Connection for an enlightening gathering at One Spirit Wellness in San Diego, CA! Each Month we offer an immersive & experiential circle that allows for deeper integration of what emerges from plant medicine work. Each circle has a curated theme that guides the community through a rapid, deep, and lasting transformational process over the span of two hours. Whether you're a curious beginner or an experienced psychonaut, this in-person event is a safe, supportive, and sacred space for raw vulnerability that fosters deeper connection, dialogue, and community. Integration Circle Is Experiential processing to allow for deeper integration of what emerges from plant medicine work. Rapid, deep, and lasting transformation A safe, supportive, and sacred space for raw, open, vulnerability that fosters deeper connection, dialogue, and C O M M U N I T Y. This Months Theme: FROM CLOSED TO OPEN HEART Those who walk into circle, do so with intent to root and weave the teachings of their medicine journeys. Those who walk out of circle, do so with a deeper connection, a tribe, a belonging. Brought to you by Kindred Connection in partnership with One Spirit Wellness & The Aware Project kindredconnection.co & onespiritwellness.com About Your Facilitator Kindra Kuntz is a therapist and creator of Kindred Connection- founded on the belief that connection is at the root of all healing. Kindras approach to working with the human experience is a collaborative and holistic process using a trauma-aware and nervous system regulation framework to help us get in touch with the here and now. Mindfulness, somatic work, expression, and psychoeducation are interwoven with the intention of creating nourishment, connection, and secure attachment. Kindra has a background working with addiction recovery, veterans, and has been running groups going on five years. Now in private practice, she offers individual therapy, preparation and integration support, fundamental mindfulness and nervous system regulation, addiction recovery and grief support, empowerment courses, and more! Kindredconnection.co connectwithkindra@gmail.com About One Spirit Wellness A holistic wellness center and ketamine clinic, integrative approach to psychiatry, psychotherapy, and psychedelics. To learn more visit: onespiritwelness.com Important Notice This group is being designed as a secure space. It is not a place to seek, encourage, or participate in the procurement of controlled substances. Do not bring, buy, sell, transfer, or arrive on any illegal substances, or swap information on how to buy them. Members who violate these basic house rules will be removed from the group and will not be allowed to attend future events. Venue 2870 5th Avenue, Suite 200 San Diego, CA 92103 Parking Street parking is available. Meters expire at 6pm. Tickets The cost for this event is sliding scale, $15-30. ( Read more about The Green Bottle Method ) Please consider paying $30 if you are comfortably able to meet all of your basic needs. Please consider paying $22 if you sometimes stress about meeting your basic needs, but still regularly achieve them. Please consider paying $15 if frequently stress about meeting your basic needs and sometimes don't achieve them. No one turned away for lack of funds.
1030539991857.description: Join the Aware Project and Kinda Kuntz, LMFT for the October Psychedelic Integration Workshop: From Distorted To Right Relationship.

1015445844857.summary: Join us for a lunchtime discussion about GIS (Geographic Information Systems) and geospatial inquiry. Topics include research, instruction, upcoming events, learning opportunities, and practical applications. A brief presentation is often included. UCR affiliates from all disciplines and departments, at all skill levels, are welcome and encouraged to attend! Join us in person in Rivera Library, Room 140. Or, if you prefer to attend remotely, Zoom information will be emailed to registered participants before the meetup begins. All participants are expected to follow and uphold UC Riverside's Principles of Community . Tentative presenters/topics: October 17: Historic Maps and Waterfront Histories in Southeast Asia - Southeast Asia's largest cities are sinking! Growing out of colonial ports located on mudflats and river deltas , these cities are home to a majority of Southeast Asia's 700 million people and are economic hubs for old and new economies. Southeast Asia's urban waterfronts are important sites for little-known stories of the modern past and visions for urban-green futures. Join environmental historian and UCR Professor David Biggs for a tour of urban waterfronts combining use of historic maps with local and archival research. November 12: Leveraging Web3 to Combat Racism as a Public Health Crisis December 10: Chicanas Changing History
1015445844857.description: A lunchtime discussion about GIS (Geographic Information Systems).
1015445844857.venue_name: Toms Rivera Library: Room 140 (Zoom option also available)
1015445844857.title: Geospatial/GIS Meetups

1041546994097.summary: Welcome to Yellow Church Chat: Windsor Neighbors Discussions ! This new series seeks to connect Windsor neighbors over issues that affect us in a civil, welcoming and constructive way. Each meeting will feature a local expert on a topic, as well as the chance to ask questions and learn from each other. Our inaugural Yellow Church Chat will be with Deva Marie Proto , who has the very long title of Clerk-Recorder-Assessor-Registrar of Voters. She will talk a bit about how elections work and we can ask questions. This in-person event is a great opportunity to connect with your neighbors, share ideas, and engage in meaningful conversations. Don't miss out on this chance to be a part of our vibrant community! See you there! Some quick answers you may have: 1) Why is it called the "Yellow Church Chat?" The friendly and neighborhood-minded pastor at Windsor Presbyterian Church is graciously hosting these meetings in the historic church off the Windsor Town Green. Which church? It's the Yellow Church on the street. Hence, the name. 2) Is this a church meeting? Nope - it's a neighborhood meeting. You don't have to be a member of the church - or any church, synagogue, mosque, coven or temple - to attend. You just have to be willing to be polite and civil and enter with a positive attitude. 3) Who is organizing this? We are a group of Windor neighbors who want to see constructive civil discourse. Tim Zahner, a Windsor resident, is coordinating these along with Pastor Mary Beene and with input from the greater community, including the Windsor Chamber of Commerce. None of these organizations are "sponsors" and aren't endorsing any views presented, but rather hoping to facilitate positive civic discourse. 4) Can I help? Yes - we don't know how yet, but if you want to help, let us know. Maybe we'll need help with snacks, or ideas, or publicity. Let us know!
1041546994097.description: Come join us at Yellow Church Chat in Windsor for some neighborly discussions with special guest Deva Marie Proto!
1041546994097.title: Yellow Church Chat: Windsor Neighbors Discussions - With Guest Deva Marie Proto

1028500471597.summary: Professional Networking Mixer at Mike Hess Brewing TapHouse, Seaport Village Unwind, Connect, & Discover Opportunities! Please be prepared to engage in business conversations with other professionals, remembering that networking is a relationship-building activity - and that this event is to help foster business connections and social capital. Hard selling of products or services, or participating as though this were a singles social event, would each be counter productive. Step into the vibrant ambiance of Seaport Village's newest gem, the Mike Hess Brewing TapHouse. As the sun sets over San Diego, immerse yourself in an evening dedicated to fostering professional connections, sharing insights, and indulging in some of the finest craft beers the city has to offer with also plenty of non-alcoholic options available as well. Why Attend? Expand Your Network: Meet like-minded professionals from various industries. Who knows? Your next collaborator, client, or friend could be just a handshake away. Insightful Conversations: Engage in discussions that go beyond just business cards. Share experiences, challenges, and success stories that can lead to fresh perspectives and ideas. Exceptional Venue: The Mike Hess Brewing TapHouse is not just a venue, it's an experience. With its contemporary design paired with a touch of rustic charm, it provides the perfect backdrop for meaningful connections. 971286372687.summary: We meet every Thursday 9-11am. IG: @theclearcorner Chit chat over coffee with other parents and caretakers of babies and toddlers in a laid back setting along the gorgeous LA River Bike path. Families of all kinds of welcome to come hang out and enjoy watching our babies interact, observe and play. Dads, grandparents, non bio parents, queer parents, nannies, family members...this is a group for all of us who care or have cared for little ones aged 0-3. This experience is beautiful and tough. Doing it together will make all the difference! ***We love our fur babies too but please do not bring them to this group.*** Location Deets: Enjoy some light, grounding vibes at the most beautiful location along the LA Bike Path called Happier Cafe LA on google. This space has... -plenty of shade & misters for hot days -amazing coffee and cafe treats -drawing supplies, toy cars, sand pit (plenty of space not to be near sand pit) -plenty of seating & space to stretch out -huge retro picture backdrop & a fun camper to hang out in -immaculate, friendly, peaceful vibes Nearby Ammenities: Lewis Macadams Riverfront Park- plenty of green space, walking trail, wheelchair and stroller accessible restrooms and water station, picnic tables in the shade and workout equipement. Bike Path- Pedestrian friendly walkway for easy access to the front of Happier Cafe LA by TADAA.coffee. Just be mindful of the bikes flying by, keep center roadway totally clear. Parking and Restrooms: Free parking lot at LEWIS MACADAMS RIVERFRONT PARK. This is where the restrooms are too. Pass the pillar courtyard and the open black gates, turn right to find the front of the cafe. If the lot is full, street parking is available And plentiful. Heads up to avoid spots that will have street sweeping Thursday morning. For wheelchair accessible routes, please use Google Maps App, set the starting point to 'your location' once parked/dropped off and enter "Happier Cafe" for 'choose destination'. Press the three dots at the top and the click 'options'. Toggle the 'wheelchair accessible' tab to "ON". This should help give the most clear passageway to the spot. **Also Highly Recommended to use Google Maps 'Walk' setting for easy guidance to the spot if mobility isnt an factor. Still super helpful** What to Bring (everything optional): -Water and snacks -Any hand me downs you wish to share -$ for coffee and treats Group Guidelines: -Respect & consent are #1. We share stories but avoid unsolicted advice or put downs. No hate or discrimination. -Parents model healthy interactions including helping little ones keep hands, mouths and feet to themselves and speak kindly. -Parents are hands-on and engaged. Never leaving their baby unattended or attended by another parent without explicit communication. -Ask permission to share foods between babies or to touch another child even to help. -Please, no pet dogs or children over the age of three years old. -No promotions unless approved by group leaders in advance. We would love to collaborate with you and give you time to spotlight your business. Can't make it to group in person? Join us online! Tag us in your photos and videos at home of your favorite toys, book or activities for each theme on IG: @theclearcorner . (Babies don't have to be in the content at all!) You can also print the weekly coloring page for your baby to enjoy at home.
971286372687.description: Stay out of isolation & bring baby to this laid back hangout where parents and carers of all kinds are welcomed & celebrated.
971286372687.title: Parent + Baby Meet Up for parents in and out of the "norm"

996514039317.summary: Chacruna started producing large-scale conferences in Mexico in 2015, and then yearly spring conferences in the West Coast since 2018. Psychedelic Culture 2025 will continue our tradition of exploring cutting-edge themes that are largely absent from the mainstream psychedelic conversation, related to our main initiatives: Indigenous Reciprocity & Decolonial Dialogues, Psychedelic Justice, Protection of Sacred Plants & Cultural Traditions, and voices from the Global South. At this two day in-person conference, with 3 simultaneous tracks, Chacruna will convene comprehensive panels and experiential opportunities that will foster conversations around topics including: Indigenous voices, Indigenous reciprocity, biocultural conservation, religion and psychedelics, holding mindful ceremony, legislation reform, law and policy, racial equity and access, queering psychedelics, women in psychedelics, veteran leaders in psychedelics, disabled populations and psychedelics, perspectives from the Global South, critical reflections on psychedelic science, including psychedelic assisted therapy, sexual abuse, touch and ethics, and dialogues between neuroscience and shamanism. We will also offer a space for participation in music, dance, art circles, rap (tobacco) ceremonies and affinity meet up groups. Chacrunas interdisciplinary conferences are well known for bringing diverse voices together, combining intellectual vision and rigor, community, activism, heart and soul. In the midst of the so called psychedelic renaissance, it is more important than ever to promote dialogues between scientists and communities who have been truly involved with these medicines, to have knowledge about the proper ways to use and steward them. Come join us in the beautiful Brava Theater, a co-op led by women in the traditional Latin neighborhood of San Francisco, for another memorable experience! Scholarships Available. Apply Here . For more information, contact us at pcu@chacruna.net Standard Refund Policy: Full refund: You can receive a full refund of your registration fee, minus a $10 administration processing fee, up to 60 days before the online conference start date. Partial refund: For cancellations made between 59 and 7 days before the conference start date, you will receive a 50% refund of your registration fee, minus a $10 administration processing fee. No refunds: Unfortunately, we cannot offer refunds for cancellations made less than 7 days before the conference start date. This is due to our final preparations and commitments made based on confirmed attendee numbers. Force Majeure Events: In the event of a force majeure event, such as natural disasters, travel disruptions, or government restrictions that make attending the conference impossible, we will offer a full refund of your registration fee regardless of the cancellation date. Please provide documented evidence of the force majeure event. Transferring Registration: You can transfer your registration to another attendee up to 7 days before the conference start date Please contact us with the name and email address of the new attendee. No-Shows: No refunds will be issued for registrants who do not attend the conference for any reason. How to Request a Refund: To request a refund, please send an email to pcu@chacruna.net with your full name, registration ID, and reason for cancellation. We will process your request within 5 business days. Important Note: This refund policy applies to registration fees only. Additional costs such as travel and accommodation are not covered. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation. We look forward to seeing you at Psychedelic Culture 2024! Standard Filming Policy: Please note that this conference will be recorded by a professional team, and photographs will be taken of both speakers and attendees. By purchasing a ticket, you automatically agree to being filmed and photographed. All media from this conference is considered the personal property of Chacruna Institute, and can be used for any purpose, for the rest of time.
996514039317.description: The Bay Areas Annual Spring Conference on Plant Medicines & Psychedelic Science.
996514039317.title: Psychedelic Culture 2025 - A Chacruna Conference

1037010445157.summary: The Institute for Energy Efficiency at UC Santa Barbara invites you to attend our 2024 Emerging Technologies Review. This year, the workshop will be organized with OpenFarm to dive into Climate Risks and Smart Food Systems on Wednesday, November 20th. Please save the date and register here. To confront the climate risks, the California Legislature passed Senate Bill 253 (Climate Corporate Data Accountability Act) and Senate Bill 261 (Climate Related Financial Risk Act). The farming sector has been a forefront of dealing with water related risks with the implementation of the Sustainable Groundwater Management Act in the last ten years. Food processors have also dealt with increasing grid power shutoffs and are managing several energy sources and loads to grow while reducing their carbon footprint. Agriculture is one of the top exporting sectors in California and in the USA. This workshop will bring together leading growers and food processors along with technology innovators and state policymakers a to address challenges in securing water for future generations and transitioning to more sustainable sources of energy in rural areas. We will discuss the policy and technological innovations necessary to meet California's climate goals and business needs to support the economic vitality of an essential sector.
1037010445157.description: Managing water risk and energy transition from farm to market
1037010445157.title: Climate Risk and Smart Food Systems

876302232567.summary: [If you are a farmer interested in attending the conference, please fill out THIS FORM . Once approved, we will send you a code to register for the conference for free.] Harvesting the Future: Moving from Pilot to Scale in Agrivoltaics Agrivoltaics is the next frontier for the clean energy transition and will be pivotal in reaching ambitious clean energy goals in Germany and California. While Germany offers advanced solar technology and practical insights from existing projects, California combines vast agricultural land with an unbeatable entrepreneurial spirit. Transatlantic Collaboration and best-practice-sharing can boost the sustainable growth of the Agrivoltaics industry. Building on the lasting achievements of last years conference, we will host the premier platform for Agrivoltaics in California again to foster knowledge exchange, connect all relevant stakeholders, and strengthen collaboration to move Agrivoltaics from niche-innovation to mainstream markets. Here are some key questions that we will tackle: How can agrivoltaic systems be designed to maximize both solar energy production and agricultural yield? What are the environmental benefits and potential barriers to develop solar on agricultural land? What are sustainable business models that deliver value to all agrivoltaics stakeholder groups (from farmers to communities and the solar industry) in a manner that is both economically sustainable and environmentally sound? Legal framework and incentives to move Agrivoltaics from niche-innovation to mainstream markets? What does it take to move Agrivoltaics to scale? During #CGAV23, 200+ attendees engaged in discussions on various topics with 20+ expert speakers. The upcoming #CGAV24 intends to delve deeper into these subjects and complement the insights with a field trip, showcasing real-life agrivoltaic examples for a comprehensive understanding. The objective is to foster robust German-American collaborations, propelling the flourish-ing market of agrivoltaics.
876302232567.description: Harvesting the Future: Moving from Pilot to Scale in Agrivoltaics
876302232567.event_address: 760 Orchard Road Ballroom A, Davis, CA 95616
876302232567.venue_name: Activities and Recreation Center | UC Davis
876302232567.title: 2nd California Germany Agrivoltaics Conference

1009210926047.summary: 2024 CEDMC Fall Conference: Accelerating Demand-Side Solutions to Address the Energy Affordability Crisis Wednesday, November 6 from 5:00-8:00pm: Evening Kickoff Reception co-hosted with AESP's EVDX Solutions Lab Thursday, November 7 from 9:00am-5:00pm: Full Day Conference with Networking Reception until 6:30pm In-person only - NO ONLINE OPTION Scottish Rite Center, Oakland, CA See website for full details: cedmc.org/events/fall-conference Join the California Efficiency + Demand Management Council on November 6-7 for our premier annual event, the Fall Conference. It will be a one-day conference with a networking kickoff reception the evening before. Attendees at this annual event represent a cross-section of executives and senior staff from energy agencies, utilities, implementers, service providers, technology companies, research organizations, and the legislature. The Council's Fall Conference is a policy and networking-packed event that focuses on key issues impacting energy efficiency, demand management, decarbonization, electrification, finance, and equity. The Conference will explore the challenges and solutions to achieving the state's clean energy and climate goals through the necessary transition from early adopters to mainstream consumers. Drawing from the latest research and analysis, speakers will highlight critical actions and innovative strategies to accelerate decarbonization at scale throughout the day. Expect candid views on what's working and what's not, where to course-correct and how, and signs it may be time to rethink a plan in its entirety. Ticket Pricing: Includes 11/7 full conference day: breakfast, lunch, networking reception, plus apps and drinks at the kickoff reception the evening before on 11/6. Council Members: $595 Non-Members: $695 Utilities, CCAs: $195 Government, Students, Non-profits: $95 Note: Sustaining Council Members receive 2 complimentary tickets, email events@cedmc.org for your code and information on how your company can become Sustaining! Kickoff Reception: Join us at our kickoff reception on Wednesday evening for light snacks and beverages. Expand your network with fellow conference AND AESPs Electric Vehicle Driver Experience Initiative (EVDX) Solutions Lab attendees, which will be wrapping up. Bonus! Fall Conference attendees receive 15% off EVDX Lab admission! Discount code will be provided in your Fall Conference confirmation email. Hotel Suggestion: We don't have a designated hotel block, but we like the Oakland Marriott City Center .

1014474298937.summary: The Golden Empire Chapter of the Air & Waste Management Association is pleased to announce the 32nd Annual Technical Conference will be held on Thursday November 14th, 2024 at the Chevron Energy Center in Bakersfield, California. Conference Speakers and topics: Brad Biagini Vice President, Technology Renovo Recources, LLC. Beneficial Reuse of Oilfield Produced Water Join us for a presentation focused on the beneficial reuse of produced water. We will explore Renovo's partnership with a prominent California-based oil company in Kern County, aimed at treating oilfield-produced water to achieve beneficial reuse quality. By transforming this resource, not only is a reliable source of freshwater suitable for irrigation generated, but Class II injection volumes are also substantially reduced. Discover how this collaboration is transforming the oil, water, and agricultural sectors! AnnieLu DeWitt Water Filtration & PFAS Product Line Director for North America Clean Harbors PFAS Treatment and Disposal Decisions AnnieLu DeWitt is the Senior Director of the Total PFAS Solution team for Clean Harbors. AnnieLu brings her 25 years of experience in the environmental laboratory and remediation fields to Clean Harbors to assist clients in interpreting their analytical results to evaluate their options for treatment utilizing varied medias and pre-treatment equipment to achieve project objectives. Having worked as a GC/MS and also most recently as a LC-MS/MS chemist for PFAS compounds she believes in the importance of evaluating the project as a whole, from suggesting the most valuable testing methods at the beginning of the project that help determine the best treatment trains and medias for complex waste streams to informing clients on their options for final deposition of their spent media and solids. AnnieLu DeWitt holds a BS in Chemistry-Geology from Bridgewater State University. Lorelei Oviatt Director, Kern County Planning & Natural Resource Department Kern County Builiding the Carbon Management Future What will it take to expand Kern County's economy to new types of carbon management industries ?New companies are interested but will past success with wind and solar, green investment funding and engineering expertise be enough? Hear from the Director of Kern County Planning and Natural Resources on the opportunities and challengesof not just designing the future, but making it happen by 2034. Yasmeen Sultana Chief Operating Officer, Spheros Environmental Evolving Landscape of Methane Regulation in Californias Oil and Gas Sector (2024) Methane regulation in Californias oil and gas sector has become increasingly complex with existing and emerging requirements. While there have been several regulations for decades to control volatile organic compounds (VOCs), additional regulations to control methane and VOCs have been emerging over the past decade at various federal, state, and local agencies. Navigating these regulations to understand requirements is itself a significantly challenging task for oil and gas operators. What is more daunting is the fast-evolving nature of these regulations combined with the emerging multifaceted technological landscape, making the implementation of compliance programs extremely difficult. The California Air Resources Boards (CARB) adopted the California Oil and Gas Rule (COGR) in 2017 to address methane emissions from the oil and gas sector. COGR introduced requirements that were mostly beyond the local air district regulations, and jointly implemented by CARB and the air districts. It was amended last year in 2023 to meet the US EPAs State Implementation Plan (SIP) requirements and to add requirements to find and fix leaks using advanced technology, i.e. satellite-detected leaks. However, CARB is already proposing to amend COGR again to align with the US EPAs Emissions Guidelines that were released towards the end of last year. This discussion will outline each of the drivers, potential changes to COGR in this latest round of amendments, potential impacts, feedback received by CARB, and timelines. Lisa Beckham Control Measures Manager, US EPA Region 9 Air & Radiation Division Regulatory Updates: PM2.5 NAAQS; EPA Sec. 111[d] (power plants, oil & gas); CARB's Oil & Gas Regulation Lisa Beckham is the manager of the Control Measures Section in the EPA Region 9 Air & Radiation Division. Lisa has been working at EPA since 2011 and has extensive experience with Clean Air Act permitting programs and with air pollution control technologies. Prior to EPA, Lisa worked for the Kentucky Department of Environmental Protection and has a B.S. in Chemical Engineering from the University of Kentucky. Please contact us at info@awmagoldenempire.org if you are interested in sponsoring or exhibiting at this event. For additional information, please visit the Chapter's website.

Rick Westra, Pastor of Trinity CRC Rev. Rob Golding, Pastor of First Artesia CRC Becket Cook, Host of, " The Becket Cook Show " and Author of " A Change of Affection " LUNCH AND REFRESHMENTS INCLUDED IN REGISTRATION Coffee and Snacks will be provided during the morning break. A boxed lunch and drinks will be provided for each registration during the lunch break. The event will be live streamed in the FAC for those wishing to extend their breaks, continue with fellowship, or parents with kids that need to burn off some energy. DESCRIPTION How should Christians shine a light in the darkness of the world? How does Gods Word apply to society? Does reformed theology have anything to offer in the modern age? Although the culture seeks to remove Christs Church from public life, it is a Christians responsibility to live faithfully in all areas of life. The framework and principles to do this can be found in Gods Word. Reformed theology reorients modern thinking by setting our hope in Gods heavenly kingdom; Thus, freeing us to live a life building Gods earthly kingdom. Join us for the 2024 Artesia Reformed Theology Conference where local pastors and podcaster Becket Cook apply biblical truth to every aspect of our lives. Our theme, God and Culture will focus on applying Gods Word to our secular culture. CONFERENCE FLYER

950220995577.summary: Data Streaming Summit 2024 (formerly Pulsar Summit) is back and better than ever! Join us for an exciting in-person event at the Grand Hyatt at SFO to learn about the latest trends and innovations in the world of data steaming, Pulsar and Kafka. Our theme this year is "Data Streaming and AI" and we will be showcasing stories that are innovative, informative and thought provoking. This year, we will be hosting a training day for Pulsar & Kafka on Monday, October 28th, 2024 and then bring the entire community together on Tuesday, October 29th for a full day of sessions and breakouts. See below for more details on Training Day. Connect with industry experts, attend informative sessions, and network with like-minded individuals. Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity to expand your knowledge and grow your professional network. See you there! ----------------------------- Training Modules: 1. Mastering Kafka Protocol (~2 hours) Dive into the ONE StreamNative Platforms seamless support for the Kafka protocol. Experience firsthand how to publish and consume Kafka messages, work with schema registries, and explore KStreams. Youll also configure Kafka clients to utilize Pulsars built-in multi-tenancy and explore Kafka Connectors, making your applications more robust and scalable. 2. Pulsar Client Fundamentals (~2 hours) Unlock the full potential of Pulsars Java Client as you explore its support for both messaging and streaming use cases. Youll gain a deep understanding of Pulsars four subscription types, topic partitioning, and how these features enhance your applications. Plus, delve into advanced topics like delayed messages, dead letter queues, Table View, and geo-replication, ensuring youre equipped to handle complex data streams with ease. 3. StreamNative+AI (~2 hours) Supercharge your AI applications with the ONE StreamNative Platform. Learn how to deploy Python Pulsar Functions to transform unstructured data into embeddings at scale using the OpenAI API. Discover how to load these embeddings into a vector database with pre-built connectors and enable Lakehouse Storage for seamless integration with Databricks. Finally, explore the latest in streaming data with Foundation Models via Amazon Bedrock APIs, opening new possibilities for your AI-driven projects.
950220995577.description: Get ready to experience the pulsating energy of Data Streaming Summit (formerly Pulsar Summit), it's going to be epic!
950220995577.event_address: 55 South Mcdonnell Road, San Francisco, CA 94128
950220995577.title: Data Streaming Summit 2024

1021295471247.summary: Thriving Together: Supporting Wellbeing in the Nonprofit Sector is designed to promote wellness and foster connection within the nonprofit community. Its been seven years since our last nonprofit gathering, and the need to come together has never been greater. In the day-to-day demands of our work, it's easy to feel disconnected, but this conference offers a unique opportunity to reunite, share insights, and envision a new future of collaboration and support. Nonprofit professionals give so much of themselves to serve others, often with limited resources, and this event offers them a chance to recharge, refocus, and help shape the future of nonprofit collaboration in Humboldt County. Through interactive workshops, thoughtful discussions, and hands-on activities centered around art, healing, and community-building, participants will discover fresh approaches to sustaining their energy and thriving in their roles. Thriving Together emphasizes the critical importance of self-care for nonprofit leaders and staff, acknowledging that while they are often on the front lines of support, they too need care, resources, and resilience. Join us as we reconnect, learn, and strengthen the foundations of wellbeing within the nonprofit sectorbecause when caregivers thrive, so do the communities they serve. Learn from successful programs empowering youth to become leaders in our community. Explore strategies that support youth development and wellness. Breakfast and lunch are included. *Dietary preferences, special accommodation requests (e.g., language, accessibility needs), and breakout session preferences will be collected during the registration process to ensure appropriate accommodations are made. *Limited scholarships available. To apply, email info@norcal-nonprofits.org and ask for a scholarship form. Morning Breakout Session Options: 1. Navigating the New Fundraising Landscape Panelists: David Reed, Development Director, Food for People; Beth Bray, Director of Development, Humboldt Senior Resource Center; Tia Baratelle, Director of Development, Hospice of Humboldt. Anne Holcomb, retired Executive Director of Food for People, will facilitate. Join us to explore the latest trends in fundraising amid shifting foundation priorities, economic fluctuations, and evolving donor expectations. The insights and strategies shared will help both new and experienced development professionals adapt and thrive in todays challenging environment. 2. Creative Pathways: The Arts and Community Wellness Presenters: Janessa Johnsrude, Director, Prison Arts Theater Program, DellArte International; Tim Cunningham, former health system vice president, humanitarian clown, and nurse The presenters will discuss the role arts play in reimagining, reinventing, and driving powerful change across multiple sectors. Citing their national and international work in healthcare, Clowns without Borders, and the prison system, Tim and Janessa will discuss ways to incorporate local artists and their practices into diverse sectors of our community. 3. Nurturing Our Future: Strategies for Youth Development Panelists: Calla Peltier-Olson, Felicity Greyson, and Aven Branson, Humboldt County Transitional Age Youth Collaboration; Yvonne Guido and Amy Mathieson, Two Feathers Native American Family Services Staff and youth members of Two Feathers Native American Family Services and Humboldt County Transitional Age Youth Collaboration will discuss empowerment and wellness programs that have had marked success in supporting youth to become transformative leaders in our community. Afternoon Breakout Session Options: 1. Communicating Across Differences and Making Authentic Connections Presenter: Jessica Pettitt, MBA, MEd, Certified Speaking Professional, nationally recognized diversity and leadership trainer, and author of Good Enough Now and Almost Doing Good. We encounter cultural, social, and political differences every day. In this interactive session, Jess will share insights on how to function better in a diverse workplace--with co-workers, clients, and customers - and in everyday community interactions. Youll learn how to open yourself up to a greater understanding of and respect for others and confidently address forbidden or contentious topics. 2. Traditions: Exploring Health, Community, and Relationships through Cultural Perspectives Panelists: Laura Woods, Yurok Tribal Court Community Outreach Manager; Judge Abby Abinanti, Chief Judge, Yurok Tribal Court; Brenda Prez, Executive Director, Centro del Pueblo; Dr Paul Michael Leonardo Atienza, Humboldt Asians & Pacific Islanders in Solidarity; Mo Harper Desir, Black Humboldt This session will focus on how cultural practices, connections and belonging function as key components of social, physical, and mental health within their organizations and communities. How do we discover common ground and incorporate cultural perspectives into current practices? 3. Trauma-Informed Leadership Presenter: Nick Bown-Crawford, Executive Director, Humboldt COAD and Chair, Eel River Valley Long Term Recovery Group Nick will be joined by other local experts to explore the principles of trauma-informed leadership, emphasizing the importance of self-care for leaders and caregivers. Participants will learn strategies for navigating the emotional and psychological impacts of trauma that affect both those providing and receiving support. Drawing on a range of experiences, attendees will acquire tools to lead with empathy and resilience, strengthening their leadership approach with a whole-person concept for others and themselves.
