Join us for a day filled with insightful keynotes, engaging panel discussions, and networking opportunities with industry experts. Whether you're a seasoned AI professional or just starting to explore its possibilities, this event is perfect for gaining valuable knowledge and making meaningful connections. Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to learn, grow, and innovate in the heart of Silicon Valley! AI Trends Across Vertical Markets for Investors, Corporate Executives, Tech Professionals and Startups Panels Venture Forum AI Roundtables VIP Investor Dinner for LPS and GPs Learn how to pitch or sponsor Would you like to speak, host a track and moderate? Contact us and let us know which track and what type of program: keynote, presentation or panel. Provide name, company, title, cell, and linkedin page and proposed topics. Email us: sv@vostoc.net with SPEAK in subject line. TRACKS AND SESSIONS: Automotive: Mobility, insurance , autonomous vehicles, manufacturing Big Data/Analytics: LLM tools, platforms Biotech:Life Sciences, Medtech, Health tech Cleantech: Energy, sustainability, ClimateTech Developer: Operatio, frameworks and tools Education: K-12, Universit Entertainment: Media, entertainment , music, and games Fintech: banking, payment and billing solutions, crypto Frontier tech: Space tech, aviation, drones Government: smart city, operations, legal implications Hospitality, Food, Travel, Leisure Infrastructure: Semi chips, Hardware, Computers, GPUs Marketing and Advertising Retail : Manufacturing, supply chain, sales, eCommerce Technology Stack: Data, infrastructure, foundational models, apps, agent Workplace: Operations and Management, HR, Hiring/recruiting What we are seeking: Specific topics, workshops or seminars where attendees will have key takeaways with immediate relevance Topics should be specific, unique and narrow. Panels will address a specific subject with 2 to 4 panelists and a moderator. Speakers must focus on industry trends, insights or applications but no sales pitches or product demos. That is reserved for sponsors only. We can also offer a customized package according to your budget and objectives. ____________________________________________________ produces venture forums and summits in Silicon Valley. We produced the popular Silicon Valley AI and Tech Investing Summit for 38 months in a row in Palo Alto which attracts 70 investors and 300 startups and corporate professionals every month. Our next event is on Friday Oct 25 from 9am to 5pm in downtown San Francisco at a large private office in the Swig Building on Bush. We had 500 executives apply and have room to accept 200 attendees. AI Enterprise Forum addresses vertical markets for enterprise trends and includes panels, discussions, venture forum from selected startups, networking, small group roundtables on specific topics of interest, meals, and demo showcase. Corporate or Vendor Sponsors Corporate Partners for vendors, service providers or established tech solution providers that do not qualify as early stage startups. Sponsor VIP Investor Dinner: Deluxe $995 Basic $495 Dinner takes place at same venue after closing mixer. Network with LPS, family offices and GPS in informal setting. Ideal for startups seeking funding or GP seeking LPS to invest in their fund.

1039280595237.summary: Explore the unique visual identity of San Francisco through the eyes of its most influential designers. Ten limited-edition art prints from the DESIGN + THE CITY exhibit will be auctioned off on Thursday, November 7 . Take home a piece of Bay Area history and support the Center for Architecture + Designs vision to enrich the community and enable positive change through architecture and design. Catalog and auction details coming soon. Overview Graphic Design is part of our citys DNA-its woven into the fabric of the landscape, surrounding us every day in countless forms. From buses and murals to branding and museum exhibitions, design sends a message, and artists are the storytellers. Their experiences inform the narrative and on a large scale, global design expressions. Created by ten artists, produced and curated by Kit Hinrichs and the Center for Architecture + Design, DESIGN + THE CITY explores San Franciscos unique visual identity through the eyes of its most influential designers: Michael Vanderby, Michael Schwab, Michael Mabry, Maurice Woods, John Mattos, Craig Frazier, Kit Hinrichs, Jennifer Morla, John Hersey, and Jason Schulte, and several others. Artists Michael Vanderby Michael Vanderbyl has achieved international prominence as a design practitioner, educator and advocate. In 1973, he established Vanderbyl Design, working across the spectrum of print, digital, interiors and product design. In 1987, he was elected to the Alliance Graphique Internationale (AGI); in 2000, he received the AIGA Medal and in 2012, was inducted into Interior Design Magazines Hall of Fame. Michael received the Lifetime Achievement Titan Award from the International Interior Design Association (IIDA) in 2014. As an educator, Michael acted as Dean of the School of Design at California College of the Arts (CCA), as well as teaching for over thirty years. Michael continues to practice, working with many of his long-standing clients as well as new clients in the luxury furniture, real estate, and wine industries. Michael Schwab From his studio in Marin County, Michael Schwab has established a reputation as one of Americas most recognized and best loved graphic artists. Originally from Oklahoma, Michael attended school in Texas and New York before graduating from Art Center College of Design in Los Angeles. Michael has a broad array of visual, cultural and geographic references to which he regularly turns for ideas most often from the American West. He has created award-winning logos and posters for a remarkable list of prestigious clients, including Apple, Levis, the National Park Service, Major League Baseball, Polo Ralph Lauren, Robert Redford and the San Francisco Opera. His work is striking in its simplicity. Michael Mabry Michael Mabry, graphic designer/illustrator was born in Michigan and raised in a suburb 30 miles south of downtown Chicago, Illinois. During the final semester of his senior year in high school, fulfilling a compulsory credit in art to graduate, he became aware of the power and the joy of creating. This initiated his lifelong journey to discover a career in the Arts. He headed west first to study at Iowa State University, then at the University of Utah to earn a Bachelor of Arts in 1978. Finally moving to San Francisco where he had the extreme good fortune to work for Nicholas Sidjakov and Jerry Berman. Sidjakovs mastery of illustration and typography and Bermans conceptual acumen left an indelible impression on Mabrys approach to his craft. With a modest loan from his soon to be bride he began his design business in 1981 with a lot of bright-eyed ambition, Midwestern temperament, and limitless energy. His approach of blending design and illustration has evolved over the years although his goal of touching the viewer with a bit of humanistic charm has remained a constant. In 2014 he closed the business of 33 years to pursue personal interests. His work is included in the permanent collections of the Library of Congress, SFMOMA, Los Angeles County Museum of Art, The Hong Kong Heritage Museum and the Center for Political Graphics. Maurice Woods Maurice Woods, a graduate of the University of Washington with a BFA and MFA in Visual Communication Design, has made significant strides in the design industry, transitioning from a professional basketball career to prominent roles at Pentagram Design, Yahoo!, and currently, Microsoft. With over 25 years of experience, he has earned accolades such as the AIGA SF Design Fellow Award and the Jefferson Award for Public Service. As the Executive Director and Founder of the globally recognized nonprofit Inneract Project, Maurice has dedicated two decades to empowering Black, Latinx, and other underrepresented communities through free design education. The organization offers a comprehensive curriculum that supports these communities from middle school to early career stages. In addition to his nonprofit work, Maurice teaches design courses, lectures internationally, and contributes to media like the Wall Street Journal and Fast Company. His contributions are also featured in the international film Design Disruptors and the Netflix documentary Bad Sport. John Mattos John Mattos, an artist residing on Telegraph Hill in San Francisco, lives just half a block west of the iconic Coit Tower. His hillside home offers sweeping views of landmarks such as the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz Island, which have profoundly influenced his work. Johns notable contributions include the artwork for the Preserve Coit Tower initiative and the 75th-anniversary poster for the Golden Gate Bridge. His creative talents extend to the Save the Rock campaign for the Golden Gate National Recreation Area. John has garnered Gold and Silver Medals from prestigious institutions like The New York Society of Illustrators, Los Angeles Society of Illustrators, and the San Francisco Society of Illustrators. John has shared his expertise at renowned institutions including ArtCenter College of Design,Harvard University, Stanford, Wellesley, McGill University, and various University of California campuses. Craig Frazier Craig Frazier has been an illustrating designer since 1978. His work is recognized internationally for its wit, surprise and simplicity. He is a frequent contributor to the NY Times and publications like Time Magazine, Fortune, Bloomberg Business Week, Harvard Business Review, and The Wall Street Journal to name a few. Amongst his corporate clients are Adobe, American Express, Boeing, Chevrolet, Deloitte, MasterCard, Mohawk Paper, Navigant, The Royal Mail, U.S. Postal Service, and United Airlines. Craig has created eight postage stamps including the 2006 Love stamp and the 2010/11 commemorative Scouting stamps. Craig published his second monograph titled Drawn, (Goff Books) in January of 2024. Craig has published a 176-page monograph titled The Illustrated Voice, (Graphis Press, 2003.) He is also the author and illustrator of ten childrens books. Kit Hinrichs Kit Hinrichs served as principal in several design offices in New York and San Francisco and spent 23 years as a partner of Pentagram before opening Studio Hinrichs in 2009. His design experience incorporates a wide range of projects, including brand development, promotion, packaging, environmental graphics, editorial and exhibition design. Kits work is included in the permanent collections of the MoMA New York, SFMoMA, the Denver Museum of Art, LACMA and Letterform Archive. He has co-authored five books, including Narrative Design, Typewise, Long May She Wave, and The Pentagram Papers. He cofounded @issue: The Journal of Business and Design. His work includes branding for the California Academy of Science, CA+D, the 75th Anniversary of the Golden Gate Bridge and Giants Enterprises. He is a member of the Alliance Graphique Internationale and an AIGA medalist. Since opening Morla Design in 1984, Jennifer Morla Jennifer Morla has paired wit and elegance on everything from motion graphics and branding to retail environments and textiles. She is the recipient of graphic design's most honored awards: The Cooper Hewitt National Design Award and The AIGA Medal. Morlas work is included in numerous museum collections including MoMA, SFMoMA, LACMA and The Smithsonian. She lectures and judges internationally and taught at California College of the Arts for over 20 years. Morla:Design, published by Letterform Archive, offers insight into her creative process and features 150 of her studios projects. John Hersey John Hersey, originally from Vancouver Canada, attended Art Center College of Design before moving to San Francisco in 1981. The personal computer revolution was just beginning and he quickly became one of the pioneers of digital illustration. John made the second commissioned digital illustration ever created in 1983 using a Macintosh Computer and MacPaint. Over the years he has worked with some of the most iconic retail technology brands and media companies in the world and continues to do so now. His work has been in many exhibitions and publications around the world. In 2006, John had career retrospective exhibition in Tokyo featuring over 60 pieces The SFMOMA, LACMA, and the Museo Fortuny in Venice have his work in their collections. Currently, John lives in Fairfax, CA. Jason Schulte Jason Schulte is the Founder and Executive Creative Director of Office, a design company in San Francisco, that transforms brands and designs experiences to make things better. Author Dave Eggers once described Office as the greatest geniuses in the history of mankind. First Lady Michelle Obama awarded Office the Cooper Hewitt National Design Award, recognizing excellence, innovation and lasting achievement in design. Offices clients have included Google, Coca-Cola, Target, Disney, Meta, Nike, IBM, P&G and Whole Foods. The studio gets just as excited about its annual pro bono projects, including branding La Cocina, Gardens of Golden Gate Park and 826 Valencias Pirate Supply Store. Jason is also a co-founder of Wee Society, a kids brand that aims to help parents raise good little people by teaching kindness, sparking imaginations, and encouraging creativity. Jason grew up in Green Mountain, Iowa (where theres no actual mountain), and graduated from Iowa State University. Today, Jason lives in the foggy part of the City with his wife (and Office President) Jill Robertson, their twin boys, and dog Ollie.

1024207360787.summary: Join us for the 2024 NAMI CA Bay Area Youth Sympsium on Saturday, November 9th from 10:00am-2:00pm , hosted by NAMI San Francisco. This year's theme is "Empowering Minds: Youth Leadership in Mental Health Advocacy". This event is FREE and includes a free lunch . Parking is very limited, and venue is easily accessible through public transit. (More info to come). This NAMI CA Bay Area Youth Symposium will feature a panel of transition age youth (TAY), workshop on building mental health reslience, and a speech from Lois Williams, a TAY Services Navigator a the SF LGBT Center and NAMI Next Gen Advisor. Williams will be giving a speech on "Decolonizing Resilience: Youth Organizing in Mental Health". "Decolonizing Resilience: Youth Organizing in Mental Health" Speech Overview: This speech will examine the term "resilience" and how its applications in youth mental health and beyond has historically denied youth the opportunities to engage in fundamental, radical mental health work. We will discuss the harmful ways in which we utilize resilience, especially for marginalized, system-impacted youth who seek mental health healing This speech will define a new resilience, one centered away from the imperialist capitalist systems that have silenced and subjugated youth minority voices for generations. We will talk about the shifts in Youth Mental Health Advocacy over the last few decades and what is needed now to imbue youth with the agency and power to create a more equitable and understandable world while addressing the current global mental health crisis we are experiencing. Speaker and Panelist Biographies: Lois Williams , TAY Services Navigator at SF LGBT Center, NAMI Next Gen Advisor Lois (they/any) is a care worker and youth mental health advocate from Georgia. They are a member of NAMI Next Gen and currently work as a TAY Services Navigator at the SF LGBT Center, where they assist queer youth experiencing homelessness in getting connected to resources. They are a community organizer currently involved in several local and national campaigns, including Cops of Campus, Stop Cop City, and Students for the Liberation of All People (SLAP). They are passionate about child liberation and deeply committed to creating communities of care that center revolutionary healing and equitable research and education. Phyu Mi Ko Miko is a 17-year-old high school senior student in San Francisco. She is on the NAMI SF Youth Council and is dedicated to mental health advocacy and community service. With a diverse background in volunteering, tutoring, and researching, Miko actively contributes to mental health awareness and support through various roles, including working with elderly patients and creating impactful content on environmental and health issues. Francelle Deray Francelle Deray is a fourth-year Pre-Medicine Psychology major with a Fine Arts minor at the University of San Francisco. After completing her Bachelor's in Arts, she plans to attend medical school specializing in Psychiatry. With her passion and dedication to raising mental health awareness, Francelle strives to implement change and foster a community around mental health, creating a safe space for all and helping develop resources for education and community settings. In her free time, she enjoys creating studio art such as drawing, painting, pottery & ceramics, and most recently, sculpture! She also likes to travel and explore new cafes and picnic spots in the city. Marcus Burke Marcus is a Junior at TIDE Academy. He is really passionate about organizing mental health oriented events to help people de-stress and find common ground between one another. Address: 1800 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94102. We will be located in the Rainbow Room.
1024207360787.description: NAMI California is proud to partner with NAMI San Francisco for this year's Bay Area Youth Symposium! FREE Admission, FREE Lunch.
1024207360787.title: 2024 NAMI California's Bay Area Youth Symposium

1002409392477.summary: The 2024 Continuous Improvement Summit is here! Our theme is Forward 2024: Using CI to Move the Agency Forward. We invite participants to participate in sessions that look at new ideas for implementing continuous improvement, learning how others have evolved tried and true tools to meet their needs, and learn about how state and tribal partners have engaged in continuous improvement. Five plenary sessions will be presented this year, with our kickoff plenary being a leadership panel centering on ways that the EPA is using continuous improvement to move the agency forward - especially during a time of transition. We will also have an excellent presentation from Adam Lawrence on the Wheel of Sustainability which emphasizes maintaining and sustaining continuous improvement within an organization. Following this, we will host the Improvies to celebrate the "Best of the Best" in continuous improvement at the agency. We will then have a presentation from Senior Master Sergeant in the Air Force, David Tibbetts on Culture as a Process which details how to create a culture of continuous improvement within teams and organizations. We close with Profiles in Lean Leadership , our final plenary that dives into what it takes to lead within the agency and adopting CI methodologies. In addition, we have 15 different breakout sessions where we will discuss the latest thinking in continuous improvement, explore how folks have adapted the tried and true CI tools to meet their needs, and learn about the CI efforts of our state and tribal partners. For all the latest updates and information on the summit visit the 2024 Summit SharePoint Page . If you have any questions or issues registering, please reach out to the registration manager at Kate@meetgreen.com .
1002409392477.title: 2024 Continuous Improvement Summit

1042345372067.summary: Purpose of Sin Siga: Sin Siga is a modern, fast-casual Ethiopian vegan restaurant concept that aims to make the bold, vibrant flavors of Ethiopian cuisine more accessible to a broader audience. Our mission is to deliver delicious, plant-based dishes that honor Ethiopia's rich culinary traditions while embracing a scalable, ghost kitchen model. Inspired by the success of brands like Chipotle and Cava, we seek to bring an authentic and sustainable dining experience to the fast-casual market. Purpose of the Pop-Up Event: We are incredibly grateful to Mela Bistro for their generous support in allowing us to test our concepts within their restaurant and kitchen. This collaboration is a crucial opportunity for Sin Siga to refine our menu, gather customer feedback, and assess the flow of our ghost kitchen operations. By hosting this pop-up at Mela Bistro, we aim to fine-tune our plant-based Ethiopian offerings and ensure they deliver a truly exceptional dining experience as we prepare for broader expansion. Thank you, Mela Bistro, for partnering with us on this exciting journey! Tasting Menu Starters/Appetizers Trio Hummus Berbere hummus, green lentil hummus, and navy bean hummus Salads Beet and Carrot Salad Beets, carrots, red onion, tomatoes, garlic, ginger, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper Lentil Salad Lentils, red onion, parsley, garlic, lemon juice, cucumber, salt, and pepper Bowl Mains Sin Siga Special Tibs Mushrooms, zucchini, bell peppers, onion, tomatoes, cardamom, garlic, olive oil, berbere, salt, and pepper Turmeric Chickpea Stew Turmeric, chickpeas, onion, garlic, ginger, olive oil, cumin, jalapeo, salt, and pepper Mushroom Wot Mushrooms simmered in berbere sauce Spicy Tofu Tibs Organic tofu, onion, garlic, ginger, cardamom, berbere, olive oil Bowl Bases Ethiopian-Style Couscous Turmeric Brown Rice Quinoa (premium option) Dessert Teff Chocolate Cake Almond Cake
1042345372067.description: Join us for the Mela Bistro x Sin Siga pop-up! Enjoy bold Ethiopian flavors as we test a new ghost kitchen concept. Dont miss out!
1042345372067.title: Mela Bistro Sin Siga: Fast-Casual Pop-Up

1013061703827.summary: BLUETECH WEEK: EVENT OVERVIEW As one of the first ocean and water technologies clusters in the U.S., TMA BlueTech is known for being at the forefront of advancing sustainable and responsible ocean and water technologies through innovation and collaboration. One of the ways we do this is by hosting pioneering events that bring together diverse minds from various sectors and silos to drive technological advancements, both the foreseen and unforeseen. BlueTech Week is TMAs annual flagship event. This is not just another large-scale conference; it is a smaller, more intimate event that is known for bringing together highly diverse technologies and knowledge sets with a high concentration of key decision-makers. This aggregation ensures that BlueTech Week offers unparalleled opportunities for highest-quality interactions that lead to positive commercial outcomes. This year, BlueTech Week is innovating yet again by exploring the powerful intersection between maritime defense, maritime decarbonization, and ocean resilience technologies. We invite you to join us on this groundbreaking journey, which has high positive-impact potential for not only ocean and coastal ecosystem worldwide, but for high-value commercial opportunities in these three sectors as well. PART 1: BLUETECH SUMMIT & EXPO (November 18-20) Theme: Uniting Maritime Defense and Decarbonization Part 1 of BlueTech Week will explore the unique opportunities at the intersection of maritime defense and maritime decarbonization-related technologies. The event will bring together a diverse group of industry leaders, policymakers, international stakeholders and active duty officers uner the U.S. Department of Defense to discuss the future of innovation and environmental stewardship in the maritime sector. Participants will engage in dynamic conversations about policy frameworks, technology integration, and how best to leverage these synergies for commercial opportunities. Attendees will gain insights into cutting-edge technologies that enhance naval operations while minimizing environmental impact, including dual-use innovations that bridge defense and commercial applications. Additionally, the event will highlight collaborative initiatives focused on decarbonization, with a particular emphasis on aligning sustainability goals with defense readiness. This gathering also serves as a platform for exploring cross-border partnerships, featuring international perspectives that showcase how global collaboration can accelerate advancements in both maritime defense and decarbonization technologies. From policy discussions to investment strategies, Part 1 will provide actionable takeaways for stakeholders looking to drive innovation and achieve a more sustainable future for the maritime industry. Key Highlights of Part 1 Defense-Driven Decarbonization : Attendees will explore how defense initiatives are leading the charge in decarbonization technologies, with a focus on innovations that enhance naval operations while reducing carbon emissions and environmental impact. Strategic Dual-Use Technologies : Learn how cutting-edge technologies, initially developed for maritime defense, are being adapted for sustainable applications. These dual-use innovations offer both enhanced defense capabilities and solutions for decarbonization, bridging military and civilian sectors. Defense Policy and Sustainability : Gain insights from defense policymakers on the evolving regulatory landscape that integrates decarbonization goals with national security strategies, fostering the development of green defense technologies. Global Defense Collaboration : Engage with defense industry leaders and international collaborators to explore opportunities for joint ventures and partnerships aimed at scaling decarbonization solutions, emphasizing the global security implications of sustainable maritime practices. Commercial Defense Opportunities : Explore commercial opportunities arising from the intersection of maritime defense and sustainability, with a focus on how businesses can contribute to and benefit from the defense sector's commitment to decarbonization and environmental resilience. PART 2: OCEAN RESILIENCE SUMMIT (November 21) Theme: Integrating Innovation, Science, Investment and Policy for Sustainable Oceans The Ocean Resilience Summit will showcase groundbreaking technologies that are making a direct and positive impact on ocean, climate, and coastal health. With a focus on actionable solutions, the summit will spotlight the Southern California regions key playersleading innovators, policymakers, and academic institutionswho are coming together to organize and drive real-world impact in ocean resilience. Attendees will explore how collaboration is advancing sustainable solutions, from maritime decarbonization to coastal protection. Adding to this regional leadership, a delegation from New Zealand will join the summit, marking the beginning of a powerful partnership between Southern California and New Zealand. This partnership aims to share innovative ideas, create commercial opportunities, strengthen connections among policymakers and academic institutions, and advance ocean science in both regions. Together, these efforts will help foster global solutions for ocean and climate resilience. Key Highlights of Part 2 Innovative Ocean Health Technologies : Discover cutting-edge technologies driving positive impact in ocean, climate, and coastal health, with a focus on practical, real-world solutions to the most pressing environmental challenges. Leadership from Southern California : Learn how Southern Californias key players are organizing collaborative efforts to lead the global blue economy in ocean resilience, creating a model for other regions worldwide. Cross-Regional Partnership with New Zealand : Engage with a New Zealand delegation focused on building powerful cross-regional partnerships, fostering shared ideas, scientific collaboration, and unlocking commercial opportunities. Commercial Opportunities at the Core : Attendees will have unique access to key stakeholders across industries, academia, and government, with a central focus on discovering commercial opportunities and advancing technologies that can be scaled for global impact. Networking and Collaboration : Join forces with industry leaders, policymakers, and innovators, gaining critical insights into ocean science, technology, and resilience, and forging new connections to advance both science and business.
1013061703827.description: Uniting Maritime Defense, Decarbonization, and Ocean Resilience, Unlocking Undiscovered Ideas through Interdisciplinary Collaboration
1013061703827.title: BlueTech Week: Bridging Gaps

1044655030317.summary: The Impact Data Xchange: Scaling SDG solutions through data convergence The goal of the workshop is to help inform Bertelsmanns ecosystem-building efforts especially as they relate to data sharing and platform interoperability. The workshop is targeted at impact leaders and has an informal working breakfast character. It will explore: Designing an Interoperable Ecosystem for Impact Investing: How can investors collaborate more effectively to identify investment opportunities and share due diligence. What are the tools, and what are the incentives, for doing so? Overcoming Barriers: Identify challenges to collaboration and brainstorm solutions to overcoming these barriers. Unlocking Opportunities: Explore how better access to information can lead to innovative investments that drive positive impact on global sustainability. Your insights on these topics and others will be invaluable as we aim to mobilize more funding for SDG solutions at scale. Phtocredit: Google DeepMind: https://www.pexels.com/de-de/foto/abstrakt-technologie-forschung-digital-18069696/

919780717887.summary: California may be the home of Silicon Valley and the birthplace of many innovative technologies, but as the biggest state (by population) and the fifth-largest economy in the world ( more than 14% of U.S. Gross Domestic Product), it faces nation-sized challenges. The human issues include everything from making health care and insurance more affordable to investing in expanded internet access, to name just two. The state government has embarked on an ambitious plan to use technology to meet its social and economic goals, and to make progress on the complex problems it faces, by providing digital services and access to those service to all its residents, building in dependability and resilience for its services and technology infrastructure, and modernizing legacy infrastructure, to name a few. Join us as thought leaders from government and industry outline where they see progress, the role of technology in meeting the needs of residents and government workers alike, and where innovative solutions are making a day-to-day difference. Learning Objectives: Review the state governments priorities and how using technology can help agencies meet them Outline the parameters of Californias digital government plans and the status of projects to fulfill them, including modernization of legacy systems Delineate the metrics being used to measure improvements for residents lives and agency employees working environment Sponsored by: Carahsoft Technology Corp., SolarWinds, and The College of Professional Studies at George Washington University. Hosted by: Claudia Hosky , Publisher, FedInsider Moderated by: To be Announced , Contributing Edtior, FedInsider Distinguished Speakers: 1:00PM Delivering Easy-to-Use, Fast, Dependable and Secure Public Services (more to be announced) 2:00PM Consolidation, Replication and Sharing are Keys to Success (more to be announced) 3:00PM How to Accelerate Digital Government Deployment (more to be announced) Complimentary Registration Please register using the form below or call (202) 237-0300. Participants can earn up to 3 CPE credits in Business Management & Organization. To receive CPE credit you must arrive on time, fill out and submit your evaluation to registration as you leave. Certificates will be e-mailed to registrants. In accordance with the standards of the National Registry of CPE Sponsors, 50 minutes equals 1 CPE. Additional Information Prerequisites and Advance Preparation : None required. Program Level : Basic Delivery Method : Group Live Fee : There is no fee associated with this event, and no penalty for cancellation or no-show. For more information regarding concern and/or program cancellation policies please contact Certs@FedInsiderNews.com CPE certification for this event is being administered by The George Washington University College of Professional Studies, registered with the National Association of State Boards of Accountancy ___________ For sponsorship inquiries, contact SLGgmarketing@carahsoft.com
919780717887.description: Complimentary Training (3 CPE Credits): In-person Discussion and Happy Hour for State and Local Government
919780717887.title: Vision 2024: Digital Resilience in Government

1030735466527.summary: Join us for an engaging UN Day 2024 celebration at the International House Davis, where UC Davis Global Affairs interns will present the UN's Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and their relevance to life in Davis. Each intern will highlight key SDGs in an accessible, engaging wayshowing how global goals intersect with our community, from sustainable cities to quality education and beyond. Furthermore, were excited to welcome the Executive Director (Tracy Fauver) from Davis Community Meals and Housing, a local nonprofit working to address critical issues such as housing and food insecurity in Davis. Theyll share insights into their impactful programs and how their work aligns with the SDGs, particularly around poverty, hunger, and social inclusion. Additionally, enjoy a special showcase of SDG-inspired artwork created by 5th graders from North Davis Elementary. Through their art, these young students express what sustainability and global change mean to them, adding a creative dimension to the event. Lets come together to explore how we can make Davis more sustainable and connected to global change.
1030735466527.description: Join the UN Association of Davis for an educational event exploring the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and their impact here in Davis!
1030735466527.title: UN Day 2024: Taking Action on the Sustainable Development Goals in Davis!

1040314999167.summary: Imagine not having access to clean drinking water in your home, your school, or in your place of business. Its hard to imagine isnt it? Unfortunately, access to clean drinking water is simply not available in many places in the world. As a result,water borne diseases are the number one killer in the world today (an estimated 4,100 children under the age of five die each day from diarrhea globally). Thankfully, Give Clean Water (GCW) is an organization that is changing those statistics by providing clean drinking water to some of the world's most desolate places. In fact, GCW has been changing lives for 16 years and has provided clean drinking water systems around the world for over 130,000 people! We are excited for you to join us as we share the amazing story of how nations have been changed through the work of Give Clean Water over the past year and the multiple new partners we have added in our expanded efforts around the world. Give Clean Water is bringing Water to the World in carrying out our mission to provide a clean drinking water to everyone who needs it. The Give Clean Water -Water for the World fundraiser will be a fantastic evening at a private residence where you'll hear about the heart of the work, participate in a live auction, and make a difference that will last a lifetime for families in need. Food, drinks, music, and a hands on demonstration of the amazing technology will all be provided. Come hear from our Founder about how you can partner with us to provide the gift of clean drinking water to over 2,000 homes! Bring your friends and co-workers for an inspiring evening and find out how you can Change the World ! See you there ! Clean water for everyone, The Give Clean Water Board of Directors
1040314999167.description: Come join us as we come together to raise funds to bring clean water to the neediest parts of the world!
1040314999167.title: Give Clean Water - Water for the World 2024 Fundraiser (Tickets $25)

1041422100537.summary: Divine Feminine Healing & Empowerment Ceremony Join us for this women's psychic energy healing ceremony. Develop intimate awareness of your innate ability to heal yourself using the power of your multidimensional intuition. Facilitated by intuitive energy healer and ascension guide, Hannah Bourke, the Divine Feminine Healing and Empowerment ceremonies are devoted to guiding you on a deep journey within yourself. Each ceremony is uniquely focused to guide you in gracefully releasing unconsciously held limiting beliefs, ancestral and personal trauma, and begin to deeply un-wind patterns of co-dependency and unworthiness as you are guided in calling home your own sovereign spiritual energy and life force back into your body, mind, and Spirit with ease. These ceremonies are devoted to holding you in an immaculate energetic container of sacred safety as you are guided ever more deeply into the power of your psyche, soul, and somatic wisdom. Reconnect with your internal radiance as you bravely shine a light on the spaces within yourself calling out to be witnessed, felt, and integrated, so that you may step deeper into the fullness of who you are as a sovereign creative being embodied in your direct connection to Source. This ceremony includes guided self-healing meditation, psychic development training, group sharing, and sound healing. This space is open to women who want to explore and deepen their intuitive self-healing abilities together in community. All are welcome, whether you have explored spiritual healing arts or you are new to the healing path. The Divine Feminine is an energetic principle connected to intuition. We all hold a balance of both feminine and masculine energies within ourselves, and my intention with these ceremonies is to help awaken and empower our ability to trust this potent connection to our internal intuitive guidance system as the clearest pathway to living in alignment with our true self. Our intuition is connected to the wisdom of our soul and the light of God/Source/Universal Consciousness. The more we learn to listen to its whisper, trust the flow of information guiding our awareness, and set healthy boundaries to protect our energy and truth, the more we align with the path of our Higher Self, soul, and highest creative potential in this lifetime. In this ceremony, we will explore profound psychic development training that empowers your awareness about the spiritual technology of your aura and chakras and how to maintain a clean, clear energetic field as you go deep within yourself to heal on every level. Every ceremony begins with welcoming in the spiritual support from Divine Feminine Ascended Masters who are available to you in every present moment as mentors on your journey as you remember how to fully embody your own sovereign divine feminine intuitive healing and creative abilities. Please wear comfortable clothes, have some tea or water nearby, and perhaps a journal to further process your experience after the ceremony closes. The Divine Feminine Healing and Empowerment Ceremony will be held on Thursday, October 24th, at The Fairfax Community Church from 7-9 pm. Please arrive ten to fifteen minutes early to settle into the space gracefully so we may start the ceremony on time. A sage blessing and anointing with Blue Lotus oil will be available for you upon your arrival to welcome you into the ceremony space. Divine Feminine Healing & Empowerment Ceremony Thursday, October 24th 7-9pm The Fairfax Community Church 2398 Sir Francis Drake Blvd, Fairfax, CA 94930 The energy exchange for this ceremony is sliding scale between $50-$100 and is intended to be a sincere investment in your own self-healing and heartfelt spiritual empowerment. Please contact the facilitator at SacredLightAlchemy@gmail.com with any questions about financial needs and any other questions. About the Facilitator: Hannah Bourke is a trained clairvoyant psychic, intuitive energy healer, Reiki Master, and devotional musician. Her spiritual awakening unfolded over many years after seeing visions of the Divine Mother and receiving messages about a coming time of great change on this planet. She has devoted herself to learning/remembering how to heal herself so that she could be of service to others with her gifts during this shift as we ascend from a wounded ego-based consciousness into the embodiment of our Higher-Self soul consciousness. She primarily works with people one-on-one as an intuitive guide and energy healer who mentors others in developing alignment with their Higher Self and soul wisdom, and guides people on their embodied ascension journey through teaching multidimensional psychic development and intuitive self-healing as tools for self-liberation. Contact details: www.HannahBourke.com Instagram: @hannah.bourke Email: SacredLightAlchemy@gmail.com

973830131137.summary: Awaken as Love Taster - Welcome to Life 2.0! Peter Petersen and Monique Darling have been with Awaken as Love since its inaugural event in 2017. It has changed our life, our relationships, and we have witnessed first hand 1000's of other lives it has touched and awakened since then. Cathleene Cienfuegos is one of our most beloved friends who has been on the path of awakening since I met her! She started her Awaken as Love journey a few years later, but has dived into it fully, and is now a Lead Faculty, who teaches it all over the world! Who is ready to become more awake and aware in their body! More empowered and have fun doing it!? This is a special 1 night event for anyone who loves to move their energy though breath, movement, sound, and touch! In this taster you will discover the difference between waking up and growing up, and why both are important in the path of spiritual illumination. Why shadow work is a key component to empowering ourselves and the re-integration of important parts of us that may have been buried for years. All in all you may leave this evening with a new perspective on how you see the world and may wake up to a new purpose of the path you are currently on. This taster event gives an introduction to Awaken as Love and the four pillars of the Awaken as Love philosophy - a modern day Integral Mystery School that is at the cutting edge of evolution. Rooted in Tantra, Shamanism, Integral Theory (Neuroscience) & Biodanza their week-long Stage 1 training has been offered all around the world and transformed the lives of hundreds of people. It has been said that a quantum leap occurs in humans when they realize and embody the most recent unfolding edge of our consciousness named Integral Consciousness, and that it takes just 10% of the world population to steady themselves at this level to form a critical mass that will help bring the rest with them and that with that the solutions to most of the world's problems today reveal themselves. The Awaken as Love training is designed to jump start your expansion into this level with the mission of helping that 10% to emerge. In this taster you will discover the difference between waking up and growing up, and why both are important in the path of spiritual practice, why shadow work is key to empowering ourselves and to the re-integration of important parts of ourselves that we may have left behind. Embodied practices will be used to anchor key concepts and theory in ways that make sense to our daily lives. As we engage in deep communication connection exercises to bridge with one another's hearts. You will be held in a safe and supportive space by the Awaken as Love faculty. Cathleene Cienfuegos, Monique Darling and Peter Petersen are lead faculty and we are so excited to be collaborating in this movement we are all so passionate about! Hours: 7 - 10:30 pm Registration cost: $69 early bird through Dec 1 Regular Price: $89 At the door: $99 (specific address will be given in a welcome email upon pre-registration so please check your spam or junk folder if it does not arrive after you pay, and you can always contact me if you did not receive the message) Workshop Overview: WE BEGIN BY INWARDLY EXAMINING WHO WE REALLY ARE AT OUR CORE DEPTH WITHOUT THE CONDITIONING AND STORY OF YOUR CHILDHOOD IMPRINT. UNWINDING OUR TRUTHS AND HOW WE CAME TO BE WHERE WE ARE IN THE PRESENT MOMENT. WE UNVEIL ALL THE PLACES WE COVER OUR LIGHT AND TRANSFORM OURSELVES BEYOND OUR BORROWED BELIEFS AND PERCEPTIONS This unique workshop draws from the "four pillars" of Awaken as Love: * Tantra for Heart Awakening: Learn breathwork and Tantric practices to open your heart chakra, cultivate joy, and access your inherent radiance. * Shamanic Journeying: Embark on a guided journey to connect with your inner wisdom and spirit guides, aligning with the shamanic pillar of connecting with unseen realms. * Boundary Exploration: Discover practical exercises to strengthen your self-awareness and establish healthy boundaries, fostering deeper and more authentic connections. * Sacred Connection Practices: Explore gentle exercises to cultivate a sense of safe and empowered connection with yourself and others, inspired by the Biodanza pillar of Awaken as Love. Participants will leave this workshop feeling: * More connected to their inner power and radiant energy. Empowered through self-discovery, shadow work, and healthy boundaries. * Guided by their inner wisdom through Shamanic exploration. * Nurtured through the creation of a supportive community and the ability to connect with themselves and others in a more meaningful way. * Introduced to the core principles of Awaken as Love, a pathway for continued personal growth and exploration. Who Should Attend: This workshop is open to anyone interested in exploring the transformative power of Tantra, Shamanism, and the philosophy of Awaken as Love. Whether you're familiar with these practices or simply curious, this workshop offers a welcoming introduction. This taster is a preview of the upcoming 7 day event in Austin. Jan 16-24, 2025 You can attend this event alone, or attend both. Here are the details: https://awakenaslove.com/austin/ Want more? Come out and play again and again! Join early as we have limited the capacity and these will sell out About your facilitators: Cathleene Cienfuegos - Awaken As Love Lead Facilitator, Healing Arts Practitioner & Trainer. She brings deep spiritual lineages, as well as contemporary philosophies, cutting edge practices and much humor, compassion and empathy. She creatively weaves ancient and contemporary wisdom streams to create Integral sessions and retreats that inspire and invite Conscious Evolution. Cathleene offers her clients a personal growth path, as well as a professional growth path, and her mission is to assist individuals in being fully empowered, fully expressed, and feeling deeply connected to life and their own innate wisdom. She has had a Tantric Healing Arts Practice for over 10 years that has served all genders in the processes of healing and sexual~spiritual integration. Three years ago she created a feminine-wisdom based business program in an effort to bring these healing arts to other professionals so they can create and grow sustainable and abundant coaching careers while they change the world.. Cathleene believes these Integral Healing Arts are the healing modalities of the New Earth. Cathleene spends her time traveling, learning and teaching Awaken As Love, Tantric Healing Arts Practitioner Trainings and her business program Standing in the Fire. She has been a featured teacher and author on Playboy.com and mytinysecrets.com for her groundbreaking work in pleasure and healing with full body orgasm. Find her at www.bliss-life.com and receive your free copy of The Erotic Anatomy Guidebook for Women. Monique Darling - https://www.everydaytantra.com Monique Darling, author of Beyond Cuddle Party and workshop facilitator extraordinaire has led over 2000 workshops in the past decade. She is the founder of Everyday Tantra, an organization dedicated to empowering people who are questioning the assumptions of how their life should be and to offering tools for self expression that create trust, inner knowing and wisdom to enjoy the life they have. Monique has taught at colleges across the US including Yale. She has been featured on TLC and The Doctors as well as various radio shows, podcasts and magazines across the globe. She specializes in helping others reclaim their power and natural sensuality by transmuting fear and repression into courage, self-love and freedom. Her primary purpose is helping folks bring out their vulnerability, energetic embodiment and fearless relating. YOU, you are the gift! Peter Petersen has been teaching for 22 years and has been a certified Sheng Zhen Qigong teacher for the last 20 years, where he has been teaching in health clubs, hospitals, retirement villas, and several different wellness/spa resorts in Mexico and the United States, such as Rancho La Puerta, Mayacamas Ranch, and Present Moment Retreat. Peter has traveled with Monique for over the last 3 years teaching Tantra all over North America, the EU, Asia, and Australia. Peter is also a personal wellness coach. This Qigong practice helps people ground themselves into their now to increase their present moment awareness of their behaviors, and find solutions to problematic habits such as: eating, moving, negative thinking, and sleeping. The result of this tool box of healthy information is that clients become their own health advocate and regain a sense of stability, peace, and well-being into their everyday lives.

989026714527.summary: 22+ Powerful Women in Red cordially invite you to celebrate with us at the 60th Anniversary Inkewell Luncheon and Legacy Week. We are a coalition of African American women who represent energy, passion, strength, courage, and creativity. Our mission is to uplift and empower African American women in diverse fields, including politics, education, business, and the arts. Legacy Week, held at "The Inkwell" in Marthas Vineyard, MA, is a long-standing tradition that celebrates the rich heritage and community spirit of Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs). More than just a celebration, it is a mission to engage, empower, and honor the unique bond and significance of HBCUs. This year, we are excited to bring this vibrant celebration to the historic landmark of "The Inkwell" in Santa Monica, CA, on Friday, November 15, 2024. This site, a cherished haven for Black families from 1905 to 1964, remains a poignant symbol of both celebration and struggle. We extend a special invitation for you to connect as a sponsor with a vibrant community of fellow HBCU alumni, Divine Nine members, organization supporters, and the forgotten Black families of Santa Monica. This is a unique opportunity to unite with purpose and strategically sustain the legacies of our esteemed HBCU institutions while fostering a sense of inclusivity and community. Proceeds from this event will support HBCU initiatives. Contact Event Coordinator: Carliss R. McGhee at Misscarli@cs.com or (310) 930-8986
989026714527.description: Join us for the 60th Anniversary Inkwell Luncheon Legacy Week as we honor Dr. La Doris McClaney and Ms. Robbie Jones.
989026714527.title: Celebrating the 60th Anniversary of the Inkwell Beach

974265703947.summary: PLEASE NOTE: once you buy your ticket, you will receive a welcome email giving you all the information you need to know to attend the event like the address and what you need to bring. If you feel like you have not received it please check your spam or junk folder first, before contacting us about where the event address is, thank you!We attach the word sacred to any practice, experience, or way-of-being that slows us down and deepens our experience of being alive. Our sensuality is a manifestation and expression-of our vital life-force and creative energy. It can play, move, and be shared and enjoyed in many ways.Come with your desire to unmask the secrets of your heart. Come ready to release those energies that hold you back from manifesting love.Come explore ways to experience more joy fully in your life. We will start the night with Latihan (a movement meditation for moving in the unknown)First let's talk a little but about how NOT moving in the unknown is one of the most costly, invisible limitations that sabotage our lives. Learning to move in the unknown is the OPPOSITE of being controlling. Its the opposite of needing to be Right. Practicing moving in the unknown is the medicine for holding your body in knots and tension in your abdomen, anxiety in your chest, and clenching in your root.Have you ever experienced any of those things? Latihan is the practice of surrender in the most pleasurable way. It can be a daily, weekly or monthly practice by your divine self or with a partner.After Latihan...let us lead you through a welcome circle where a room of strangers slowly opens up and winds up on the same page, having the opportunity to be seen, heard, and understood in ways maybe you have never even imagined! What does temple party mean?In short, it is whatever it means to you. We attach the word sacred to any practice, experience, or way-of-being that slows us down and deepens our experience of being alive.Our sensuality/sxxuality are a manifestation and expression-of our vital life-force and creative energy. It can play, move, and be shared and enjoyed in many ways. You are invited to co-create whatever feeds your soul.Participation with a capital P can mean many things and voyeurs are as warmly welcomed as the most actively engaged. Its a sensual space where participants are encouraged to explore themselves and others in ways that are stimulating, nurturing, exciting, safe and FUN!This is the party you want to come to if youve never been AND this is the party you want to come to if you want to experience how to take generating safe play space for you and your loved ones to the next level. WHO SHOULD ATTEND You are sensually and emotionally savvy enough to play nicely with others. Youre a good sharer, you take good care of your toys and you use your words. You are somebody who knows your own wants and boundaries and can communicate them clearly and/or youre someone willing to work and explore these areas for your own growth and enjoyment! You treat yourself and others with respect and kindness.If youre reading this, thinking, I would love to come, but I dont want to play, PLEASE COME and enjoy the pressure-free company of like-minded individuals and exit whenever you wish. Really. There will be no pressure for you to do ANY activity at this party at any time.My biggest request is that you come with a fun-loving, warm, caring, open-minded, generous, thoughtful, compassionate, non-judgmental attitude and that you conduct yourself with the highest level of integrity possible.This will be a very chill, fun, playful event. Come relax. Come smooch. Come play. Come watch. All genders, bodies, and orientations welcome. Come as you are and have a great time!We especially welcome trans, intersex, queer and other folks living anywhere within the spectrum we recognize how hetero-normative spaces can be and aim to challenge this through our conversations and actions TIME Doors open at 7:00 PM and CLOSE AT 8:00 PM. BE ON TIME as it is essential to have everyone present for the opening circle. There will not be anyone admitted after the doors are closed to preserve the safety of our space. The Welcome Circle is what we use to introduce ourselves to one another, craft meaningful conversations, share any boundaries and relationship agreements people should know about and get all comfy and ready to play. There will be a closing circle at midnight. PLEASE text Monique at 619 601 8852 if youre unavoidably running late, but please just be on time!WHAT TO BRING Whatever food and drink you might want for the evening. No drugs or alcohol please. We like our attendees to be present and capable of connection. Bring whatever clothing youd like to don and lounge in while we frolic or just throw on your regular weekend clothes for relaxation. Bring along whatever toys or accessories you feel comfortable sharing with select individuals and whatever protection makes you feel safe, whatever you might be needing to create that perfect evening. Oh, and of course, please bring a Playful attitude and an open heart and mind. COST: Love Exchange is $99 for male identified $69 for female identified or nonbinary or $150 for pairs We have a few sliding scale and scholarship tickets for some savvy female identified folk, just contact Monique or Peter. Please RSVP Here:If you would prefer to use Paypal or Venmo, just contact us and you can pay us directly. Thank you.PLEASE NOTE: once you buy your ticket, you will receive a welcome email giving you all the information you need to know to attend the event like the address and what you need to bring. If you feel like you have not received it please check your spam or junk folder first before contacting us about where the event address is, thank you!

One thing Ive learned is that some of our best healing happens in COMMUNITY. And for this reason I have a passion for getting people together to connect on their healing journeys. Its a risk, I know. 882299219717.summary: Women of Color Los Angeles - Women Over Dinner **We apologize that the event date has been shifted, our dinners in NYC have been popping off and needing more attention there. We're wanting to bring the same energy to LA as soon as possible ** Come join us at Women of Color Los Angeles - Women Over Dinner. Our first in a series of quarterly dinners. We want to live in a world where the Inherent Power of Woman is remembered and expressed. The expressions will of course be as diverse as we are. Women Over Dinner is an invitation to gather and ask ourselves questions like: What does it mean, in present time, to be a woman? What if girls were taught from an early age, whether or not they ever choose to have a child, that they are born into nobility, a lineage that has the power to carry life and birth humans the lineage of Woman? Especially the nobility of women of color. Then, might we ask, is equality even our goal, or is it something else? Something deeper, something more than a reaction to what has been, but a creation of what is true? Women Over Dinner offers an insightful, just-edgy-enough guide to topics ripe for exploration: power, sexuality, and how both affect everything we see and experience in the world. And in this dinner in particular, the power, the sensuality of women of color, the conversations perhaps that are harder to have in mixed company. The dinner table, in its sacred simplicity, holds us. We invite you to gather friends, family, community, around a meal and have a personal and intimate conversation. Not the kind of conversation that goes sideways when cookie cutter political opinions tempt us towards divisiveness. Instead, a place to just share what you think, have experienced, and maybe most importantly, what you feel, as you break bread and listen. We have no doubt that what ripples out of these conversations can change the world. We are a nonprofit run on donations and the intention of every meal is that all women are welcome. Only give what you can. Any extra goes to another womans ticket and all proceeds go directly to the events we host. We are so excited to spend the evening with you. (Suggested donation is $50) Due to the intimate nature of the topics we explore, this event is for adults. You must be 18+. We check IDs at the door and require each guest sign a waiver prior to entering the event. This is a substance-free and alcohol-free event.
882299219717.description: Come join us at Women of Color Los Angeles - Women Over Dinner. Our first in a series of quarterly dinners
882299219717.title: Women of Color Los Angeles - Women Over Dinner

1038493340537.summary: Letting go, or the release, of a restricted way of being is essential to being filled back up. That emptying out process is a surrender. Surrender can a negative connotation, the feeling that we have lost. But in this case it allows us to let go of the way things have been and embrace newness as it appears in each moment. We are able to find a new range of motion with new possibilities and space for our blissful nature to flourish. In this very special New Years Day Celebration we will cleanse the entire chakra system utilizing yoga asana (Vinyasa flowing form), pranayama (restriction of life-force in order to set it free), dhyana (meditation technology) and kirtan (ancient musical cleansing techniques). Plan to leave the practice cleansed and inspired, with take-home practices to jumpstart your yoga practice for 2025! Tickets for this workshop are $45. (Email events@mygreenyogi.com to offer a sliding scale rate of $35 for those in more need or $55 for those who can sponsor another yogi!) ***We offer student, educator, elder and BIPOC discounts! Reach out to events@mygreenyogi.com for more info. Cancellation Policy Registrations for workshops and events can be canceled and refunded up to 48 hours ahead of time or applied to future instances of the same event, where applicable. Workshops and events are non-refundable within 48 hours prior. Special exceptions may be made by calling the studio (510-306-4466) or emailing events@mygreenyogi.com. About Vrinda Advanced Certified Jivamukti Yoga Teacher Vrinda Prita (Carly Boland) is passionate about sharing yoga as a life practice. She has had the rare opportunity of living with her teachers, Sharon Gannon and David Life at the Wild Woodstock Jivamukti Forest Sanctuary, immersed in rich direct transmission that is palpable through her heartfelt teaching. Serving as a co-creator on the compassionate path to enlightenment, Vrinda's classes provide a journey for practitioners. Incorporating light on ancient yogic teachings fused with modern application, her classes are known for bringing heartfelt activism, seamless eclectic musicality, chanting, skillful hands-on assists, and a down-to-earth, spiritual yet humor-filled approach to yoga. Her dynamic Vinyasa sequences draw from her integrative dance, somatic and holistic health background. Her Yin classes are poetic and nourishing. Vrinda's aim in every class is for all involved to leave closer to who they truly are, more of a vibrant, kind, centered, and joyful version of themselves. She is eternally grateful to her teachers Radhanath Swami, Padma-ji Sharon Gannon and David Life for their endless mentorship, generosity, teachings, wit, and love.
1038493340537.description: Join Green Yogi's beloved Vrinda Priti for a beautiful and powerful New Year's Day workshop to cleanse the entire chakra system.
1038493340537.title: Purify: A New Year's Reset for Body, Mind & Spirit

1027575174007.summary: On Halloween night, the streets of New Orleans are alive with spirits, celebrations, and masquerades. At a lavish mansion in the French Quarter, a mysterious host invites guests to a grand masquerade ball, blending the eerie traditions of the Day of the Dead with the magic of voodoo. But the evening takes a dark turn when the host is found dead, surrounded by voodoo symbols and cryptic messages. Each guest, dressed in elaborate costumes, harbors secrets, grudges, or past connections to the deceased. As the night unfolds, guests must decipher occult clues, unravel hidden motives, and summon spirits for guidance. Only by solving the puzzles and uncovering the truth can they reveal the killer before the nightand the spiritsclaim another victim. An immersive event, means that everyone is a character and a suspect. A few days after you choose your character and buy a ticket, we will email you a character dossier. This will help you know what is going on, how to dress and how your character relates to the other characters. If you do not want to play a character, then choose a General Admission ticket. DINNER MENU: Green Salad, Choice of one meat entree: Ribs, Baked Paprika Chicken,or Catfish or Cajun Cauliflower Steak (not vegan friendly). Sides are Green Beans Mac n Cheese and Cornbread. DRINKS ARE NOT INCLUDED. Costumes are highly encouraged.

1027575174007.title: Deadly Delights Murder Mystery Dinner

Freshness is in the crisp with a lovely, simplistic salad consisting of young spinach leaves, tart dried cranberries, farm fresh radish, toasty pumpkin seeds and a well-rounded acidity addition with our lemon vinaigrette Mashed potatoes with lemon confit : Carefully selected Yukon golden potatoes are a must for the smoothest and creamiest mashed potatoes, with a hint of zesty lemon to aromatase each bite. Green beans with almond flakes , sun-kissed tomato and toasted sunflower seeds: Enjoy the crunch on a well-balanced favorite, accompanied by the sweetest little Tuscan kissed tomato. 1028552477147.summary: In partnership with L'apro by FAHGA and SFBA. Enjoy an evening filled with: A Selection of Exquisite French Wines Live Music to set the ambiance Gourmet Food Pairings to delight your palate Gather your friends and immerse yourself in the charm of French culture. Its a night you wont want to miss! PERFORMANCES 6.30PM Kevin Soucie - Chanteur of French Song With guitar in tow, Kevin Soucie has been singing French and Quebecois songs since his university days in Montreal. What began as a hobby, has developed into a passion for the French chanson. Soucie, a native of Milwaukee, has used his craft to entertain and inspire French language students by performing at numerous schools and colleges, including the Wisconsin system universities in Madison, Milwaukee, and Green Bay. He has also performed at Lawrence University, Samford University, College of Charleston, Scranton University and the University of Minnesota-Morris. Touring the country, Kevin Soucie has delighted francophile audiences for the Alliance Francaise organizations in Milwaukee, Chicago (North Shore), Des Moines, Detroit, Pittsburgh, Birmingham, Naples, Albuquerque, Tucson and Phoenix. He is also an annual performer at the popular Bastille Days festival in Milwaukee and is a frequent guest performer on AF of Milwaukees Rive Gauche weekly radio show.With guitar in tow, Kevin Soucie has been singing French and Quebecois songs since his university days in Montreal. What began as a hobby, has developed into a passion for the French chanson. Soucie, a native of Milwaukee, has used his craft to entertain and inspire French language students by performing at numerous schools and colleges, including the Wisconsin system universities in Madison, Milwaukee, and Green Bay. He has also performed at Lawrence University, Samford University, College of Charleston, Scranton University and the University of Minnesota-Morris. Touring the country, Kevin Soucie has delighted francophile audiences for the Alliance Francaise organizations in Milwaukee, Chicago (North Shore), Des Moines, Detroit, Pittsburgh, Birmingham, Naples, Albuquerque, Tucson and Phoenix. He is also an annual performer at the popular Bastille Days festival in Milwaukee and is a frequent guest performer on AF of Milwaukees Rive Gauche weekly radio show. 8.15PM Charles Unger Experience - Jazz Live Band A major force in the music scene of the San Francisco Bay area for the last 40 years, saxophonist Charles Unger is a musical institution. He is known for his exuberant style and talent, and for a stage show that is unforgettable. A regular performer at various San Francisco clubs, Charles is an innovator in the genres of Jazz, R&B and World Beat. Charles, who plays alto, tenor and soprano saxophones, was deeply influenced by the seminal works of artists such as Coleman Hawkins, John Coltrane, Charlie Parker, Dizzy Gillespie, Miles Davis, Grover Washington, Kenny Garrett and Lester Young, but has also drawn on a lifetime of experience playing with top level musicians the world over. Charles brings an undeniable sense of joy to his performances, with a smile that welcomes even the most recalcitrant listeners to the party, then proceeds to open up avenues of music that are enjoyable for the uninitiated and the aficionado alike. Charles Unger is a great player who loves what he is doing. Music for him is a spiritual mission and a quest for a kind of secular redemption that he has pursued since he was a child one that sustains him and has brought him a wealth of knowledge and experience. With your ticket, you'll receive two glasses of wine and a delectable plate of artisanal cheeses and charcuterie + a nice plate of desserts WHERE? Alliance Franaise de San Francisco, 1345 Bush Street, San Francisco, CA 94109 LIMITED SPOTS AVAILABLE! We look forward to sharing this delightful experience with you! Sant! 1020504816377.summary: FALL COLORS A DINNER BY CHEF SCOTT WINEGARD AT TIMELESS PRESENTED BY LAND AND SEA SATURDAY NOVEMBER 2nd. Timeless. Oakland California. LAND AND SEA & TIMELESS welcomes long time friend and Chef, Scott Winegard back to Oakland for our second collaboration- FALL COLORS. Scott will bring his years of cooking beautiful and delicious plant based menus to Oakland for this one night only event at Timeless. We will prepare a five-course plated and family style menu sourcing produce from our bountiful farms of California. Chloe Miller will be with us to pair natural wine sourced and produced with care. Joshua Wismans from The Crown is making a special Kombucha. Expect both communal and table seating. Maria Otero and Christopher Robin Duncan of LAND AND SEA are handbuilding ceramic plates for the dinner. As a gesture of gratitude for joining us, and to commemorate the occasion - guests will be given their plates to take with them as the night ends. ABOUT SCOTT WINEGARD: Scott Winegard is a maestro of flavor, seamlessly blending his passions for plant-based cuisine and culinary innovation into a symphony for the senses. Hailing from Long Island, NY, Scott's journey into the culinary world began unexpectedly, as he immersed himself in the punk rock and skateboarding scene of his youth. However, it was his serendipitous encounter with Angelica Kitchen, a local macrobiotic restaurant, that ignited his culinary flame. Under the mentorship of Leslie, the restaurant's owner, Scott honed his craft, learning the art of thoughtful, seasonal cooking sourced from local farms. His culinary prowess blossomed during his tenure at Angelica Kitchen, spanning nearly a decade, where he cultivated a deep-rooted commitment to fresh, vibrant cuisine. In the early 2000s, Scott delved into the pop-up dining scene, spearheading the exclusive and successful Brooklyn-based dinner club, Nasturtium. Simultaneously, he served as a private chef for esteemed clients in media, television, and fashion, further refining his culinary repertoire and forging lasting relationships. Scott's culinary journey took him across the globe, where he served as Executive Chef and Culinary Creative Director alongside Chef Matthew Kenney, a pioneering force in plant-based cuisine. Together, they collaborated on numerous projects, including the development and launch of over 25 restaurants, as well as co-authoring acclaimed cookbooks such as "Plant Food" and "Plant Lab." In 2018, Scott embarked on a new chapter, assuming the role of Culinary Director, Executive Chef, and partner at a small restaurant in Portland, Oregon, where he championed his vision of seasonal, plant-based cuisine. Despite initial success, the challenges posed by the Covid-19 pandemic prompted a pivot, leading Scott to part ways and seek solace in the sun-drenched landscapes of Carefree, Arizona. At Civana, a boutique wellness resort, Scott reignited his culinary passion, spearheading the reopening of food outlets and collaborating with Deepak Chopra's team on the Chopra Whole Health Retreat. However, the allure of Los Angeles beckoned, drawing Scott back into the fold of Matthew Kenney's culinary empire, where he lent his expertise to various high-profile projects and events. Now, in 2024, Scott finds himself returning to his roots in Brooklyn, poised to share his culinary wizardry through a myriad of private and public cooking events, consultations, and cooking classes. His illustrious career has been punctuated by accolades, from hosting a sold-out dinner at the James Beard House to being named Best Vegetable Restaurant in the US by We're Smart Green Guide. In addition to his culinary pursuits, Scott is eager to reignite his passion for music, embarking on long-talked-about music projects that have been simmering on the back burner. The harmonious blend of his culinary and musical talents promises to captivate audiences and enrich communities in new and exciting ways. Furthermore, Scott is thrilled to announce his collaboration with LAND AND SEA, an artist collective based in Oakland, California. Together, they will curate seasonal dinners that celebrate the bounty of the land, showcasing Scott's innovative approach to plant-based cuisine in conjunction with LAND AND SEA's incredible artist community. These collaborative dinners promise to be a feast for the senses, embodying the spirit of creativity, community, and culinary innovation. https://scottwinegard.com ABOUT CHLOE MILLER: Chloe Miller has been in the bar and restaurant industry for over a decade. She has curated several wine and cocktail menus with an emphasis on sustainability and accessibility within the community. ABOUT JOSHUA WISMANS: The Crowns Fermentation Lab is an adventurous side project of Joshua Wismans. Sparked by the allure of culinary fermentation and some excess equipment, what started as a fun experiment has turned into a full kombucha program fueled by seasonality and quality ingredients. ABOUT TIMELESS: As the only 100% plant-based coffee roastery and bakery since 2012, the Timeless mission has been to share the company's passion for great coffee and to expose customers to the positive benefits of being and eating vegan. Timeless products are all made in-house daily. Subculture, community, social awareness, and a general interest in being and doing better make up the rich fabric of the Timeless employees and customers alike. The company acts as a good steward not only in the coffee and food industry but for animals, people, and the planet. https://timelesscoffee.com ABOUT LAND AND SEA: LAND AND SEA is an independent publisher/record label and occasional project space based in Oakland California run by Maria Otero and Christopher Robin Duncan. For over a decade, LAND AND SEA has hosted shows, published books, records, tapes and zines that share, shed light and support images, sounds and ideas from a wide variety of artists. LAND AND SEA embodies lessons learned from an early education perpetuated by show flyers, music made in basements and VFW halls, stolen kinkos cards, photocopied zines, 12th generation mixed-tapes and 7" records that intended to change the world. LAND AND SEA hope to amplify generally unheard and unseen efforts, adding to an ever-expansive, tactile, shared culture of print and sound ( and now dinners). LISTEN TO LYNC

1044063771847.summary: The 16th edition of the Founders Forum for Sustainability is just around the corner! Are you the founder of a sustainable start-up? Then be part of this edition! StartHub Hessen and TechQuartier invite you to a joint virtual exchange with other founders of sustainable and green start-ups in Hessen and the Rhine-Main region. This time, everything revolves around the topic of green transformation. This time the Keynote will be held by Karsten Hirsch, founder of Plastic Fischer . Karsten studied law in Cologne and, after graduating, founded Plastic Fischer - the world's first company to stop ocean plastic from entering rivers in order to protect marine biodiversity. Together with his team, he turned a rough idea into a company that has received awards from the World Economic Forum and the German Sustainability Award, among others. The event starts at 17:00 and is intended exclusively for startup founders with a sustainable business model. The event is also part of TechQuartier's TQ Accelerator: Green Transformation. 947662733747.summary: Rethink Circularity: European Circular Economy Summit 2024 Date: December 5-6, 2024 Place: Frankfurt, Germany Organizer: ECV International Official Website: https://www.ecv-events.com/EuropeanCircularEconomy/index.php?cci=17 Background In the era of net-zero and digitalization, it is necessary to rethink the circular economy. Defined by the European Commission as "where the value of products, materials and resources is maintained in the economy for as long as possible, and the generation of waste is minimized," the circular economy aims to decouple economic growth from resource consumption. To achieve more sustainable development models and meet the 2050 Net-zero target, the EU launched a new Circular Economy Action Plan in 2020. The benefits of the circular economy extend beyond achieving climate goals and reducing resource consumption, it also enhances business profitability, creates new commercial opportunities, and improves supply chain resilience. The development of digital technologies provides essential support for achieving cradle-to-cradle cycles in the circular economy. Transforming the European economy into one that is cleaner and more competitive requires collaborative efforts across industries. This transformation must involve comprehensive and systematic changes, integrating ecological principles into design stages to minimize resource consumption and waste generation. It necessitates coordinated cooperation throughout the entire value chain. The summit aims to facilitate communication and learning among different industries and stakeholders in key areas crucial for advancing the circular economy. Participants will share new insights into achieving circular economy goals, strategies, and proven effective actions. It also serves as a high-quality platform for participants across the value chain to strengthen cooperation, exchange ideas, and explore new business opportunities. We Will Unite Thought Leaders, Policymakers And Innovators From Leading Global Companies To Discuss Hot Topics : Action on New Circular Economy Perspective from European Policies and Regulations . Unlock the Value of Circularity by Establishing Circular Business Models to Drive Economic Growth and Environmental Benefit . How to Deploy Strategies and Take Actions to Realize Automotive Industrys Circularity Transition . A Holistic Approach to Decouple Growth from Finite Resource Consumption across the Entire Value Chain . Redefine Products How Design Driving the Future of Circularity . Circular Packaging - Reduce Resource Consumption from the Design Stage and Improve the Safety and Recyclability of Materials . Panel Discussion: Challenges and Methods to Realize European Circular Economy Transition . Establish a Management System to Guide the Road towards Circular Economy and Waste Management . Navigating a Path to Leverage Circular Potential of Steel Industry . Extracting and Recycling Rare Earth Permanent Magnets to Promote more Resilient Supply Chain . From Linear to Circular Embracing the Future of Circular Economy Transition . Developing Battery Closed Loop Recycling to Decrease EV Carbon Emissions throughout the Life Cycle .
